loans.name: Sonia Hortencia

texts.es:
Sonia realized early on that starting a retail business would give her a good opportunity to increase her revenues since she saw that others in her community made a good living this way. Eight years ago she began selling clothes at retail. With a lot of hard work she began saving enough money to restock her merchandise. She is well known in her neighborhood for the quality of her apparel and the clients keep coming back.

However she is struggling to support her two young children, and she needs a loan of $475 to purchase stock since the money she had set aside for her business has been used for her family. Sonia is ready to return the loan in 6 months and with your help she will be able to pull through with both her business and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Stock purchase

loans.name: Kith

texts.en:
Mrs. Kith E., 41, is married with four children and works as a tailor, earning around US$ 3.50 each day in revenue. Her husband is self-employed as a construction foreman and generally earns about US$ 3.50/day in income. One of her children is employed by a private company and the rest of them are enrolled in school.

Mrs. Kith E. has requested a loan to dig a well in order to grow cucumbers and a variety of vegetables. With the new water system, they will be able to generate more income for the family and raise their standard of living. Mrs. Kith E. plans to use any remainder of the money to purchase more construction tools for her husband in order to to facilitate his business.

loans.use: To dig well that will allow them to grow cucumbers and a variety of other crops

loans.name: Chit

texts.en:
Mrs. Chit K. H., 32, is the mother of four children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She cooks a variety of Khmer foods, selling them to the people at a market, and typically earns about US$ 7/day in revenue. Her husband works as a barber on a roadside in his community, making on average US$ 2/day in profit. Two of their children are employed by a private company and other two are enrolled in school.

Mrs. Chit K. H. hopes to use this loan to build a little shelter to be used as a barbershop for her husband. The remainder of the loan is to buy a motorcycle to use for her family’s transportation. (Her husband is pictured here because Mrs. Chit K. H. was unavailable.)

loans.use: To build a barbershop for her husband's business and buy a motorcycle to use for her family’s transportation

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Shahnaz B. is married to Muhammad Waris. She is a resident of Lahore and a mother of eight children. Shahnaz currently needs a loan of US$350 to purchase both old and new shoes for sale in a shoes store which her husband operates in an old and used items market. Shahnaz and her husband's business is very small, and they need to expand it to increase their income.

loans.use: Purchase of old and new shoes for sale in a store

loans.name: Majeedan

texts.en: Majeedan B. is a mother of four and lives with her family in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. She is an artist and makes jewellery on order. Her husband owns a fruit cart and earns money selling fruit. Majeedan would be very thankful for a loan of US$250 to help her husband expand his fruit sales business.

loans.use: Expansion of a fruit sales business

loans.name: Thi Hanh

texts.vi:
Mrs.Hanh, 25 years old, lives in N. Xa village, Bac Ninh. She is married and does business on wasted materials with her husband’s family. Every day, she buys wasted materials such as used plastic or metal goods from scrap-iron dealers. Her family has been doing this activity for 5 years and the income is very stable. This is also the main income of her family. Knowing about the Binhminh microeconomic program, she enthusiastically joins to borrow money to assist her daily business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Hạnh 25 tuổi sống ở thôn Nghiêm Xá, Bắc Ninh. Chj lấy chồng và làm nghề cùng gia đình chồng là buôn bán phế liệu. Hàng ngày chị mua lại các thứ phế liệu như đồ nhựa cũ, kim loại từ những người thu mua đồng nát nhỏ lẻ. Công việc này gia đình chị đã làm được 5 năm và rất ổn định. Đây cũng là công việc tạo thu nhập chính cho gia đình. Được biết có chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh, chị đã hăng hái tham gia để có thêm vốn hỗ trợ cho công việc kinh doanh hàng ngày của chị.

loans.use: To assist in business

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en: Fozia B. is married to Mazhar Hussain. She is a mother of two children, both of whom attend a local school. All of her family resides in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. Fozia's husband runs a general store in a nearby market. The couple wishes to increase their family's income and are therefore planning to expand the store. They are asking for a loan of US$350 for this purpose.

loans.use: Expansion of a general store

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.en:
Tajiboeva Gavhar is a 53-year old lady. Gavhar and her husband, who is a driver, have been married for almost 30 years and raised three wonderful children. Two of them are already married and have the children of their own who adore their grandparents. 
Gavhar has been running her own small business for 25 years already. She has a store selling shampoos, detergents, toothpaste and brushes and other items. Her youngest daughter helps her in the store registering the stock and serving the clients. Gavhar and her daughter are very friendly and polite which allows them to attract the clientele. 
Now she is requesting 1000 US dollars. Gavhar is planning to spend the loan for purchasing more goods for selling, thus increasing the range of the products. Gavhar promises to pay her loan in 12 months and thanks everybody who decided to support her.

loans.use: Purchasing of additional home products in order to sell them and increase the  range of goods

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: Rukhsana A. lives in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. She is a mother of three, two of whom study at a local school, while the youngest one is not of schooling age yet. Rukhsana wishes that her children are able to complete their education and find good employment for themselves. Rukhsana's husband runs a printing press. His business is going well, but he would like to expand it further. Therefore, the couple is asking for a loan of US$175.

loans.use: Expansion of a printing business

loans.name: Thi Dung

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dung, 20 years old, is married and has one children. Her family is living in Nghiem Xa village, Bac Ninh, where business on wasted materials is every common. This activity is very stable and the income is enough for her family basic living cost. Every day, she buys used books, newspapers, waste-paper, and plastic or metal goods from the retailers and then sells them to the recycling plants. She hopes to borrow money to assist her activities in business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Dung 20 tuổi đã lập gia đình và có 1 con nhỏ. Gia đình chị sống ở thôn Nghiêm Xá, Bắc Ninh là nơi có nghề thu mua phế liệu. Công việc này rất ổn định và thu nhập kiếm được đủ để trang trải các khoản chi tiêu cơ bản của gia đình. Hàng ngày chị mua lại các loại sách, báo, giấy vụn cũng như là các hộp nhựa hay đồ kim loại cũ từ những người bán lẻ và sau đó bán buôn lại cho các cơ sở chế biến đồ tái sử dụng. Chị hy vọng có thêm vốn để hỗ trợ cho các hoạt động trong công việc kinh doanh của chị.

loans.use: To assist in business

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.en:
A. Mavzuna is 28. Her elder son is 8 and already goes to school, and the daughter is only 4. Mavzuna is selling make-up and cosmetics. Her husband has another trading place in a different market. He also sells make-up for women. Mavzuna has been in the business for two years already. 
Mavzuna is dreaming of expanding her business and opening her own store and establishing contacts with the suppliers of well-known producers. Mavzuna and her husband are working hard in order to have sufficient funds for educating their kids so that they become experts in future. 
Now Mavzuna requests 990.00 US Dollars in order to purchase new cosmetics, such as lipsticks, mascaras, powder, cream for skin, etc. with the purpose of enlarging her range of goods. This is her first loan; however, she is quite sure that she is able to pay it in a timely manner. Mavzuna would like to thank everybody for supporting her and promises to pay the loan in 12 months.

loans.use: Purchasing the goods for selling and increasing the stock

loans.name: Thi Lien

texts.vi:
Mrs.Lien, 24 years old, is married and has one son. Her family has been doing business on music CDs for a long time. Therefore, she is very experienced in getting to know customers’ taste and collecting products from various sources. Her husband is a driver and his income is also a constant contribution to the family’s income. She hopes to borrow money to buy more CDs to sell and to upgrade her CD-tryout-station.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Liên 24 tuổi, chị đã lập gia đình và có 1 con trai.Nhà chị kinh doanh đĩa nhạc từ rất lâu vì vậy chị có khá nhiều kinh nghiệm trong việc nắm bắt được thị hiếu của khách hàng hay có những nguồn hàng tốt để chị nhập về bán. Chồng chị làm nghề lái xe và cũng là nguồn thu nhập ổn định của gia đình. Chị hy vọng vay vốn để mua thêm đĩa về bán và đầu tư nâng cấp dàn máy nghe nhạc của chị.

loans.use: To  purchase more discs

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en: My name is Shahida B. and I live in Lahore, Pakistan. I have six children, all of whom study at a local school. My husband manufactures water pumps and he is in the process of expanding his business. To continue with this expansion he needs a loan of $250.

loans.use: To expand the family water-pump manufacturing business

loans.name: Zahara

texts.en: My name is Zahara B. and I live with my family in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. I am married with six children: four girls and two boys. My husband lives abroad and one of my sons runs a kiosk and sells various items such as candy, pulses, oils and other sundries. I would like to request a loan of $175 for my son to expand his kiosk.

loans.use: To expand the family kiosk business

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: My name is Rukhsana B.. I have six children: four of whom attend a local school; the other two are not old enough to attend school yet. My husband, Muhammad Mushtaq, manufactures shoes on daily wages. We are unable to make both the ends meet on his small income. Therefore, my husband has decided to start his own shoe business and for this he requires a loan of $250 to buy the necessary raw materials.

loans.use: To start a shoe business

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: My name is Shazia R. and I'm from Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. I am married with six children, four of whom attend a local school; two are not old enough to attend school yet. My husband owns and runs a small restaurant. Currently he needs to buy a variety of items to stock in the restaurant and would like a loan of $175.

loans.use: To buy items for the resturant

loans.name: Sharofiddin

texts.ru:
Sharofuddin G., who is 30, is married and has 2 children. He has his own dealership center in the town of Qurgan-Tube. He is in the business of selling sim and prepaid cards from mobile phones. Using the funds from the loan, he plans to purchase a large amount of sim and prepaid cards. Currently, these products are very popular among population of the city because many people use this method of communication. This loan will give the people of Qurgan-Tube and those who visit the town an opportunity to purchase these cards at lower prices, as Sharofuddin had contracts directly with operators of mobile connections. He plans to pay off the credit in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Гафуров Шарофиддин, возраст 30 лет, образование среднее, семейное положение – женат, имеет 2 детей. Гафуров Шарофиддин имеет диллерский центр в городе Курган-Тюбе. Он занимается продажей сим-карт и препэйд-карт для мобильнхых телефонов. На полученный кредит он планирует приобрести большое количество сим – карт и препэйд – карт для мобильных телефонов. Данный товар в настоящее время пользуется большим спросом среди населения, так как очень много пользователей мобильной связи. Этот кредит даст возможность населению Курган-Тюбе и людей приезжающих в этот город, приобретать эти карты по более низким ценам, так как Шарофидин имеет прямые договора с операторами мобильной связи на их приобретение. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of sim cards and prepaid cards for cell phones

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: My name is Azra B. and I am a widow with four children: three sons and one daughter. One of my sons is a turner and possesses his own lathe. His business is our major source of income. He would like a loan of $175 to expand his business. I will save the profits to help my children marry. I currently supplement our household income by selling cloth and crockery from my home.

loans.use: To expand her family's business

loans.name: Sharif

texts.ru:
Sharif G. is 44 years old, finished high school, married, has five children. Sharif lives in the village Obi-Keek, in the Hurossonskiy district and in the last 10 years has been raising and fattening cattle for sale. Until now he never took out a loan, since he didn't think anyone would loan him money. Sharif is planning to use the loan money to buy more cattle for fattening and sale. Every 40-45 days he will sell the bulls and use the money to pay back the loan, purchase the calves and family needs. With time he is hoping to save enough money and use it to expand his business. The client is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Гаффуров Шариф, возраст – 44 года, образование среднее, женат, имеет 5-х детей. Шариф, житель кишлака Оби-Киик, Хуроссонского района в течение уже 10 лет занимается разведением и продажей домашнего скота. До этого никогда не получал кредитов, так как не верил, что ему могут дать деньги в кредит. Поэтому Шариф планирует на полученные денежные средства прироберсти крупный рогатый скот для откормки и продажи. Через каждые 40-45 дней он хочет продавать скот и вырученные деньги направлять на погашение кредита, приобретение молодняка, а прибыль использовать для личных нужд. Со временем он хочет скопить свой собственный капитал и использовать его на расшиерение своего бизнеса. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: purchase of cattle for fattening and sale

loans.name: Nizoramoh

texts.ru:
Nizoramoh N. is 48 years old, has completed high school education, is married and has three children. Her main occupation is raising and fattening of cattle. She has 15 years of experience with raising cattle. Mrs N. is planning to use this loan to purchase several young calves for fattening and sale. She will sell them every 40-45 days. The money earned form the sales will be used to purchase more animals, and the left overs will be used to support the family. The client is planning to return the loan within the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Носирова Низорамох, возраст – 48 лет, образование среднее, замужем, имеет 3-х детей. Основным видом деятельности, которым занимается Низорамох это купля, откорм и продажа крупного рогатого скота. Она имеет 15-ти летний опыт в разведение домашнего скота. На полученный кредит она планирует приобрести несколько молодых бычков для откормки и продажи. Она будет их продавать через каждые 40-45 дней. Вырученные деньги она будет использовать на приобретение молодняка, а оставшуюся часть денежной суммы будет использовать на содержание семьи. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: purchase of cattle and feed for fattening

loans.name: Farasta

texts.en: My name is Farasta B. and I'm from Lahore, a large metropolis in Pakistan. I am a widow with three children, all of whom are married. I live in a joint family with my sons and their wives. One of my sons is a tailor. He needs to buy a few sewing machines for his shop and would like a loan of $175. With this loan, he hopes to establish a more successful business.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines

loans.name: Alimahmad

texts.ru:
Alimahmad I. is 46 years old, has completed high school, is married, has five children. Alimahmad is planning to use his loan to buy cattle and feed for fattening. Mr. I. has been doing this type of activity for the last 13 years. After completing fattening he will sell the cattle every 40-45 days and use the money he makes from sales to purchase more animals. The main buyers of his cattle are the citizens of the city Kurgan-Tyube and surrounding regions. This type of activity is the main source of income for the family. The client is planning to return the loan within the next 12 month.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Ибрагимов Алимахмад, возраст – 46 лет, образование среднее, женат, имеет 5-х детей. На полученный кредит Алимахмад хочет приобрести крупный рогатый скот и корм для его откорма. Этим видом деятельности он заниается уже в течение 13 лет. После откорма скота через каждые 40-45 он будет продавать их и на вырученные деньги приобретать новый молодняк. Основными его покупателями являются жители города Курган-Тюбе и близлежащих районов. Этот вид деятельности является основным источникам полученя дохода для содержания семьи. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: purchase of calves and feed for fattening of cattle

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Tatyana K., who is 43, has a bachelors degree, is married, and has 2 children. Currently, Tatyana works at a Magnet School #1 in the town of Kurgan-Tube as an elementary school teacher, and her husband temporarily works in Russia. Using the loan, she is planning to purchase a computer for her children. Tatyana wants her children to learn how to work with a computer, since it is such an important part of our everyday life. Once her children with have their own computer, there will no longer be a need to use services of an internet cafe and pay additional fees. Tatyana plans to pay off the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Хайдарова Татьяна, возраст – 43 года, образование высшее, замужем, имеет 2-х детей. Татьяна в настоящее время работает в лицее №1 города Курган-Тюбе, в должности преподователя начальных классов. На полученный кредит она хочет купить персональный компьютер для своих детей. Ее муж в настоящее время находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Татьяна хочет чтобы ее дети научились работать на компьютере, так как сегоденя компютер это неотъемлемая часть во всех сферах нашей жизни. Ее дети получат возможность иметь свой собственный компьютер и не надо будет ходить в интеренет-кафе и платить за пользование компьютером дополнтельную плату. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of a computer for students

loans.name: Umed

texts.ru:
Umed S. is 22 years old, has a high school education and is a bachelor. He will use his loan to purchase young livestock. He will fatten the livestock and resell it every 20-25 days. Umed will use his revenues to purchase new livestock to feed.

This business will help Umed to earn a living as it is currently hard to find a well paying job. He will pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Собиров Умед, возраст 22 года, образование среднее, семейное положение - холост. На полученный кредит он хочет приобрести несколько голов крупного и мелкого рогатого скота. Он будет откармливать скот и продавать через каждые 20-25 дней. На вырученные деньги он будет приобретать новое поголовье мелкого и крупного рогатого скота. Так как в настоящее время трудно найти хорошо оплачиваемую работу, таким образом он будет иметь возможность зарабатывать небольшие денежные средства на содержание своей семьи. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Tanzeela

texts.en: My name is Tanzeela B.. I am married with four children: two of them are finished with their studies and are currently working whereas the other two attend school. My husband operates a secondhand store in the used items market of Lahore. One of my sons also assists him in the business. My son has gained enough experience and now feels that he can open his own shoe store. Please lend us $175 for this purpose.

loans.use: Open an additional shoe store

loans.name: Rolando

texts.pt:
Rolando N., resident of the Bagamoyo neighborhood, is married and the father of four children. He joined the program on March 15th, 2006, borrowing the amount of 3000 meticais. He is now in his fourth loan cycle. He will borrow 3000 meticais, and with this amount, he plans to buy a television.

Translated from Portuguese by Ilse Ackerman, Kiva volunteer.

Rolando N., residente no bairro de Bagamoyo, vive maritalmente Portador do BI nº110074764F, pai de 4 filhos entrou no programa a 15/03/06, tomando o valor de 3000 mt esta no 4º ciclo vai tomar o mesmo valor de 3000 mt com o valor do emprestimo pretende comprar um televisor.

loans.use: purchase of goods

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.ru:
J. Gulnoza has been in the business of selling woolen yarns and socks for 10 years. She is married and has 3 children. The whole family lives together with their mother-in-law. After several unsuccessful attempts to find a stable well paying job, her husband decided to breed sheep, whose wool Gulnoza is selling and using in socks knitting. Her mother-in-law has taught her to do that and now this is their main source of income. Her daughters also knit socks and help their mother. Her husband and son take care of wool processing, cleaning, and drying. This business involves their whole family.

Gulnoza wanted to use the loan from Kiva to purchase a different kind of wool - angorka, so she could mix it when knitting socks. That way, she will be able to raise the prices of her goods and obtain higher earnings. These winter months are the best season for sales of warm wool socks. She really hopes for your support.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Джураева Гулноза занимается продажей пряжи и шерстенных носков на протяжении 10 лет. Она замужем и имеет троих детей, они живут вместе со свекровью. Муж после неудачных поисков постоянной хорошо- оплачиваемой работы решил заняться разведением овец, шерсть которых Гулноза продает, а так же вяжет из них теплые шерстяные носки. Этому научила её свекровь и теперь это их основной источник доходов. Её дочери тоже вяжут носки и помогают маме. Обработку, чистку и сушку шерсти производят муж и сын. Можно отметить, что это их семейный бизнес. В КИВА программе Гулноза захотела участвовать с целью получения займа на покупку другой шерсти- ангорка, для дальнейшего присоединения её при вязании носков. Она сможет, повысит цену на продаваемую продукцию и получит больше прибыли. Эти зимние месяцы сезон продаж теплых шерстяных носков. Она очень надеется на вашу поддержку.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Anorgul

texts.ru:
Anorgul Z. is 42 years old and has a secondary school education. She is married and has four children. Anorgul and her husband produce gravestones for a living. She plans to use her loan to buy more materials for making gravestones, such as marble and granite. This loan will give local residents the opportunity to order custom-made gravestones for their relatives and loved ones. Anorgul plans to repay her loan within a 12-month period.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Зарипова Аноргул, возраст 42 года, образование среднее, замужем, имеет 4-х детей. Аноргул вместе со своим мужем занимается производством надгробнхых плит. На полученный кредит она планирует приобрести материал (мрамор, гранит) для их производства. Полученный кредит даст возможность местным жителям заказывать у них плиты на могилы своих родственников или близких в случае их утраты. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making gravestones

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.ru:
K. Shahodat is married and has 8 children. She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2006. Using the first loan she bought a young bull and sold it 4 months later. Her husband was unemployed, and using her income, she was able to purchase him a ticket to Russia, where he could find a job. She has a large family and only her income previously allowed them to get sufficient amount of food and clothing. Her husband currently makes $200 a month and sends $100 to his family in Tajikistan.

Shahodat used the funds from the last loan to purchase a cow. Now her children drink fresh milk every morning. She wants to receive a new loan to purchase 2 more cows for the purpose of breeding.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Кундузова Шаходат –замужем и имеет 8 детей. Клиент «Микроинвеста» с начало 2006 года. На первый полученный кредит она купила бычка и продала после 4 месяцев откорма. Муж был безработным,на полученный доход она купила билет, и отправила мужа на заработки в Российскую федерацию на заработки. Семья большая и только ее доход позволял им нормально питаться и одеваться. Муж на данный момент зарабатывает около 200$ в месяц и отправляет домой жене и детям по 100$ каждый месяц. На последний полученный кредит клиентка купила корову. Теперь ее дети каждое утро пьют свежее молоко. Она хочет получить новый кредит и купит 2 коровs и получить потомство (телят).

loans.use: Purchase of 2 cows for breeding

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en: My name is Sughran B. and I live with my family in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan.  My husband and I have five children: four sons and one daughter. I make jewelry tassels on daily wages and my husband operates a fruit cart. He would like to expand that business by purchasing a greater variety of fruit and for this he requires a loan of $175. I hope to start my own jewelry tassels business in the future and increase our household income.

loans.use: Buy a greater variety of fruit for resale

loans.name: Churaboy

texts.ru:
Churaboy M. is 58 years old, married, has four children. He has been a client with Microinvest since the beginning of 2005. Sharif has been raising and fattening cattle for sale for more then 15 years. Since nowadays all the farm co-ops have been disbanded, the only farm work that earns a good income for Mr. M. is the fattening of cattle. Mr. M. has used his previous loan from Microinvest to buy calves and after fattening them for 4 month he sold them for double their purchase price. At this time he has more the eight calves on his farm. Mr. M. would like to use this new loan to increase the number of the calves he owns.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Мамарофиев Чурабой , возраст- 58 лет. Женат. Имеет 4-х детей. Клиент МЗФ «Микроинвест» -а с начала 2005 года.Откормом скота занимается более 15 лет. Так как на данное время все колхозы и совхозы расформированы единственным работой приносящий доход клиенту это откорм скота. Клиент на первый полученный доход купил молодняки и после откорма 4-х месяца продал на удвоенную сумму. Так он на данный момент имеет более 8-и молодняков. Клиент хочет получит новый займ и увеличить число молодняков.

loans.use: Purchase of calves for fattening and sale

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: My name is Safia B.. My husband and I live in Lahore, the second largest metropolis in Pakistan. My husband runs a small shoe factory, and I am a seamstress for neighborhood clients. I am expecting a baby and my husband and I want to give our child a sound economic future. Therefore, my husband would like to expand his shoe business with a loan of $250.

loans.use: To expand the shoe business

loans.name: Isabel Manuel

texts.pt:
Isabel Manuel S., resident of the Maxaquene neighborhood, is married with three children. She is entering her third loan cycle. She sells chairs, basins, buckets, and plastic containers. She will borrow 15000 meticais, to pay back in eight months. She sells her goods in the Xiquelene market. With these funds, she will invest in her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Ilse Ackerman, Kiva volunteer.

Isabel Manuel S., residente no bairro da Maxaquene, portadora do BI nº 100176798E, vive maritalmente , tem 3 filhos esta no 3º ciclo vende cadeiras , bacias, baldes, cestos plasticos, vai tomar o valor de 15000 mt para pagar em 8 meses vende no mercado Xiquelene com o valor ela vai investir no negocio.

loans.use: Increase her business

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en: My name is Suriya B. and I'm from Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan.  I am married and a mother of two children: a son and a daughter. My daughter has just completed 14th grade and my son has completed 10th grade. My husband works at a lawyer’s office as an accountant and I sell clothes. I buy clothes from Peshawer, a mountain town which is famous in Pakistan for inexpensive clothes. I would like a loan of $175 to buy  more clothes in bulk for my business.

loans.use: To buy clothes in bulk for resale in her business

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: My name is Nasreen B. and my husband and I have six children. Four of our children are in school while two are grown and have jobs of their own. My husband owns a wagon and uses it to make a living offering local transport services. This wagon is our major source of income, but to continue to use it we must renew the government token which allows us to offer these services. We are seeking a loan of $175 to renew the token.

loans.use: Renew the token which allows us to transport goods in our wagon

loans.name: Nighat

texts.en: My name is Nighat T. and I run a beauty parlor in my house. My husband is a driver and is seeking a loan of $350 to buy his own rickshaw. The one he uses now is old and in very bad shape. We have two children, both of whom study at a local school, and a new rickshaw will allow us to better support our family and keep our children in school.

loans.use: Buy a new rickshaw

loans.name: Felismina Aida

texts.pt:
Felismina Aida C. is married with two children. She lives in Matola. She sells fish and shrimp as a street vendor. She is joining the program and would like to borrow 6000 meticais to pay back in four months. With these funds, she will increase the amount of products.

Translated by Ilse Ackerman, Kiva volunteer.

Felismina Aida C., potadora do BI nº100333510N, Vive maritalmente , tem 2 filhos vive na cidade da Matola, vende peixe camarão e vendedora ambulante, esta a entrar no programa vai tomar o valor de 6000 mt para pagar em 4 meses com o valor voi aumentar os produtos.

loans.use: increase stock

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: My name is Azra A. and I live in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. I am married and the mother of seven children, two girls and five boys. I make a living sewing clothes for the people of my neighborhood, and my husband sells old and used shoes in the local market. My husband needs a loan of $175 to buy shoes in bulk for his shop.

loans.use: Buy old and used shoes in bulk

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: My name is Shamim B. and I am a widow who lives in the large city of Lahore, Pakistan. I have no children and live at my aunt’s house. I make a living selling clothing. I buy materials for my business in Peshawer, a city in my country that is famous for low-priced cloth. I need a loan of $175 to buy cloth in bulk, because the low price will allow me to make clothing that I can sell to support myself.

loans.use: Buy cloth for my clothing-making business

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: My husband is a dealer who buys and sells old, used items, and we need a loan of $350 to expand his business. He intends to use this loan to buy large quantities of scrap items and sell them for a reasonable price that will allow him to support our family. I help him do this by sewing clothes for the people of my neighborhood. My husband and I have seven children, two sons and five daughters.

loans.use: Buy scrap items for my family's business

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 40 years old. He has 3 children who are all in school. After his father's death, he was responsible for supporting his elderly mother. He has a small spare parts shop which is rented. He applied to borrow $1200 to purchase new spare parts. He will also paint the shop and make new shelves to increase his income and save for a better life for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new spare parts

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en: My name is Shabana B. and I live in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. Because my husband has suffered from TB for many years, I am my family's only breadwinner.  I support my husband and my three children, all of whom are in school, by making bags. I need a loan of $350 to expand my business so that I can continue my husband’s treatment and my children's education.

loans.use: Expand a bag-making business

loans.name: Firdos

texts.en: My name is Firdos B.. I am married and the mother of seven children: two girls and five boys. I live with my family in Lahore, a big city in Pakistan. Five of my children study at a local school, while the other two are not yet old enough to enroll. My husband makes furniture for a living, and needs a loan of $350 to buy wood so he can expand his business and better provide for our family.

loans.use: Buy wood to expand a furniture-making business

loans.name: `lim

texts.en:
Mrs. Lim K., 54, is a widow and works selling various kinds of fruits in front of a garment factory, earning around US$ 3/day in revenue. Mrs. Lim K. has four children. Two of them work at a private company; one is enrolled in school, and another one is self-employed as a construction foreman, making around US$ 5 each day.

Recently, Mrs. Lim K. has requested a loan to expand her inventory by purchasing more fruit to meet her customers’ needs. She believes this will help her generate additional family income and raise their standard of living.

loans.use: To expand her inventory by purchasing more fruits to meet her customers’ needs

loans.name: Constância Mário

texts.pt:
Constância Mário C. is married with three children. She lives in the Albazine neighborhood. She joined the program on Nov. 16th, 2006, with a loan of 3000 meticais. She is now in her third loan cycle and will borrow the amount of 5000 meticais, to pay back in five months. She sells her goods in the Xiquelene market. She sells liquor and wines. The funds are to invest in her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Ilse Ackerman, Kiva volunteer.

Constância Mário C., portadora do BI nº 18966591, casada com 3 filhos vive no bairro de albazine entrou no programa a 16/11/06 tomando o emprestimo de 3000 mt agora esta no 3º ciclo vai tomar o valor de 5000 mt para pagar em 5 meses vende no mercado Xiquelene vende Bebidas secas e vinhos o valor é para investir no negócio.

loans.use: increase stock

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Mr. Lay S., 49, is married with four children and lives with his wife in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He works as a mechanic repairing car engines and generally makes about US$ 5 each day. His wife, 44, works selling grocery products to the people in her community, making on average US$ 10/day in revenue. Two of their children work with their father as mechanics and the other two are students.

Mr. Lay S. hopes to use this loan to purchase some spare parts for his business and buy more grocery products for his wife to better meet her customers’ needs.

loans.use: To purchase some spare parts to expand his machine shop

loans.name: Lurdes Jeremias Q.

texts.pt:
Lurdes Jeremias Quefasse N., resident of the Infulene neighborhood, is married with five children. She is entering her first loan cycle. She will borrow 4000 meticais and pay it back in four months. She has a kiosk at her home, from which she sells oil, vinegar, eggs, flour, etc. With these funds, she will increase her amount of stock.

Translated from Portuguese by Ilse Ackerman, Kiva volunteer.

Lurdes Jeremias Quefasse N., portadora do BI nº 100318621G, Residente do bairro Infulene vive maritalmente tem 5 filhos esta no 1º ciclo vai tomar o valor de 4000 mt para pagar em 4 meses vende na sua casa tem uma barraca vende oleo , vinagre ovos farinha ovos e etc. com o valor ela vai aumentar o stock.

loans.use: increase amount of stock

loans.name: Try

texts.en:
Mrs. Try P., 35, runs a stand selling fried banana cakes to the people in her community and typically earns around US$ 4 each day in revenue. Her husband works as a taxi driver, earning on average US$ 3.50 each day. She has one school-age child living with her.

Due to the huge demand from her clients who want her to sell some kinds of soft drinks or sugar cane juice, Mrs. Try P. has recently requested a loan to help her purchase a machine to produce fresh sugar cane juice, which will better satisfy her customers and raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a machine to produce fresh sugar cane juice

loans.name: Chim

texts.en:
Mrs. Chim S., 46, works selling fish at an open-air market ,earning on average up to US$ 10 each day. Her husband works as a soldier and normally makes less than US$ 1 each day. Mrs. Chim S. has seven children. Two of them are employed in a far-off province. Two help her sell fish at the market and the other three are enrolled in school.

Mrs. Chim S. hopes to use this loan to invest in her business. She also plans to buy fish to raise in her pond so that when the fish are big enough she will sell them directly to both wholesalers and her customers at a good profit. (One of her daughers is pictured because Mrs. Chin S. was unavailable.)

loans.use: To expand her business and also buy fish to raise in her pond

loans.name: Kheweul Group

texts.fr:
This group of entrepreneurs which calls itself Kheweul has initiated its own special program in the fight against poverty. We intend to sell hand-dyed cloth (batiks) produced by group members. Starting up this joint venture is the reason why we are asking for a loan which will allow us to better care for ourselves and our families by increasing our income and at the same time allow us to protect our environment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Le groupement Kheweul, dans le cadre de la lutte contre la pauvreté, a initié un programme qui lui est propre; Il s'agit, de la vente des produits de teinture fabriquées par les membres dudit groupement. C'est a cette ocasion que le groupement sollicite un prêt qui leurs permettra de mieux s'occuper, de faire des recettes pour le soutien des familles et aussi pour la protection de leurs environnements.

loans.use:
Sale of local handicrafts (batiks)

Vente de produits artistiques locaux (Tissu batick)

loans.name: Vuqar

texts.ru:
M. Vuqar was born in 1966 in the village of Padakirshlak located in Ahsuniyski region. He has 3 children. He has been in the business of animal breeding for 5 years. This hardworking person always tries to provide for his family. He is seeking a loan from Normicro to purchase several more cows.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Мюзаффарли Вугар родилься 1966 году в село Падаркышлак Ахсуниского района. Семейный, имеет троих детей. Пять лет подряд занимается скотоводством. Этот трудолюбивый человек всегда старается обеспечивать свою семью. 2007 году он обратился в Нормикро Ахсуниский филиал. Вугар хочеть купить еще несколько коров.

loans.use: To  purchase additional cows

loans.name: Hurshed

texts.ru:
Hurshed O. has been in the photography business for 16 years. He is married and has two children. He has a secondary technical education and was trained as an engineer. Since the local factories are closed, he started a photography business in order to support his family. Now he has many clients, but in order to stay abreast of the competition, he needs to keep his photo equipment up to date. Hurshed wants a loan to buy new equipment, which will improve the quality of the photo services he provides.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Обидов Хуршед занимается этим делом 16 лет. Женат и имеет 2-х детей. Имеет средне техническое образование по специальности инженер. Из-за того что не работают заводы и фабрики он вынужден чтобы прокормит семью зарабатывать этим делом.На сегодня он имеет много клиентов,но законы конкуренции требует постоянного обновления новых технологий для чего Хуршед хочет получит кредит и купит аппаратуры для улучшения качество услуг .

loans.use: to buy new equipment

loans.name: Gie Bana-Bana Group

texts.fr:
The members of the group calling itself BANA-BANA intend to innovate in the field of distribution of goods and managing of sales points. We intend to divide the responsibilities fairly, taking into account the fact that each of us is a member of the eco-village. The disbursal of local products is to be assured using using a pick-up truck, and we will see to the sale of the various much-needed goods in the marketplaces of the commune of Diourbel and the area surrounding it. Our group intends to put into place a chain of little corner grocery stores, thereby creating work for each of us.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Les membres du groupement BANABANA ont innovés la distribution et la prestation de services avec un moyen de transport (camionnette) et surtout l’équilibre des charges en tenant compte de la qualité de membre de l’éco village du commerçant. La circulation des produits locaux est assurée grâce au véhicule fonctionnel. La chaîne de commercialisation des divers produits demandés dans les marchés de la commune de DIOURBEL et de la région. Le groupement envisage de mettre en place une chaîne de petites boutiques de quartier et créer des emplois pour chaque unité.

loans.use:
Fairly managed businesses in wholesale distribution and retailing

Commerce équitable

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch O. V. is married and works selling pork / beef rice and porridge in front of a school, earning on average around US$ 3/day in revenue. Her husband is self-employed as a goldsmith earning around US$ 7each day in revenue.

Mrs. Touch O. V. hopes to use this loan to invest in her little cooked food business. The remainder is to buy more goldsmith tools to facilitate her husband’s business. (The man with the red T-shirt is her husband who works as a goldsmith; Mrs. Touch O. V. was unavailable.)

loans.use: To invest in her little food business and purchase more goldsmith's tools to assist her husband's business

loans.name: David

texts.ru:
David S. was born in 1979 and grew up in the Ahsuniyski region. He has been in the business of animal sales for the past 4 years. He is expanding this business because it is very profitable. David would like to receive a loan from Normicro to purchase several more cows and sheep.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Сеидов Давид 1979 года рождения. Родился и вырос в Ахсуниском районе. Холость. Уже четыре года подряд занимается скотоводством. Этот выгодное дело заставил его расщирять свой бизнес . Давид написал заявление в Нормикро Ахсуниский филиал, чтобы получить кредит. Он на эти деньги хочеть покупать несколько коров и овец.

loans.use: To increase the guantity animals

loans.name: Ergash

texts.ru:
Ergash Uktamchonovich R. has been cooking food for sale on markets during the past 10 years. Ergash is a member of a group called "Asil". He is an accountant for this group. Thanks to Ergash, the group always receives loans and returns money on time. He also helps to keep the group working together. Despite his young age, Ergash gives good advice to all members of the group.

Ergash is the oldest in his family. His parents' salaries were not enough to support the family, and after finishing high school he began working at the market. With his profit, he helped the family and saved up for his marriage. He married after 6 years. Currently, Ergash has 2 children. He successfully receives loans is an individual client. He is asking for a loan to increase the size of his business location.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer.

Рахмонбердиев Эргаш Уктамчонович на протяжении 10 лет занимается по оказание услуг по реализации блюд рынке . Эргаш член группы «Асил». Он является бухгалтером группы. Благодаря ему группа в течении своей деятельности во время погашает и получает займ. Сплоченность группы благодрья ему. Не смотря на свой молодой возраст он всем членам группы дает полезные советы. Эргаш является старшим в семье. Заработки родителей не хватало на семью и он сразу после окончания средней школы он начал работать на рынке оказанием услуг. Полученный доход он тратил на семью а часть копил для свадьбы. После шести лет деятельности он женился. В данное время имеет 2-х детей.Сейчас он успешно кредитуеться как индивидуальный клиент. На запрашиваемый кредит клиент хочет расширить плошадь своего бизнеса.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Mrs. Phal S., 42, is the mother of four school-aged children and lives with her husband in Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. She works on her rice paddy growing rice and typically earns about US$ 2 each day. Her husband works as a motor-taxi driver and also works with her on their farmland, making on average about US$ 4.50 each day in income.

Mrs. Phal S. hopes to use this loan to purchase more seed to expand her crops and use another part of the loan to repair their grinding mill to facilitate her farming work. (Her husband is pictured with his grinding mill.)

loans.use: To purchase more seeds to expand her crops and repair her grinding mill to facilitate her farming work

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru:
Mohira Aminjanovna S. has been selling women's clothing for seven years. She has two children. Her husband was a construction worker who was killed on the job. After she was widowed, Mohira's brothers helped her support her children, but before long she had to find a source of income to feed her family. In 2000, Mohira began to trade at the market in Istravshan. She used some of her profits to enroll her daughter in a sewing course. Now her business is stable. She buys goods wholesale from Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan and sells them at her local market. She needs a loan in order to increase turnover and inventory.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Собирова Мохира Аминчановна в течение 7 лет торгует женской одеждой. Имеет 2 детей. Муж умер на производстве . Он работал строителем. После смерти мужа чтобы прокормит детей ей помогали ее братья но со временем потребность стал больше и она была вынуждена искать источник дохода чтобы прокормит детей. Начиная с 2000 года она стала торговать на вещевом рынке города Истаравшан. На полученный доход она обучила дочь на курсы шитья . В данный момент у нее есть стабильный бизнес. Она привозит товар оптом из Бишкека (Киргизстан) и продает на рынке. Она нуждается в финансировании чтобы увеличить товарооборот и асортимент товаров.

loans.use: Expansion of assortment of goods.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok C., 36, is the mother of two children and works with her husband on a plot of land, raising ducks and growing rice, earning collectively around US$ 13/day in revenue. Mrs. Sok C. has humbly requested a loan to expand her inventory by purchasing fertilizer, seeds, and duck feed to expand her poultry business. (Her husband is pictured because Mrs. Sok C. was unavailable when we came to take the photo.)

loans.use: To expand her inventory by purchasing fertilizer, seeds, and duck feed for her poultry business

loans.name: Ekubchon

texts.ru:
Ekubchon H. is a member of the group "Ekubchon". He has been receiving loans from Microinvest for more the two years. Ekubchon works for "Binokor" as a construction worker and earns a salary of 70 dollars a months. He is married and his wife is not employed. Mr. H. used his first loan to buy a calf and after fattening it for 5 months sold it with profit. He used his income and an additional loan to buy a cow and two calves. His wife helps him in his business. With the new loan Mr. H. is planning to buy two calves for fattening and sale. He is planning to use the profits to buy additional animals and the rest will be spent to support his family. Mr. H. is hoping to repay the loan within the next eight months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Хакназаров Екубчон член группы «Екубчон». Кредитуется в «Микроинвест» более 2-х лет. Екубчон работает в ООО «Бинокор» строителем и получает 70$ в месяц заработную плату. Женат. Жена не работает (домохозяйка). Клиент на первый полученный кредит купил бычка и после откорма в течении 5 месяцев продал с прибылью. На полученный доход и новый кредит он купил одну корову и 2-х телят. . Ему в этом помогает жена. На полученный кредит клиент планирует приобрести 2-х голов крупного рогатого скота для их откормки и перепродажи. Вырученные деньги он будет использовать на приобретение молодняка, а оставшуюся прибыль будет направлять на содержание своей семьи. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 8 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Babash

texts.ru:
Babash R. was born in 1974 in the Ahsuniyski region. He is not married. He has been actively involved in the business of animal breeding for three years. He first took out a loan of $600 from Normicro and bough two buffalos. This time, he wants to obtain another loan to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Рахов Бабаш 1974 года рождения. Уроженец Ахсуниского района. Холость. Три года этот человек занимается скотоводством. Бабаш активно ведет эту работу. Первый раз он взял кредит в Нормикро Ахсуниского филиала 600 долларов и купил два буювола. Теперь он хочеть взять еще кредит, чтобы расщирить свой бизнес.

loans.use: To increase the guantity animals

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru:
Sharofat H. has been selling fruit for the past 5 years. She finished high school, is married and has 8 children. Sharfat has a large family. Her husband and oldest daughter help her in this business. She has been receiving loans from MicroInvest since 2005. Then, her loan was $115. After receiving the first loan and using it wisely, she was able to significantly raise her assets. She increased the assortment of her products and increased the size of her sales location. Sharofat plans to receive the new credit and open a new sales location. (Sharofat is very shy, and her husband agreed to pose for a photo.)

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer.

Хаятова Шарофат уже 5 лет занимается этим бизнесом. Имеет среднее образование. Замужем. Имеет 8 детей. Ей в этом деле помогает муж и старшая дочь. У клиентки большая семья . Она кредитуется в МЗФ «Микроинвест» с 2005 года. Тогда ее актив был 115 $. После получения кредитов и целевого использования ее актив увеличился в несколько раз. Она расширила ассортимент товара и расширила торговую точку. Шарофат планирует получит новый займ и открыт новую точку торговли.(она очень стеснительная и её муж согласился сфотографироваться за неё.)

loans.use: Open new point of trade

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok C., 47, works with her husband as brokers buying fish from the fish farmers and reselling them to other vendors at a market. Together they can earn around US$ 5 each day in profit.

Mrs. Sok C. has three children. One of them is married, another one is enrolled in school, and the third is employed as a taxi driver, earning about US$ 5 each day.

She and her husband have humbly applied for a loan to purchase a simple little truck to use for their business’s transportation. ( Her son is pictured with his taxi-car because Mrs. Sok C. was unavailable when we took the photo.)

loans.use: To purchase a little truck to use for transporting her fish

loans.name: Fahriddin

texts.ru:
Fahriddin Ibodulloevich H. rears cattle in his house. He works as a mechanic in a state farm and receives a tiny salary. Sometimes, he does not receive salary for months. He is the only provider for his family and his salary is not sufficient. Since 2003, Fahriddin has been rearing cattle. In the beginning of 2006 he found out about a microcredit program called MicroInvest. With his first loan he purchased 2 bulls.

Fahriddin needs a new loan to expand his business in order to increase his profits. He lives in a village and has no problem feeding additional animals. In the future, Fahriddin plans to expand into milk processing business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer.

Худойбердиев Фахриддин Ибодуллоевич занимается откормом скота дома. Он работает механиком в колхозе и получает мизерную сумму а иногда месяцами не получает заработную плату. Он является единственным кормильцем семьи. Его заработная плата не хватает на семью. Откормом скота он занялся начиная с 2003 года. В начале 2006 года он узнал о программе микрокредитования Микроинвест. На первый полученный кредит он купил 2-х бычков. Он нуждается в финансировании так как он живет в сельской местности и с кормом для скота у него нет проблем и он хочет увеличить количество скота чем он увеличить прибыль. В дальнейшем он планирует заняться переработкой молока. .

loans.use: Business expansion

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 29681

loans.name: Bahtiet

texts.ru:
Bahtiet works as a foreman in a company called "Jangikurgan" where he receives a salary of $17 per month. This is not enough, and he grows cattle to supplement his income. Bahtiet’s wife and children help him. With the credit he plans to purchase 3 cows in order to grow and resell them. With the profit he will receive from sales, Bahtiet will purchase new young cows and use the remaining money to provide for his family, because his small salary is not enough. He does not have any additional sources of income. The client plans to repay the credit in 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Бахтиер работает бригадиром в ХДФ «Янгикурган» получает 17$ в месяц. Этого не хватает и он дома занимается откормом скота. Ему в этом помогают дети и жена. На полученный кредит клиент планирует приобрести 3 голов крупного рогатого скота для их откормки и перепродажи. Вырученные деньги он будет использовать на приобретение молодняка, а оставшуюся прибыль будет направлять на содержание своей семьи, так как небольшой размер заработной платы не хватает на месяц. Других источников дохода он не имеет. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 29682

loans.name: Sadiq

texts.ru:
Sadiq X., who is 26, was born and grew up in Ahsuniyski region. He has been in the business of animal breeding for the past 2 years. He is a bachelor, but he wants to get married. For this reason, he wants to expand his business so he could increase his earnings. He came to Normicro to obtain funding to purchase more animals.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Халилов Садиг.1981 года рождения. Родился и вырос в Ахсуинском районе. 2 года подряд занимается скотоводством.Холост . Этот молодой человек хочет женится.Но до этого он хочет расширить свой бизнес чтобы имеет хорошую прибыль. Для этого ему нужны деньги.Поэтому он обратился в Нормикро Ахсуинский филиал.

loans.use: To increase the guantity animals

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru:
Jamshed Rahimovich S. has been selling food for the past 5 years. He is married and has 2 children. In 2005, Jamshed received the first credit of $142; back then, his assets were $570. After receiving the loan and using it wisely, he increased assortment of goods and expanded his store. After receiving profits, he purchased a minivan to transport his goods. Now, he has a salesman who is paid $50 per month. Jamshed's assets have increased significantly and he plans to open new stores.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Шарипов Чамшед Рахимович занимается продажей продуктов питания вот уже 5 лет. Женат . Имеет 2-х детей. В 2005 Чамшед получил первый кредит в размере 142$ тогда его актив составлял 570$ . Постепенно после получения займа и целевого использования он увеличил ассортимент товара, расширил место деятельности. Получив прибыль от торговли он купил микроавтобус для перевозки товаров. У него на данный момент есть продавец которому он платит заработную плату в размере 50$ в месяц. Сейчас его активы увеличились в несколько раз и он планирует открыт новые торговые точки.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Nadia's Group

texts.en: My name is Nadia Z. and I live in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. I am married and have four children, two of whom are now old enough to go to school. My husband is a builder and needs money to buy a machine to polish tile floors. We are applying for this loan with two other members of my loan group. The first, Arshad A. B., needs a loan for her husband’s construction supply business, and the second, Arshad B., needs a loan for her husband's fruit business. All three of us work together and are committed to help each other pay off our loan and contribute to the success of our families.

loans.use: Buy various pieces of equipment for three family businesses

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en: My name is Shazia B.. I am married and gave birth to my first child, a girl, seven months ago. I live with my family in Lahore, a large city in Pakistan. My husband builds homes for a living, and needs to buy a machine to polish tiles. There are five other members of my loan group, all of whom are eager to expand their businesses. I feel very happy to be working with them and to apply for a loan with their help. My group members are Zainab Bib, who needs a loan for her husband’s cosmetics store; Simki B., who needs a loan to repair her husband's rickshaw;  Rani B., who needs a loan for her husband's construction supply business; Naseem B., who needs a loan for her husband’s fruit cart; and Kalsoom B., whose husband needs to buy a rickshaw.

loans.use: To buy construction equipment and other items

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en: My name is Parveen A. and I live in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. I am the mother of six children, four sons and two daughters. My husband repairs cars for a living, and two of my sons are also in this line of work. We are applying for a loan to buy several items we need for this business. I am also trying to help a few women who are my neighbors and members of my loan group. Like me, they are all committed to establish a good life for their families. I have been their group leader for last two years, and we have always repaid loans on time. The members are: Sughran B., who needs a loan for her husband’s electric store; Jameela B., who needs a loan for her husband’s car-painting business; Shamim B., who needs a loan for her son, who is a carpenter; and Tasleem K., who needs a loan for her husband’s grocery store.

loans.use: To expand various family businesses

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en: My name is Bushra S.. I am married and have two sons. My older son makes shoes and the younger one runs a decorative lace store. My husband runs a boutique and needs a loan to buy a sewing machine and other pieces of equipment for his business. Last year, we took out a loan for his boutique and used it to successfully increase our income. We are applying for this new loan with four other people. They are: Zahida K., who needs money to invest in her boutique; Basheeran B., who needs a loan for her husband, a builder; Sughran B., who needs money to help her husband buy a rickshaw; and Rani G., whose husband needs a loan to buy a carpet-washing machine. All of these women are very hardworking entrepreneurs who need your help.

loans.use: Buy pieces of equipment for various family businesses

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en: My name is Rukhsana S. and I live in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. I have five daughters, all of whom are enrolled in a local school. My husband is a builder and needs a loan to buy a stone-grinding machine. I am applying for this loan with several other people: Asma B., whose husband needs money to buy a printing press; Nusrat B., whose husband is a driver and needs money to install equipment on his rickshaw; Lubna B., who needs a loan for her beauty parlor; and Nazia B., who needs a loan for her brother’s tire shop. This loan will help all of us to establish or expand our family businesses.

loans.use: Buy a stone-grinding machine and other pieces of equipment

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en: My name is Sughran B. and I live in the large city of Lahore, Pakistan. I am married and have four childrenl. My daughter is married and my three sons operate a shoe store in a nearby market. My husband is a scrap dealer who buys and sells used items. We need a loan to expand our son's shoe store. There are three other members in my loan group, and their names are: Parveen J., whose husband is a painter and needs a loan to open a paint store; Noor B., who needs a loan for her husband’s scrap business; and Allah R., who needs a loan for her husband’s brother's grocery store. All of these people are my friends, and we work together to solve each other's problems.

loans.use: Expand a shoe store and several other businesses

loans.name: Shugufta's Group

texts.en: My name is Shugufta F. and I live in the small town of Kamoki, Pakistan. My area is semi urban and has few employment opportunities. My husband was murdered two years ago, so now I am raising our seven children on my own. All three of my sons are currently employed, and help me run our household and meet our many expenses. For a living, I sew clothing on order for my neighbors and also teach sewing to girls in my area. I have made a small training center for this purpose inside my house. I have applied for a loan to further expand my sewing business, and am applying for this loan as part of a group which I lead. All the members of this group are very helpful and strive to enhance each other's well being.  Let me introduce my group members to you: Saleema B., who needs a loan for husband’s spare-parts business; Zahida B., who needs a loan for her boutique; Alice B., who requires a loan for her daughter's clothing-making business; and Muddaser B., who needs a loan for her son’s cosmetics and jewelry store. We are full of hopel for our future and believe that by helping each other we will succeed both now and in the the years to come.

loans.use: Expand several businesses, including one that makes clothing

loans.name: Uzma's Group

texts.en: My name is Uzma B. and I am married and the mother of two children, both of whom are in kindergarten. I make my living sewing and embroidering clothing on order for a boutique. I went into this line of work to supplement my husband's small salary, and have made good use of several previous loans to expand my business and increase  my family's income. I am applying for a new loan to further improve my business, and am submitting this application with three other people: Zarina B., who seeks a loan for her son’s clothing business; Najma B., who needs a loan to expand her beauty parlor; and Sajida B., who wants to buy a machine for her husband's snack-packing business.  I am the leader of this group, but all the members are committed to helping each other improve their living conditions.

loans.use: Improve and expand several businesses

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina is married. She lives in Zaporozhye and works in the local Krytyi market selling women’s terrycloth bathrobes as well as blankets and pillows. She rents a vending spot in a nice, busy location which is attractive for customers passing by her kiosk. Antonina has been in this business for 6 years. Presently, she has about US$ 1600 in inventory. Her monthly net profit is about US$ 300.

Antonina admits that she needs financial assistance to increase her wholesale purchase amounts. She is requesting a loan of $400 to increase her turnover capital. Antonina believes that good sales will help her earn more and better provide for her family’s needs. She is hoping to continue to develop her business and add new inventory items to her assortment of merchandise.

loans.use: To expand her business this Christmas season by purchasing wholesale

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is married with a grown daughter. She lives in Zaporozhye and sells toys in the local Angolenko market. Galina has been in this business for 12 years. She has gained rich experience and always knows what toys will sell well. Galina offers a nice variety of Lego construction blocks, puzzles, dolls, and other toys that are always in high demand during the Christmas and New Year season. Galina has about US$ 3000 in inventory. Her monthly net profit is about US$ 400.

Galina is requesting a loan of US$ 900 to purchase more inventory wholesale. She sees the opportunity to make money and wants to seize it. She is ready to work longer hours and be challenged to increase her income and succeed eventually. We believe Galina’s genuine appetite for success will help her achieve her business goals.

loans.use: To expand her business venture this Christmas season by purchasing wholesale

loans.name: Konstantin

texts.en:
Konstantin is married with two kids. He lives with his family in Ordzhonikidze. Konstantin sells good quality footwear in the central city market. His vending kiosk is well known in the market for a wide assortment of shoes and boots at affordable prices. Konstantin started his venture 3 years ago. Currently, he has about US$ 4000 in inventory. His net profit is about US$ 700 per month.

Konstantin is hoping to open a new vending facility in another city market and is requesting a loan of $1000. His perfect credit history with Nadiya Ukraine proves his integrity and capacity to repay the current loan. We believe Konstantin’s ability to transform his business into what he wants it to be and make profit in the process will lead him to ultimate success in the venture.

loans.use: To purchase inventory  for his shoe shop wholesale

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is married with one child. She and her family live in Ordzhonikidze. Nina runs a small business in the central city market selling clothing. Her vending spot is well-known for having a wide variety of inventory. The assorted trendy clothing items that Nina offers for sale in her kiosk are in high demand among her customers. Nina has been in this business for one year. Currently, she has about US$ 14,000 in inventory. Her monthly net profit is about US$ 700.

Nina’s hard work is – plain and simple – the engine that drives her success. She is also very consistent in her business planning. She is requesting a loan of US$ 1200 to open a new vending spot and expand her business venture. One of Nina’s long-term plans is to launch her own start-up business manufacturing and selling clothing which will allow her to increase her sales and income.

loans.use: To open a new vending spot for clothing

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
Mr. Teodoro González Yegros resides in San Antonio city, San Ignacio state, and is owner of a animal clinic called Santa Rosa, located in the center of San Antonio. 

He sells supplies for cattle as San Antonio is a city where the main activity is agriculture and beef.  Among the supplies he sells are vaccinations and mineral sals for beef, he also provides animal health services. 

The income he receives from this activity helps maintain his family, which consists of 3 daughters ages 25, 20 and 16, who with their mother have a vegetable selling business in their home. They also cover the education expenses that the oldest daughter has as she is finishing her studies in Encarnación city.

He is asking for a loan to purchase mineral salts as the demand during this time of year is particularly high.


Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Descripción:	 El Sr. Teodoro González Yegros, reside en la ciudad de San Antonio distrito de San Ignacio, es propietario de una veterinaria llamada Santa Rosa, ubicado en el centro mismo de la mencionada ciudad.

 Se dedica principalmente a la venta de insumos para ganados ya que se encuentra en una ciudad donde la actividad principal es la agricultura y la ganadería. Entre los insumos que vende podemos citar vacunas y sales minerales para ganado vacuno, también realiza servicios de sanitación animal.

 El ingreso que percibe por esta actividad ayuda a la mantención de su familia, que lo constituyen sus 3 hijas, de 25 20 y 16 años de edad respectivamente, quienes con su madre en su domicilio particular poseen venta de verduras. También cubre los gastos de estudio que posee la mayor de sus hijas que se encuentra culminando sus estudios en la ciudad de Encarnación.

 Solicita de este préstamo para compra de  sales minerales debido a la demanda que posee en esta época del año es bastante alta.

loans.use: Purchase mineral salts for animals

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Mrs. Margarita Centurión lives in San Ignacio Misiones, she lives in a house with her mother and younger sister. The family raises and sells chickens, and has been in this business for 5 years.

She raises the chickens on her house’s patio and sells them by taking them via motorcycle from her home to the city as well as other cities such as Santa Maria, Santa Rosa y San Patricio (cities that are only a few minutes from San Ignacio).

With the income from this activity she is able to support her family and also cover the health expenses of her daughter, who suffers from epilepsy and the treatment is very expensive.

The loan is to purchase chickens in order to meet the high demand that occurs at the end of the year.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Margarita Centurión, reside en la ciudad de San Ignacio Misiones; habita en la casa de su madre junto con otra hermana menor, la familia se dedica a la cría y posterior venta de pollos parrilleros con una antigüedad de 5 años en el negocio.

La cría de los mismos lo realiza en el patio de su casa y la venta la realiza recorriendo en una moto de su propiedad y por diferentes ciudades como Santa Maria, Santa Rosa y San Patricio (ciudades que quedan a pocos minutos de San Iganacio).

Con los ingresos percibidos con esta actividad mantiene a su familia y también cubre los gastos de salud de su hija, quien padece de principio de epilepsia y el tratamiento que esta siguiendo es costoso.

El crédito solicitado es para comprar pollos parrilleros para poder abastecer su gran demanda de fin de año.

loans.use: Purchase chickens

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Mrs Carmen Graciela Martínez, owns a grocery store named “Carmen Graciela”, located in the city of San Ignacio Misiones.

She got married approximately 10 years ago and from that union she has a daughter attending preschool. She is separated and now she lives with a different man with whom she has a 3 year old daughter.

Her grocery store is well supplied and her husband delivers all types of merchandise to other business by motorcycle. Among the many products she sells are: sugar, flour, noodles, rice, fruits, vegetables, meat, milk, eggs, chicken, etc.

Carmen is requesting a loan to be used for purchasing merchandise in big quantities in order to obtain better discounts from her providers.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Carmen Graciela Martínez, es propietaria de una despensa llamada “Carmen Graciela”, ubicada en la ciudad de San Ignacio Misiones.

Se casó hace 10 años aproximadamente; de ese matrimonio tuvo una hija que se encuentra en la escuela primaria; se separó y actualmente vive en pareja con otro hombre con el que tiene una nena de 3 años.

Su despensa está bien surtida y su marido realiza reparto de todo tipo de mercaderías a los demás negocios en moto. Entre los productos que comercializa podemos citar: azúcar, harina, fideo, arroz, frutas, hortalizas, carne, leche, huevos, pollos, etc.

Carmen solicita un crédito ya que con el mismo planea adquirir mercaderías en grandes cantidades, de esta forma obtiene mayores descuentos de sus proveedores.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise such as sugar, flour, noodles, rice, fruits, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Estanislaa

texts.es:
Estanislaa Vllalba from Barreto is married and has three sons. Two of her sons are already financially independent. The youngest is 15 years old and is studying in a public middle school.

Estanislaa has long been a shopkeeper in the city. She has a grocery store called "Tres Reyes" (three kings) where she sells all types of primary food goods such as rice, oil, noodles, salt, sugar, bread products, drinks, vegetables, chicken and sausages.

Her store is in a good location and she has been working in the same place for 11 years. She is requesting a loan so that she can stock her grocery store with greater quantities of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Estanislaa V. de Barreto, esta casada y tiene 3 hijos varones. Dos de sus hijos ya son económicamente independientes. Y el menor de 15 años se encuentra estudiando en un colegio público de nivel medio.

Estanislaa es una comerciante antigua de esta ciudad, ella posee una despensa llamada “Tres Reyes” en donde vende todo tipo de comestibles de primera necesidad como ser arroz, aceite, fideo, sal, azúcar, panificados, bebidas, verduras y pollos y embutidos.

Su negocio esta bien ubicado y lleva 11 años trabajando en el mismo lugar. Ella solicita el crédito pues con el podrá surtir de mayor cantidad de mercaderías en su despensa.

loans.use: purchase of merchandise such as rice, oil, noodles, salt, sugar, bread products, drinks, vegetables

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Mr. Julio Eduardo T. Centurion is 47 years old, married, owns a house, and has 2 children, 18 and 14 years old. His wife has a beauty salon in the same place, the only one in the neighborhood.

Since 2005, Julio has a business in which he produces tiles and floors of all sizes and for all purposes. He employs two helpers. He has all the tools necessary to do this activity, like a manual press, molds of different sizes, among other things. He has gathered a clientele because he is responsible and offers his products at good prices.

The loan will be to buy materials to produce tiles, such as cement and granite. This is because he has a very large order for a building project, for which he has to make 400 square meters (approx. 4,300 sq. feet) of granite floor.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Julio Eduardo T. Centurión, tiene 47 años, es casado vive en casa propia y tiene 2 hijos de 18 y 14 años respectivamente. Su esposa posee en el mismo lugar una peluquería que es la única del barrio.

Desde el 2.005, Julio, posee una baldosería en donde fabrica baldosas y pisos de todos los tamaños, para todo tipo de obras, cuenta con 2 ayudantes. Posee todos los implementos necesarios para desarrollar esta actividad, como ser prensa manual, moldes para diferentes medidas, galpón entre otros, cuenta con clientela formada debido a su responsabilidad y buen precio.

El destino del crédito es para la compra de materiales para la construcción de baldosas como ser cemento y granito, esto es debido a que tomo un pedido muy grande para una obra, para la cual tiene que fabricar unos 400 metros cuadrados de piso granito.

loans.use: Buying cement and granite (compra de cemento y granito)

loans.name: Anorhol

texts.ru:
Anorhol F. is 52 years old and has a secondary school education. She is a widow with two children. Anorhol has a small store where she sells food products close to her home in the village of Kizil-Kala. She plans to use her loan to increase the assortment of goods sold. Most of her clients live in the village. The loan will allow local residents to obtain the groceries they need without having to go into the center of the region. This way they can save time and money. Anorhol plans to repay her loan within a 12-month period.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Факирова Анорхол, возраст 52 года, образование среднее, семейное положение – вдова, имеет 2 детей. Анорхол рядом со своим домом, в кишлаке Кизил-Кала посторила небольшой магазин по продаже продуктов питания. Полученный кредит она хочет использовать на увелечение ассортимента продаваемого товара. Основными её клиентами являются жители этого кишлака. Данный кредит поможет местным жителям приобретать необходимые им продукты питания, при этом не выезжая в центр района, что намного съэкономит их время и денежные средства. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of goods sold

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.ru:
Sabohat S. is 30 years old; she has finished high school, is widowed and has 3 children. Sabohat has a business buying and selling pistachios wholesale. When she receives credit she purchases pistachios from wholesale sellers in order to sell them later. She has been in this business for one year. This credit will give her the opportunity to increase the amount of product that she buys, which, in turn, will raise her profit. This will help feed her children. She also will not have to continue periodically buying small amounts of pistachios for a small price.

The client plans to repay the credit within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Сафарова Сабохат, возраст 30 лет, образование среднее, вдова, имеет 3-х детей. Сабохат занимается оптовой куплей-продажей фисташек. На полученный кредит она планирует закупить партию фисташек у оптовых продавцов для дальнейшей их продажи. Этим бизнесом она занимается в течение одного года. Данный кредит даст ей возможность увеличить закупаемый товар, что соответственно увеличит её доход, кототый поможет прокормить ей своих детей. Ей не придётся слишком часто закупать пратию товара на маленькую сумму. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of pistachios for future sales

loans.name: Claudia Everta

texts.es:
Claudia Everta N. is a woman originally from Chinandega state in Nicaragua. For over 18 years she has made different types of food to sell. She is a single mother with responsibility for a son.

Every day from very early in the morning, Mrs. N. buys the ingredients in Chinandega market to prepare the food. It is important to note that she is well-known for being an expert cook in her area.
