Solicita un préstamo para alcanzar sus metas, usted puede ayudarlo.

loans.use: Implement small bodega to offer goods in conjunction with phone/communication services business.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Florencia is a farmer and mother to five children. She is very motivated with her work,and although they've had a really bad rainy weather, she does this because she is always thinking of her own children. She wishes to purchase a cow in order to sell the milk in the city of Tarma and at the same time produce some cheeses at home. This should help her gain the economic support she needs to raise her kids. Through your help and charity you will be able to make all of her dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Florencia, en una dama agricultora y madre de cinco hijos quienes son su especial fuente motivadora de trabajo que realiza a diario en la chacra, a pesar del mal tiempo que la acompaña y de las lluvias intensas que hay en la zona, la alegría de sus hijos hacen de esta labor un afán mínimo, debido a que sus hijos van creciendo y sus deseos con ellos tiene pensado adquirir una vaquita para vender leche en la ciudad de Tarma y elaborar quesos artesanales en su hogar a fin de otorgarles seguridad económica.A través de la ayuda de tu noble corazón podrá concretar cada uno de sus planes de forma inmediata.

loans.use: Purchase of a cow

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
Maria Antonia Perez lives with her partner and has five children, all school age. She is an enterprising woman with strong desires to develop her business to be able to support her family offering them a stable life. Her dream is to see her children become good professionals.

Two years ago, Mrs. Perez started with a small general store, which through the years, has grown, offering a variety of products. Her starting capital was US$100.00 of her own savings from her youth.

Mrs. Perez has worked with Ceprodel for six years and feels satisfied with the loans she has gotten because they have helped her increase her business, satisfy the needs of her customers, and support her children. She has a record of 28 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Maria Antonia P. es una mujer acompañada madre de cinco hijos, todos en edad escolar, es emprendedora con deseos de desarrollar su negocio para poder apoyar a su familia ofreciéndole una vida estable, su mayor sueño es ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.

Hace Doce años la Sra. P. inicio con una pequeña pulpería la cual al paso de los años ha ido incrementando, pudiendo ofrecer variedad de productos. Su capital inicial fue de U$100.00 (dólares) de ahorros propios que obtuvo a lo largo de su juventud.

La Sra. P. trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace Seis años y se siente muy satisfecha por el apoyo ofrecido, ya que de esta manera ha podido incrementar su negocio, satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela y sacar adelante a sus hijos. Ella tiene un record de Veintiocho créditos.

loans.use: Investing in general store business (Inversión al negocio)

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Maria Auxiliadora is an entrepreneurial woman with great desires to grow her business so she can support her family and at the same time, have a higher standard of living with better income.

For 10 years, Maria Auxiliadora has dedicated herself to the sale of chemicals and base products. Her sales increased since she has been enlarging her store and improving the structure of it. Her seed capital was $1000, which was obtained through a loan.

Maria Auxiliadora has been working with CEPRODEL for three years and she feels very content with the loans that have been lent to her at timely moments. The loans helped her to meet her business's needs and satisfy her customers' daily demands. She has a record of 15 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Maria Auxiliadora es una mujer Soltera emprendedora con grandes deseos consolidar su negocio para poder apoyar a su familia y al mismo tiempo tener un mejor nivel de vida con mayores ingresos económicos.

Desde hace Diez años Maria Auxiliadora se dedica a la venta de productos de embase y químicos, sus ventas incrementaron, ya que ella ha ido ampliando su local y mejorando la estructura del mismo. Su capital de inicio fue de U$1,000.00 (dólares) los cuales obtuvo a través de un préstamo.

Maria Auxiliadora trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace Tres años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando así a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. Ella tiene un record de Quince créditos.

loans.use: invest in her business

loans.name: Maria  Nela

texts.es:
Maria Nela is a mother of two children who are school age. Her children have been her reason to live, and because of that she has worked hard, offering them a stable family and an education for their own future.

For 8 years, Maria Nela has worked selling agro-chemical products and fertilizers, however, she has managed to find a better opportunity and so it was that she started her own locale to be better able to offer her products.

This business is one of the most outstanding in her area nowadays. Her sales increased considerably through the years because she has expanded her locale and improved its structure. Her initial capital was C$10,000.00 (cordobas) which came from her savings and a contribution from her husband.

Maria Nela has been working with Ceprodel for three years now and she feels very satisfied with the loans she has been given, because they have come at a good time, helping her satisfy the needs of her business and the daily needs of her customers. She has a record of eighteen loans.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Maria Nela es una dama madre de dos hijos los cuales se encuentran en la edad escolar. Sus hijos han sido su razón de vivir y por ellos es que ella se ha esforzado, brindándoles así una familia estable y una educación para el futuro de ellos.

Desde hace ocho años Maria Nela se dedicaba a la venta de productos agroquímicos y fertilizantes, sin embargo logró encontrar una mejor oportunidad en su camino y fue así que ella da inicio con un local propio para ofrecer mejor sus productos.

Este negocio es uno de los mas destacados hoy en día en su sector, sus ventas incrementaron considerablemente al paso de los años, ya que ella ha ido ampliando su local y mejorando la estructura del mismo. Su capital de inicio fue de C$10,000.00 (córdobas) los cuales una parte eran sus ahorros y otro aporte de su esposo.

Maria Nela trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace Tres años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando así a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. Ella tiene un record de Dieciocho créditos.

loans.use: Investing in her business (Inversión al negocio)

loans.name: Martha Eugenia

texts.es:
Martha Eugenia M. S. is a single woman. She is enterprising and has hopes to expand her business so that she can support her family and offer them a more stable life and meet the needs of her children.

Ten years ago Ms. M. S. started with a small grocery store that has been growing over the years allowing her to offer a greater variety of products. Her start-up capital was $50.00 in savings.

Ms. M. S. has been working with CEPRODEL for five years and is very happy with the support that they have given her because she has been able to expand her business, meet her clientèle's needs and help her children to succeed. She has a history of twenty four loans.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Martha Eugenia M. S. es una mujer Soltera, emprendedora con deseos de progresar en su negocio para poder apoyar a su familia ofreciéndole una vida estable, poder satisfacer las necesidades de su hijo.

Hace Diez años la Sra. M. S. inicio con una pequeña pulpería la cual al paso de los años ha ido incrementando, pudiendo ofrecer variedad de productos. Su capital inicial fue de U$50.00 (dólares) de ahorros.

La Sra. M. S. trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace Cinco años y se siente muy satisfecha por el apoyo ofrecido, ya que de esta manera ha podido incrementar su negocio, satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela y sacar adelante a sus hijos. Ella tiene un record de Veinticuatro créditos.

loans.use: Purchase of products

loans.name: Vilma Mirna

texts.es:
Vilma is a dedicated teacher who focuses on teaching early education to small children between the ages of newborn to five years old. This vocation is her passion, given that she has always enjoyed teaching and taking care of kids. At the same time, she and her husband grow citrus and other fruits that they sell in the city of Pichanaki. She and her two daughters, ages 13 and 15, want to open a small store in their home where they can sell cold beverages to the community. For this reason, she works hard as a teacher and farmer in order to reach her goals. Regardless, the season to produce the most crops is approaching and they need additional fertilizers and tools to grow and harvest their fruits. Vilma is seeking your collaboration and support to increase her citrus crop with the objective of meeting the demands of the next crop selling season.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Vilma, es una noble profesora que se desempeña como promotora de niños en servicio de un PRONOEI que otorga estimulación temprana a los pequeños de 0 a 5 años de edad, esta labor es su pasión puesto que siempre le encantó enseñar y cuidar a niños; a la par ella y su esposo se dedican al cultivo de cítricos y demás frutas que comercializan en la ciudad de Pichanaki.Ella y sus dos hijas de 13 y 15 años desean implementar en su domicilio una pequeña bodega a fin vender bebidas heladas a su comunidad; es por ello que su ardua labor de profesora y agricultora le ayudaran a alcanzar sus metas; sin embargo el tiempo para producir a mayor cantidad se acerca y la campaña de marzo para le venta de frutas esta próxima; por esa razón requiere mayor cantidad de abonos y demás herramientas para cosechar sus terrenos de cultivo. Ahora Vilma requiere de vuestra colaboración y apoyo para elevar la producción de su chacra de cítricos con el objetivo de abastecer la demanda de la campaña próxima de venta de frutas.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and tools for harvesting crop.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
When we visited Teodora’s house, we found her working enthusiastically and diligently in her vocation as a teacher reviewing and refilling the notebooks of the children she teaches in her small garden. She is a single mother with one eleven-year-old daughter. She works very hard at her endeavors because she believes the best gift she can give her young daughter is a good education. Given her immense desire to provide all the best for her daughter, she has for some time now contemplated the possibility of opening a small store in their home. Her goal is to supplement her income during her free time, so she can improve their standard of living. For this reason, she turns to you for your support in helping her reach her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Cuando visitamos la casa de doña Teodora, la observamos trabajando con un muy buen ánimo y empeño en sus labores de maestra revisando y rellenando las libretas de los niños a quienes imparte educación en un modesto jardín.Ella es madre soltera con una hija de once años, quien aún está en etapa escolar, razón por la cual trabaja constantemente por que considera que el mejor regalo que le puede otorgar a su pequeña hija es una educación adecuada. Debido a su inmenso deseo de querer ofrecerle lo mejor a su hija desde hace mucho ha contemplado la posibilidad de aperturar una pequeña tienda en su domicilio, con el objetivo de incrementar sus ingresos para elevar su nivel de vida familiar durante su período de horas libres, por esta razón recurre a vosotros en busca de tu ayuda a fin de cristalizar su anhelo en corto tiempo con tu importante aporte.

loans.use: Open a small store/bodega in her home.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa gets immense satisfaction seeing people enjoy the refreshing flavor of her delicious oranges each morning. She tends carefully to each and every one, as her citrus crop plays a key role in her goals to get ahead. She has a beautiful plot of land where she grows her produce, along with the help of her loved ones. Regardless of her efforts, an unfortunate incident one afternoon last October resulted in her crops catching fire and sustaining damage. In his desperate efforts to fight the fire, her husband also nearly lost his life. In the end, they were unable to do anything but watch sadly as the fire consumed their hard work and the funds it had taken them to plant and tend to the crop. She still has the desire to plant her fields, and your contribution is very important for her to be able to move forward so the family can recover their happiness and well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Teresa, siente una inmensa satisfacción cuando las personas disfrutan todas las mañanas del refrescante sabor de sus deliciosas naranjas, productos que son adecuadamente cuidados, ya que pone en cada uno de ellos un enorme esfuerzo y sobretodo llevan impregnados en si, sus inmensas ganas de progresar.Posee una hermosa tierra en las que cultiva cítricos, en compañía de sus seres queridos; sin embargo hace poco el infortunio llegó a su hogar; una tarde del mes de octubre por descuido de un pariente se produjo un dantesco incendio en sus chacras de cítricos y quemó una cuadra de su producción y con la desesperación de apagar el fuego su esposo casi pierde la vida, al ver que no se podía hacer nada sólo se quedaron contemplando con mucha tristeza como en unas horas el fuego terminó por consumir el trabajo de varios días y las cuantiosas sumas de dinero que tuvieron que invertir para su producción. Aún conserva el anhelo de sembrar sus campos y la contribución vosotros es muy importante para poner en marcha este proyecto a fin de que esta trabajadora familia recobre la alegría y bienestar.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene always feels an immense satisfaction when seeing her delicious orange and citrus crops, products she adequately tends to being that she places an enormous amount of effort on each one of them. In the company of her children, who are the reason for all her work, she does her job with the purpose of always seeing them happy. Additionally, she has been planning on opening a small store at home hoping that it can provide for a part of her family’s daily expenses. For this reason, she is requesting a noble contribution from each one of us, since with this loan she will be able to obtain a greater amount of citrus products and thus increase their quality and quantity and in that way, open her much-desired store. Let’s support this noble mother’s wishes to progress.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Marlene, siempre siente una inmensa satisfacción al ver sus cultivos de cítricos y deliciosas naranjas, productos que cuida adecuadamente ya que pone en cada uno de ellos un enorme esfuerzo.En compañía de sus hijos, los cuales son la razón de todo el trabajo que realiza, inicia sus labores con el propósito de verlos siempre felices. De manera adicional tiene pensado aperturar una pequeña bodega en casa a fin de que este negocio pueda suplir parte de los gastos diarios de su familia. Por esta razón solicita la noble contribución de cada uno de vosotros, ya que a través de un préstamo podrá obtener una mayor producción de cítricos e incrementará su calidad y cantidad para así poder tener la anhelada tiendita. Apoyemos el propósito de esta noble madre para progresar.

loans.use: Purchase capital to increase the quality and quantity of her citrus crops so that she may open a store in her home.

loans.name: Silvia Arlinia

texts.es:
With a lot of effort and spirit, Mrs. Silvia Arlinia is a woman who has been able to move ahead thanks to the sale of food.

Because of her economic status and her desire to provide for her children, Mrs. Pérez decided to initiate the sale of food in order to move ahead in life. She wanted to give her family everything they needed. In order to achieve this dream she teamed up with Ceprodel to receive loans so that she could begin to sell food.

After receiving these loans Mrs. Pérez has been able to overcome her economic situation. She has bought various products to elaborate her food for sale. She is an excellent cook and has expanded her set of clients in the market of The Station.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

La Señora Silvia Arlinia es una dama que con mucho esfuerzo y con gran espíritu de superación ha podido salir adelante gracias a la venta de comida la cual tienen a su cargo.

Debido a la situación económica que atraviesa la señora Pérez y por el apoyo que debería de dar a sus infantes, la señora Pérez decide iniciar una venta de comida preparada por ella para poder salir adelante y ayudar a su familia que mucho lo necesitaba. Para poder realizar este trabajo realizo prestamos en ceprodel el cual los uso como capital de trabajo para comenzar a vender los alimentos.

Después de dar lugar a estos préstamos la señora Pérez ha podido superar su situación económica de manera que ha realizado compras de los productos para elaborar los alimentos para la venta y sin olvidar que por ser excelente cocinera ha aumentado su cartera de clientes en el mercado de La Estación.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina’s principal occupation is the cultivation and production of fruits. She is an excellent and admirable farmer who received from her husband the techniques and secrets of this beautiful activity, skills that have allowed her to develop multiple agricultural capabilities now that she has widowed, and have especially granted her the possibility of maintaining her loving family in these times of numerous financial problems. She has five children at her siD. who have been her aid in the most difficult moments of her life and are her principal motivation to progress. For this reason, she wishes to contribute to the dreams of each one of her children by furnishing their small home in the best way possible in order to open a small store there to cover her household’s expenses. Marcelina requests your help in the form of a loan that will allow her to obtain greater revenues this year for the purpose of reaching each one of her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Marcelina, tiene como actividad principal el cultivo y producción D. frutas, y excelente y admirable agricultora que recibió D. su esposo las técnicas y secretos D. esta hermosa actividad; enseñanzas que ahora al quedarse V. le han permitido desarrollar múltiples habilidades para la agricultura y sobretodo le ha otorgado la posibilidad D. mantener a su amada familia en estos días D. múltiples problemas económicos. Ella tiene a su lado a cinco hijos que han sido su ayuda en los momentos más difíciles D. su vida y quienes son su principal motivo D. progreso, por esta razón desea contribuir con los sueños D. cada uno D. ellos y asimismo acondicionar D. la mejor manera su pequeña casita con el propósito D. aperturar una tiendita para solventar los gastos que genera su hogar y solicita vuestra ayuda a través D. un préstamo que le permitirán a Marcelina obtener este año mayores ingresos a fin D. lograr cada una D. sus metas.

loans.use: Opening and implementing a small citrus product store at home.

loans.name: Marilú

texts.es:
Marilú is a very selfless and hard-working woman, who since her childhood has appreciated the imperative value that work has in the lives of all of us. More so now because of the weight of her family’s expenses on her and because of her partner’s abandonment. Despite her situation, she continues to strive with that same diligent spirit, but her family’s financial situation is not the most favorable and her greatest support is the small grocery store she owns and which she tends to fervently. Because of this, her greatest wish is to buy another refrigerator (which offers her extensive support in the sale of cold drinks), due to the fact that it has not been functioning properly lately and has brought about a diminishing income. For this reason, she wishes to purchase a small refrigerator or freezer to continue offering her community cold drinks being that they have a very warm climate. You can collaborate with Marilú and contribute to the accomplishment of her goals with a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Marilú, es una dama muy abnegada y trabajadora que desde su niñez ha apreciado el valor imprescindible que tiene el trabajo en la vida de cada una de las personas, y ahora aún más por la carga familiar que afronta y por el abandono de su pareja, a pesar de estos hechos sigue conservando ese mismo espíritu diligente pero la situación económica que afronta su familia no es la más favorable y su gran ayuda es la pequeña bodega que posee en la que se desempeña fervientemente. Raíz de este hecho posee el inmenso anhelo de cambiar su refrigeradora que tanto apoyo le otorga en la venta de bebidas heladas debido a que en estos últimos días ha estado fallando y ha traído consigo la disminución de sus ingresos, es por ello que desea comprarse una pequeña refrigeradora o congeladora para seguir ofreciendo bebidas heladas a su comunidad por ser un lugar muy caluroso.Vosotros podéis contribuir con Marilu para el logro de sus planes a través de un préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase a small refrigerator or freezer.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha is a farmer and had us taste some of her delicious coconuts, mangoes and bananas, products which she grows with much effort and dependability with the help of her family in her fertile farming lands. She puts a lot of enthusiasm into the development of her farming efforts because she is aware that they can help her children. The unconditional support that she receives from them provides her with optimism, and despite the financial shortcomings at home she tries to alleviate those shortcomings efficiently. Martha feels a profound obligation toward her family, and especially for her youngest child, who suffers from epilepsy, and who to this day she has only been able to treat with natural herbs. Her wish to improve the health of her little one brings her to request a loan to increase the quality and quantity of her products with the goal of providing him with appropriate treatment in a hospital in their country once she obtains profits from the marketing of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha, es agricultora ella nos hizo degustar algunos de sus deliciosos cocos, mangos y plátanos productos que a costa de mucho esfuerzo y constancia logra producir en compañía de su familia en sus fértiles tierras de cultivo.Ella pone mucho ánimo en el desarrollo de sus labores agrícolas porque es consciente que de esta manera puede ayudar a sus tres hijos, el apoyo incondicional que recibe de ellos le inyecta optimismo y a pesar de las carencias económicas que hay en casa, trata de aliviar eficazmente las carencias de su hogar.Martha siente un profundo compromiso con su familia y aún más con el último de sus hijos, quien sufre de epilepsia, mal que hasta el momento sólo ha logrado aliviar con un tratamiento con hiervas naturales. Su deseo de mejorar la salud de su pequeño la llevan a solicitar un préstamo para mejorar la cantidad y calidad de sus productos a fin de otorgarle con las ganancias que obtendrá luego de su comercialización un adecuado tratamiento en un hospital de su país.

loans.use: Increase the quality and quantity of her products to provide adequate treatment for her son's illness.

loans.name: Teogina

texts.es:
Teogina is an extremely diligent and experienced woman, well trained in her agricultural and political endeavors being that she is part of her city council. It is for this reason that with much effort, she is able to produce coffee, mangoes and bananas which she then sells to wholesale merchants who take their products to all the markets in the region. This activity allowed her to adequately raise and educate her six children who are grateful of her effort and sacrifice. Today she continues to be a mother to her grandchildren as well, for which reason she wishes to pave her way into more competitive markets with her fruits. To do this, she needs a substantial increase in her investment capital and she appeals to your generous hearts to increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Teogina, es una mujer sumamente experimentada y diligente, muy bien adiestrada en las labores agrícolas y políticas al ser regidora en su comunidad, es así que con mucho esfuerzo logra producir café, mangos y plátanos que posteriormente vende a comerciantes mayoristas que llevan sus productos a todos los mercados de su región. Estas actividades le permitieron educar y mantener adecuadamente a sus seis hijos quienes agradecen todo su esfuerzo y sacrificio. Hoy sigue siendo una madre para sus nietos por lo cual desea abrirse paso en mercados más competitivos a través de sus productos frutícolas, para ello necesita una mejora muy sustancial en la inversión que realiza y apela a vuestros corazones generosos para incrementar su producción.

loans.use: Increase her capital to venture into more competitive markets.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
In November of 1990, one month after her husband suffered an accident, Virginia began to wrap presents and sell items in her region, like earrings, necklaces, and tablecloths she made with fabric she obtained at a low price. She started to make money to be able to pay the expenses of her home and her children's education. Virginia dreams about seeing her children graduate from college so they will have a better future. Four years ago, the opportunity to sell shoes presented itself, which has given her good results since she lets her clients buy on credit.

However, the car that she uses to collect from her clients isn't working right now, so this is why she is requesting a loan of $750 which she will repay in 6 months. She will use the money to repair her car and to buy more merchandise to be able to have a larger variety of items and to be able to collect from her clients. With your help, Virginia will be able to give her three children an education.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

En noviembre de 1990 tras un mes de que su espos sufrió un accidente, Virginia se dedicó a envolver regalos y vender curiosidades de la localidad, como aretes, collares y manteles hechos por ella, con telas que conseguía a bajo precio, comenzó a sacar dinero para poder mantener los gastos de su casa y los de la escuela de sus hijos ya que Virginia sueña con que sus hijo terminen la universidad para que tengan un mejor futuro que el de ella. Hace cuatro años se le presentó la oportunidad de vender zapatos, lo cual le a dado mejores resultados, puesto que deja a crédito los zapatos a sus clientes.

Sin embargo el carro que utiliza para poder cobrarle a sus clientes actualmente se encuentra descompuesto, es por eso que Virginia Está solicitando un crédito de US $750 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Virginia podrá arreglar su carro y comprar más mercancía para poder darle variedad a sus artículos además de poder salir a cobrarle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Virginia podrá darle estudios a sus tres hijos.

loans.use: To repair her car which she uses to collect from her clients and to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Roy

texts.es:
Roy is 41 years old and is the father of two children. For a long time now, he has been selling fish throughout the streets of the Pucallpa zone. This task is very pleasant and habitual to him being that he comes from a family of fishermen. He wants to continue expanding his business with the sale of this powerful source of nutrients, and to do that he needs materials to build a kiosk in an appropriate location to offer his fish in fresh, fresh saltwater and dehydrated varieties. With the help of his wife, Rudith, they do everything possible to provide their children with an education and well-being. He has a goal of expanding his business to its peak, which might include exporting to different regions in the country; however, he is in need of capital to realize this goal. He awaits the disinterested support of your generous and noble heart.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Roy de 41 años de edad, es padre de dos hijos, desde hace mucho se dedica a vender pescado por las diferentes calles de la zona de Pucallpa, la labor es muy habitual y agradable para él debido a que proviene de una familia de pescadores, quiere seguir incrementando su negocio con la venta de esta poderosa fuente de nutrientes, y para ello requiere de materiales para construir un kiosco en un lugar apropiado para ofertar sus pescados frescos, frescos salados y secos.En compañía de su señora Rudith, quien lo apoya también en la venta de pescados, hacen todo lo posible por proveer a sus hijos de educación y bienestar.Él tiene una meta que es acrecentar su negocio al máximo llegando incluso a exportarlos a las diferentes regiones, sin embargo necesariamente le urge un capital para la realización de sus propósitos. Él espera la ayuda desinteresada de tu bondadoso y noble corazón.

loans.use: Purchase greater quantities of fish as well as construction materials to build a kiosk.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.es:
Catherine is a very active woman with wishes of self-improvement. For a long time now, she has been selling beauty products such as: perfumes, shampoos, powders, lipsticks, nail polish removers, etc. In the time she has been doing this job, she has acquired a great range of clients, and for that reason she has decided to set up a glass counter (showcase) so that she can display these beauty products. Wilter, her loving husband, supports her in all her decisions since he is an independent worker. She is the mother of three wonderful children, and all she expects from them is that they get an education so that they can reach each one of the goals they set in the future. She is in immediate need of investment capital to reach her objectives and accomplish everything she wants to do. With your help, Catherine will accomplish her goals in a very short time.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Catherine, es una dama muy activa y con deseos de superación, se dedica desde hace mucho tiempo a la venta de productos de belleza como: perfumes, shampoos, talcos, lápices labiales, Correctores para uñas, etc; con este trabajo durante el tiempo de su permanencia ha conseguido una gran gama de clientes y es por eso que ahora optó por poner su mostrador (vitrina), con el fin de exhibir estos productos de belleza, el señor Wilter su querido esposo la apoya en todas sus decisiones, ya que él es trabajador independiente. Ella es madre de tres hijos maravillosos y lo único que espera es que estudien para que puedan alcanzar cada una de las metas que se tracen en un futuro; precisa de un capital de inversión lo más pronto posible para lograr su objetivo y cumplir con lo que realmente quiere. Con tu ayuda la señora Catherine logrará su propósito en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Increase capital to purchase a glass counter (showcase).

loans.name: Eider

texts.es:
A long time ago Eider started a business selling scrap iron, and his daily routine of collecting, buying, and selling this material makes him keep in mind each of his goals. He is 52 years old, father of three loving children, and together with his beloved wife, Anita, their main purpose is to offer education and well-being to their children. Don Eider has always wanted to add two extra rooms for rent to his small home, but he needs capital to invest in construction material and purchase of more scrap iron in order to become an important wholesaler to factories that recycle this kind of waste. Let us support this father, who is working arduously with effort and dedication, to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Eider, se constituyó en el negocio de la venta de chatarra desde hace mucho tiempo, su rutina diaria de acopio, compra y venta de estos materiales de desecho, hacen que él siga concibiendo en su memoria cada uno de sus propósitos. Tiene 52 años de edad es padre de tres hijos súper cariñosos, en compañía de su amada esposa, Anita, tiene la finalidad de educar y otorgarles bienestar.Desde siempre el señor Eider ha deseado construir dos cuartos adicionales en su pequeña vivienda para darlas en alquiler, sin embargo para la realización del mismo, necesita de un capital de dinero, para invertirlos en materiales de construcción, y también para la compra de mayor cantidad de chatarra a fin de convertirse con el tiempo en un importante exportador de estos desechos útiles al sin número de empresas que elaboran materiales en base a estos materiales.Apoyemos a este padre que con esfuerzo y dedicación sigue trabajando arduamente por prosperar.

loans.use: Purchase of construction material and increase of capital to make a small business grow.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Don Julio Cesar repairs motorcycles and vehicles, he is a self-taught mechanic and throughout time he has participated in several training courses offered by commercial establishments in order to specialize and now he is proud of having his own repair-shop which is very successful because of the good service. Apart from repairing he also sells spare parts, in small proportions, to motorcycles and vehicles.

He is a father of two children, and his wife, Laura, is pleased to have a husband who is dedicated to his work and his family, and therefore Don Julio works arduously to provide well for his children. His goal is to strengthen his small sale and repair shop with an increased number and more variety of spare parts in order to turn it into a motor factory (sale of spare parts, mechanical services, electrical services, wash and lubrication). In order to reach his goal he requires capital to invest in his business. The support offered by your noble heart is very important to make this diligent mechanic reach his goal.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

EL señor Julio Cesar se dedica al arreglo de motos y motocarros, él aprendió empíricamente sobre la mecánica de motos, con el pasar del tiempo ha participado en las diferentes capacitaciones que hacían las tiendas comerciales de motos para especializarse, ahora se siente orgulloso de tener su propia mecánica y es bien solicitado por su buen trabajo, aparte de reparar vende también repuestos de motos y motocarros en pocas proporciones.

Es padre de dos hijos, su esposa, Laura, se siente feliz de tener un esposo dedicado a su trabajo y a su familia, es por eso que Julio trabaja muy arduamente para brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijos.Tiene un solo propósito en mente el de implementar mayor cantidad y variedad de repuestos en su pequeño espacio de ventas y reparaciones, con el propósito de convertirlo en una factoría de motos (venta de repuestos, servicio mecánico, servicio eléctrico, lavado y engrase ). Para concretar este objetivo requiere de un capital de inversión ya que espera mejorar su mecánica día a día. La ayuda desinteresada de tu noble corazón es el factor más importante para que este diligente mecánico alcance sus metas.

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for motorcycles and vehicles.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco Javier was laid off from his job 5 years ago. At the same time, one of his three daughters became ill with bone cancer. This terrible news forced him to fight to keep his family going. His wife got a job as a cashier at a convenience store and Javier, armed with his mechanic skills, started to do work for his neighbors and acquaintances. With all faith and enthusiasm, his auto mechanic business started to grow little by little. Currently, his earnings coupled with that of his wife's meet their family's living expenses.

However, he is finding that the tools that he has are not enough to work at his job with full speed. For this reason, Francisco seeks a loan of $750 that will be paid back over the course of 6 months. This loan will be used to buy tools and material used to repair autos. With your help, Francisco will be able to provide for his children's education and especially, for his ill daughter, who needs Francisco the most in these moments.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Francisco Javier hace 5 años lo despidieron de su trabajo y al mismo tiempo se dio cuenta que una de sus tres hijas se enfermó de cáncer en los huesos. Esta terrible noticia fue lo que le dio fuerzas para luchar por sacar adelante a su familia. Su esposa comenzó a trabajar como cajera en una tienda de conveniencia y Javier con los conocimientos que tiene de mecánica comenzó a hacer trabajos para sus vecinos y familiares. Con toda la fe y el entusiasmo su negocio fue creciendo poco a poco y actualmente ya saca dinero para poder pagar junto con su esposa los gastos de sus hijos y la familia.

Sin embargo cada vez le están pidiendo más trabajo pero las herramientas con las que cuenta no le son suficientes como para poder ofrecer con rapidez sus trabajos. Es por eso que Francisco está solicitando un crédito de US $750 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero podrá comprar herramientas y material para poder reparar los carros. Con tu ayuda Francisco podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos brindándoles estudios, y en especial a su hija quien en estos momentos necesita más de Francisco.

loans.use: to buy tools and materials

loans.name: Ana De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Ana de los Angeles G. Garcia is married and has five children. She studied up to 5th grade. She has a business selling food in the county market of Chichigalpa. She started the business when her husband's income was very low. She had always enjoyed preparing food, and had been selling food at her home every afternoon. Ten years ago, at the insistence of a friend who also has a food stand at the market, she rented an unoccupied locale in the market too.

She has been working with CEPRODEL for two years now, and she tells us that she feels very good about all the loans she has gotten because they have arrived at a good time and have been given quickly and allowed her to get ahead because through the income generated by this business they have been able to improve the living conditions in their home and have managed to ensure their children are educated.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Ana de los Ángeles G. G., es casada y con cinco hijos, cursó hasta el quinto grado de primaria, tiene un negocio de venta de alimentos ubicado en el mercado municipal de Chichigalpa, el negocio lo comienza cuando los ingresos que percibía su esposo eran bastantes bajos, a ella siempre le gustó el negocio de comidería ya que en su casa se vendía todas las tardes, este negocio lo emprende hace diez años, esto lo logra a través de una amiga que también tiene un puesto de comida en el mercado, fue ella quien la impulso a rentar el local que estaba vacío.

Trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace dos año, nos manifiesta que se siente muy bien con los créditos otorgados pues han sido muy oportunos y brindados de manera muy ágil, y que le han servido para salir a delante, ya que a través de los ingresos que les ha generado este negocio han podido mejorar sus condiciones de su hogar y a podido lograr que sus hijos se vayan preparando.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (Compra de mercadería)

loans.name: Claudia Guadalupe

texts.es:
In 1995, because of the need to offer her children a better future as a single mom, Claudia started her general store. In 1996 she added a small cart for selling tacos, which Claudia prepares very well because her parents work preparing and selling tacos too. By 2002 she started selling new shoes as a distributor, by them she could count with the help of her eldest son, who helped his mother paying for his college and offering his sister the same opportunity.

However, Claudia thinks it is time to renovate her locale, so her customers feel more comfortable when they come shopping, and she wants to buy a metal curtain to protect her products. Claudia is requesting a loan for US $ 750, which she is willing to pay in 6 months. With your help, Claudia will be able to buy what is necessary to protect her merchandise as well as fixing up her store, and with this pay for her children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

En 1995 tras la necesidad de ofrecer un futuro mejor a sus hijos, ya que es madre soltera, Claudia inicia con el negocio de abarrotes, en 1996 pone una pequeña carreta de tacos que Claudia sabe elaborar muy bien ya que sus padres también se dedican a eso. Para el 2002 comenzó con la venta de calzado nuevo mediante vales, como distribuidora, contando ya con el apoyo de su hijo mayor y así el ayudarle a su madre a costearse los estudios universitarios y al mismo tiempo poder ofrecerle la misma oportunidad a su hermana.

Sin embargo Claudia considera que es momento de renovar su local, para que sus clientes se sientan más a gusto al ir a comprarles y poder comprar una cortina metálica para proteger sus productos. Claudia está solicitando un crédito de US $750 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses con tu ayuda Claudia podrá comprar lo necesario para proteger su mercancía así como para arreglar su local, y con esto pagar los estudios de sus hijos.

loans.use: Buying a metal curtain to protect her store and remodeling her locale (Comprar una cortina metálica para proteger su negocio y remodelar su local)

loans.name: Ana Isaura

texts.es:
Ana Isaura M. is a married woman with 2 children that are in school. Her children are the reason she wants to improve herself and she has worked very hard to provide them with a stable family life and an education for their future.

Ana Isaura M. has owned a grocery store for twelve years and her sales have been very good. Her business is profitable now in her sector. Her sales have increased considerably over the years. Her initial capital was $15,000 - money she had saved and support from her husband.

Ana Isaura has worked with Ceprodel for 7 years and is very satisfied with the loans she's received. The loans have been provided to her when she needed them and have helped her satisfy the necessities of her business and her clients. She has made 23 transactions with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

Ana Isaura M. es una mujer casada con 2 hijos los cuales se encuentran en la edad escolar. Sus hijos han sido la razón para que ella se superara y por ellos es que ella se ha esforzado, brindándoles así una familia estable y una educación para el futuro de ellos.

Hace 12 años Ana Isaura M. tiene su pulpería y sus ventas han sido muy buenas. Su negocio es rentable hoy en día en su sector, sus ventas incrementaron considerablemente al paso de los años. Su capital de inicio fue de C$15,000 (córdobas) los cuales eran ahorros y aporte del esposo.

Ana Isaura trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 7 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando así a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. Ella tiene un record de 23 créditos.

loans.use: The purchase of various products

loans.name: Laura Patricia

texts.es:
Laura Patricia is a mother of 5 children, who wishes that one day her kids will go to college. Not being able to take care of her kids with a regular job, she started her own business two years ago. She bought a tortilL. machine and started selling them. Since the business is only in the mornings from 4am to 1pm, she is able to take care of her children.

Her tortilL. business has increased tremendously. Nevertheless, every time her clients request greater amounts of tortillas, she is not able to complete their request since the production of these is very time consuming. This is why Laura is asking for a credit of U.S. $375 which will be paid in full in 6 months. This loan will enable her to buy a machine that will cut the dough into small balls making the tortilL. production a lot faster. With your help Laura will be able to meet her customer’s demands.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Villegas, Kiva volunteer.

Laura Patricia es madre D. 5 hijos, los cuales desea que salgan adelante con estudios universitarios. Fue por eso que hace dos años comenzó a elaborar tortillas, comprando una máquina D. tortillas, y así no deja D. atender a sus hijos ya que el negocio es sólo en las mañanas, desD. 4 D. L. mañana hasta L. 1 D. L. tarD. pudiendo estar con sus hijos cuando estos salen D. L. escueL.. Y desD. entonces el negocio D. las tortillas ha ido incrementando su clienteL..

Sin embargo cada vez los clientes le piden mayor cantidad D. tortillas y L. producción D. estas es muy lenta. Es por eso que Laura está solicitando un crédito D. US $375 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo D. 6 meses y con este dinero podrá comprar una máquina para cortar L. masa en bolitas y así eficientar L. producción D. tortillas. Con tu ayuda Laura podrá sacar adelante su negocio y con esto sacar dinero para pagar los estudios D. sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy a machine to cut dough

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
Ramona became a widow 5 years ago, being in charge of her four daughters who are between 8 and 23 years of age. Back then, the eldest was 18 and was in high school, so the expenses for her daughters were high. For that reason, Ramona started selling second-hand clothes in her neighborhood, because there wasn't any such business in her area. She started selling her daughters' clothes, and then she bought clothes from other places to offer more variety. Little by little, and through lots of dedication, Ramona acquired a clientele and started overcoming her financial problems.

However, right now Ramona does not have enough merchandise for the winter season, and so she is requesting a loan for US$ 925, which she is determined to pay back in 6 months. With this money she will be able to buy large lots of clothing to have more variety for her customers. With your help, Ramona will be able to move her business forward and offer her daughters a better future based on education.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Ramona enviudó hace 5 años, quedándose a cargo de sus cuatro hijas que van desde los 8 hasta los 23 años. En ese entonces la mayor tenía 18 y estaba estudiando la preparatoria y los gastos de sus hijas eran muchos. Por lo tanto decidió comenzar a vender ropa de3 segunda en su colonia puesto que en ella no hay un local semejante. Comenzó por vender ropa de sus hijas, y después compró ropa de otros lados para ofrecerles más variedad. Poco a poco y con mucha dedicación Ramona comenzó a adquirir clientes y así salir de los problemas económicos.

Sin embargo actualmente Ramona no tiene suficiente mercancía para invierno, es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $925 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar pacas de ropa para poder tener más variedad para sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Ramona podrá sacar adelante su negocio además de poder brindarles a sus hijas un mejor futuro a base de estudios.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (Comprar mercancía)

loans.name: Ángela Petronila

texts.es:
Angela Petronila M. M. is married. She attended through the sixth grade of primary school, and is not supporting any children. She has a business in her home which she runs together with her husband. She began running the business as a way to help her spouse support their family.

When they opened their business, the children were small, and they saw that it was necessary to begin investing in the business.

She has worked with CEPRODEL for the last three years. She has show that she manages her loans well. They have been very opportune, helping her with cash flow problems in her business.

Now this business is, if not the strongest, at least among the strongest found in Chichigalpa.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Ángela Petronila M. M. es casada, cursó hasta el sexto grado de primaria, no tiene hijos a su cargo, tiene ubicado el negocio en su casa de habitación, el negocio de ella lo lleva a cabo junto con su esposo, ella comienza a administrar el negocio para ayudarle a su marido a sostener la familiar.

Al iniciar el negocio sus hijos estaban pequeños y miraron la necesidad de comenzar a invertir en el negocio.

Trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace tres año, nos manifiesta que se siente muy bien con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido muy oportunos y brindados de manera muy ágil, y que en su momento le sirvieron para solventar problemas de iliquidez en el negocio.

Actualmente este negocio si no es el mas fuerte es uno de los mas fuerte que están en Chichigalpa.

loans.use: Inversion en el negocio

loans.name: Anita Delvis

texts.es:
Anita Delvis Sanchez C. is married with three children who are in school. She finished 5 years of secondary school, and she is responsible for supporting her school aged children. Because her husband's salary is small, she decided to open a small store in her home as a way to help with the household expenses. Her husband works as a truck driver in Ingenio San Antonio.

This customer has worked with CEPRODEL for three years. She has told us that the loans which she has received have been very opportune, providing her with great help in solving issues of business cash flow.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Anita Delvis S. C., casad, cursó hasta el quinto año de secundaria, tiene tres hijos los cuales están estudiando y tiene la responsabilidad de mantener, tiene ubicado una pulpería como negocio en su casa, ella comienza el negocio cuando sintió la necesidad de ayudarle a su marido a sostener la carga familiar, ya que el ingresos que el genera es muy poco, por tal razón, buscando la manera de ayudar con los gastos de la casa es que ella decide emprender este negocio, el marido trabaja con un camión en el Ingenio San Antonio.

Esta cliente, trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace tres año, nos manifiesta que se siente satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido muy oportunos y brindados de manera muy ágil, y que en su momento le sirvieron para solventar problemas de iliquidez en el negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.es:
Militza is 33 years old and has 1 son, Elizabeth is 36 years old and has 4 children, while Nay is 27 years old and has 2 children. Militza, Elizabeth and Nay have been members of the Gratitude Communal Bank for 1 year.

Militza and her husband sell wood. Her husband is a carpenter and, besides manufacturing furniture, they buy and sell wood.

On the other hand Elizabeth sells food, purple liquor, jora liquor (a beverage that is prepared with a special type of corn), and also, together with her husband, she has a motor-taxi.

Nay sells trout, but before she had other businesses which included a beauty parlor, selling imported clothes and also a restaurant. Currently the trout business allows her to attend her children.

They need loans of 1000 soles, 400 soles and 800 soles, respectively, that will be used for the repair of their motor-taxi and the purchase of eucalyptus wood, rice, corn, sugar, jora, cereals, a freezer, and a cooler. They tell us that in their Communal Bank they learned to save and to be punctual and responsible.

Their dreams are to have a lumber business, to live conveniently and want for nothing, to have their own house, to have more capital for their business and to give their children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Militza tiene 33 años y 1 hijo, Elizabeth tiene 36 años y 4 hijos, mientras que Nay tiene 27 años y 2 hijos. Militza, Elizabeth y Nay pertenecen al Banco Comunal Gratitud desde hace 1 año.

Militza junto a su esposo venden madera; su esposo es carpintero y además de fabricar muebles, compran y venden madera.

Por otro lado Elizabeth vende comida, chicha morada, chicha de jora (bebida que es preparada con maíz), y también junto a su esposo tienen un mototaxi.

Nay vende truchas, pero antes ella tuvo otros negocios como salón de belleza, vendía ropa importada y también tenía un restaurante. En la actualidad el negocio de truchas le permite atender a sus hijos.

Ellas necesitan préstamos de 1000 soles, 400 soles y 800 soles, respectivamente, que serán invertidos en la compra de madera de eucalipto, arroz, maíz, azúcar, jora, cereales, congeladora, cooler y para la reparación de su mototaxi. Ellas cuentan que en su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ser puntuales, responsables y a ahorrar.

Sus sueños son tener una empresa maderera, vivir cómodamente y que no le falte nada, tener casa propia, tener más capital para su negocio y que sus hijos tengan una buena educación.

loans.use: To repair their motor-taxi and to buy Eucalyptus wood, rice, corn, sugar, jora (a species of corn), cereals, a freezer and a cooler

loans.name: Paula's Group

texts.es:
Julia is 39 years old with three children, Paula is 37 years old with three children, and Karina is 27 years old with no kids.

Julia, Paula and Karina have belonged to the Gratitud Comunal Bank for 1,4,1 years respectively and Paula is the president of the bank.

Julia makes bread and has a little grocery store. Both business are run in her house and it has been for the last 4 years.

On the other hand, Karina sells treats, in the fairs of Matara and Seccelambras, activity that learned when she helped her aunt.

Paula has a grocery warehouse and she tells us that at the beginning she had a small store and it needed capital and that’s how she joined the Communal Bank. At the present time her grocery warehouse has assorted groceries and has implemented a liquor store, in addition she’s thinking on implementing another didactic department of material for gardens.

They need a loan of $625 together, which will be used to purchase flour, sugar, butter, treats, chocolates, cakes, candy, beer, wine and pisco.

The partners are friends and companions and tell that in the Communal Bank they learned the responsibility, punctuality and mainly the saving. Their dreams are to implement a new business, have more capital, finish their studies and that their children go to university.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Villegas, Kiva volunteer.

Julia tiene 39 años y 3 hijos, Paula tiene 37 años y 3 hijos, mientras que Karina tiene 27 años y no tiene hijos. Julia, Karina y Paula pertenecen al Banco Comunal Gratitud desde hace 1, 4, 1 años respectivamente y actualmente Paula es Presidenta de su Banco Comunal. Julia elabora panes y además tiene una tienda de abarrotes, y ambos negocios los realiza en su casa desde hace 4 años. Por otro lado Karina vende golosinas en las ferias de Matara y Seccelambras, actividad que aprendió cuando ayudaba a su tía. Paula tiene una bodega y nos cuenta que al inicio tenía una tienda pequeña y le faltaba capital y fue así que entró al Banco Comunal. En la actualidad ella tiene una bodega surtida y ha implementado una licorería que cuenta con variedad de productos, además ella piensa implementar otro negocio de material didáctico para jardines. Ellas necesitan préstamos de 400 soles, 600 soles y 800 soles, que serán invertidos en la compra de harina, azúcar, manteca, golosinas, chocolates, galletas, caramelos, cerveza, vinos y pisco. Las socias son amigas y compañeras y cuentan que en el Banco Comunal aprendieron la responsabilidad, puntualidad y sobre todo el ahorro. Los sueños de Julia, Karina y Paula son implementar un nuevo negocio, tener mas capital para su negocio, una tienda de golosinas, terminar sus estudios y que sus hijos estudien en la universidad.

loans.use: Julia, Paula and Karina need a loan of $625, which will be invested in the purchase of flour, sugar, butter, cookies, chocolates, cakes, candies, beer, wine and pisco.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Nguyễn Thị L. is 49 years old. She tends a small stand selling fruits and grocery. This type of business is quite popular amongst the locals. It gives her cash flow to cover her family living expenses and making the weekly payment. Her income is about 4 USD a day. Ms L. lives with her husband, her son and her daughter in the town of Lương Bằng, Kim Động district (near Ha Noi). Her husband helps her a lot in tending her business. Ms L. is a TYM member for 6 years now. She would like to obtain a L. to buy more merchandise, in time for the Tet period (New Year). She's requesting 950 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị L., 49 tuổi, làm nghề bán hàng hoa quả tại thị trấn Lương Bằng, Kim Động. Đây là một nghề phổ biến với người dân trong vùng. Công việc này giúp chị có được những khoản thu nhập hàng ngày để chi phí cho gia đình và trả tiền tuần. Tiền lãi hàng ngày của chị khoảng 4USD. Chị L. sống với chồng và 1 con trai 1 con gái đều đã đến tuổi trưởng thành. Chồng chị là người phụ giúp chị rất đắc lực trong việc kinh doanh. Chị tham gia quỹ TYM đến nay được 6 năm nay. Sắp đến Tết âm lịch, chị rất muốn vay vốn từ TYM để mua thêm nhiều hàng phục vụ cho người dân. Mức vốn đề nghị của chị lần này là 950USD.

loans.use: Buy fruits

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị T., 50 years of age, has been a member of the TYM Fund since 1997. She is living with her husband and three children. In addition to farming its six acres of rice paddy, the family is running an animal husbandry business. The stock is usually composed of hundreds of pigs, hundreds of egg laying hens and chickens for meat, the main source of food for near by poultry processing plants and people in the area. As the result of her efficiency, the income of Mrs. T.’s family has increased from 50USD, before her joining the Fund, to 160USD a month, currently. She figures that in order to expand the family’s animal husbandry business she would need to apply for a loan of 775USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị T., 50 tuổi, là thành viên vào Quỹ từ năm 1997. Chị hiện đang sống cùng chồng và 3 con. Gia đình chị làm 6 sào ruộng. Ngoài việc làm T.ần nông chị còn mạnh dạn cùng chồng đầu tư chăn nuôi gia súc gia cầm. Trong chuồng nhà chị lúc nào cũng có hàng trăm con lợn thịt, vài trăm con gà thịt và đẻ, cung cấp nguồn thực phẩm rất giá trị cho các nhà máy thức ăn gia súc gần nhà chị và cho người dân trong vùng. Nhờ làm ăn có hiệu quả T. nhập của chị T. tăng từ 50USD/tháng (trước khi vào Quỹ) lên 160USD/tháng. Để việc đầu tư phát triển chăn nuôi hiệu quả chị T. rất cần vốn để phát triển chăn nuôi với quy mô lớn hơn, chị đang đề nghị mức vốn vay là 775USD.

loans.use: Expanding the family's animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Trần Thị Thủy is married and has 2 children: 1 son and 1 daughter who are both in school. They own a small piece of land so it cannot bring in enough revenue. So Ms Thủy joined TYM fund and obtained a loan to start a business of handicraft: hand made artificial flowers. This has become the main occupation for her and her family for the last couple of years. Her children give her a big help after school. Her family income is about 150 USD a month. She's requesting a loan of 650 USD which she will use to stock up the material to make the artificial flowers and this would increase her revenue.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị Thủy sống cùng chồng sống với 2 con 1 trai, 1 gái. Các con chị đều trong độ tuổi ăn học, do vậy nếu chỉ trông chờ vào vài sào ruộng khoán thì chị không thể có tiền cho con ăn học. Chính vì vậy mà chị đã tham gia vào Quỹ TYM vay vốn về làm hoa giả. Nghề này đã trở thành nghề chính của gia đình chị Thuỷ nhiều năm nay. Các con chị ngoài giờ đi học còn hỗ trợ cho mẹ rất nhiều. Thu nhập gia đình chị hiện nay bình quân 150USD/tháng. Vòng vốn này chị đề nghị mức vốn là 650USD. Với vốn vay của Quỹ chị Thủy hi vọng có thể mua nhiều sản phẩm về làm hoa và tăng thêm nguồn thu nhập.

loans.use: Buy materials to make artificial flowers

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị T., 23 years of age, has been running her clothing store for 5 years. It is her family’s traditional business. Her husband, Nguyễn Văn Minh, lends her a hand in taking care of the store. Clothing sales are currently booming and profitable. After all expenses, the yearly income is about 3000USD. She often said: “This business of my family always relies on loans.” That’s the reason of her joining TYM Fund. In 5 years, her loans has totaled to 2000USD. This time Mrs. T. is applying for a loan of 950USD for purchasing more goods to get ready for this year’s Tết.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị T., 23 tuổi, mở cửa hàng kinh doanh quần áo cách đây được 5 năm, đây là một nghề chính của gia đình chị. Chồng chị, anh Nguyễn Văn Minh là người thường xuyên hỗ trợ chị trong việc kinh doanh. Nghề kinh doanh hàng quần áo của chị T. hiện nay rất phát triển, sau khi trừ chi phí, thu nhập một năm của gia đình chị khoảng 3000USD. Chị thường xuyên tâm sự, với nghề này thì gia đình tôi lúc nào cũng cần đến nguồn vốn vay. Do vậy chị đã tham gia vào quỹ TYM đã được 5 năm và đã vay tổng số vốn của Quỹ là 2000USD. Hiện nay chị đang đề nghị Quỹ cho chị vay mức vốn 950USD để mua thêm hàng về bán vào dịp Tết âm lịch.

loans.use: Buy clothes

loans.name: Ta Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Tạ Thị T. is 47 years old. She and her husband have 4 children, they live in the town of Lương Bằng, Kim Động district. She opened a clothing store 10 years ago, this is the main revenue for her family. Her husband is a cow seller, he helps her out in his free time. It is hard for her to make ends meet, putting their children in school. But that wouldn't keep her from keeping a happy face. Her store caters to the women clientele from her town as well as the neighbor towns. This time she requests a loan of 950 USD to buy more merchandise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Tạ Thị T., 47 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 4 con tại thị trấn Lương Bằng, Kim Động. Chị mở cửa hàng kinh doanh quần áo cách đây được 10 năm, đây là nghề chính của gia đình chị. Chồng chị ngoài việc đi buôn bò còn thường xuyên hỗ trợ chi trong việc kinh doanh. Cuộc sống vất vả lam lũ để nuôi các con ăn học nhưng lúc nào trên khuôn mặt chị cũng thường trực nụ cười rạng rỡ. Cửa hàng của chị chủ yếu phục vụ những người phụ nữ nơi khu chợ chị bán và các vùng lân cận. Vòng vốn này chị rất mong muốn được vay 950USD để mua thêm hàng về bán.

loans.use: Buy clothes

loans.name: Karla Berenice

texts.es:
Karla is a woman who must care for her mother and her brother, who has cancer in the eye. There are many expenses, besides which Karla has a small daughter of 8 years and is a single mother. That is why she learned to be a stylist and opened a small beauty business with which she maintains all of her family. With a strong desire to make something of her life, Karla has been growing her business little by little.

Nevertheless, she at present considers it necessary to buy furniture, since from time to time she does not have sufficient for her clients. It is for this reason that she is requesting a loan of $375 that she is willing to pay back within 6 months. With this money she will be able to buy a little furniture. With your aid Karla will be able to grow her business, and thus to help her mother and brother, as well as to help her small daughter progress. Do not let this opportunity to help the head of a family pass you by.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Karla es una mujer a la que le tocó estar a cargo de su madre y su hermano, quien tiene cáncer en el ojo y los gastos son muchos, además de que Karla tiene una pequeña hija de 8 años y es madre soltera, es por eso que se preparó como estilista y abrió un pequeño negocio de belleza con el cual mantiene a toda su familia. Con todas las ganas que tiene de ser alguien en la vida Karla ha ido creciendo poco a poco en su negocio.

Sin embargo actualmente considera necesario comprar mobiliario puesto que en ocasiones no cuenta con suficientes para los clientes que tiene, es por esto que está solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar un poco de mobiliario. Con tu ayuda Karla podrá crecer su negocio, y así ayudar a su madre y hermano, así como sacar adelante a su pequeña hija. No dejes pasar esta oportunidad de ayudar a una jefa de familia.

loans.use: To buy furniture

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es:
Raul Gomez has three children to whom he wishes to give the best. However, one of his children has an illness in his bones that prevents him from being independent. This is why his wife devotes herself completely to take care of him, and Raul tries to give his family as much money as possible to be able to cover the expenses of schooling for his other two children as well as medicines and treatments for his son. Raul sells electric appliances and second-hand clothing to be able to make money.

However, right now Raul needs to buy a bigger tent to display the products he is about to buy, and have more variety in his business. This is why Raul is requesting a loan for US$575, which he is willing to pay in a term of 6 months. With this money, Raul will be able to buy a larger tent, as well as stock electric appliances and clothing. With your help, Raul will be able to make enough money to cover his children's expenses, especially the treatments for his sick young son.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Raúl G. tiene tres hijos a quienes desea siempre darles lo mejor. Sin embargo desafortunadamente uno de los hijos tiene una enfermedad en los huesos que lo imposibilita a valerse por sí solo. Es por eso que su esposa se dedica totalmente a brindarle los cuidados y Raúl trata de dar la mayor cantidad de dinero a su familia para poder costear todos los castos de la escuela de sus dos hijos así como los gastos en medicinas y tratamientos para su hijo. Raúl vende aparatos eléctricos y ropa de segunda para poder sacar dinero.

Sin embargo, actualmente Raúl necesita comprar una carpa más grande para poder poner los artículos que está por comprar y así poder tener más variedad en su negocio. Es por eso que Raúl está solicitando un crédito de US $575 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Raúl podrá comprar una carpa más grande así como más surtido en sus electrodomésticos y ropa. Con tu ayuda Raúl podrá sacar dinero para poder cubrir con los gastos de sus hijos en especial con los tratamientos de su pequeño hijo enfermo.

loans.use: Buying a larger tent and more merchandise (Comprar una carpa más grande así como más productos)

loans.name: Cuauhtemoc

texts.es:
The family of Cuautemoc has been working to manufacture powdered brown sugar since their great-great-grandfather. Nevertheless, Cuauhtemoc decided to begin to work in other jobs, which did not serve him so well since he did not earn sufficient money to pay the costs of school for his two children.

That is why Cuauhtemoc decided to continue the tradition of its family and to take advantage of how well he knows how to do this work. It began with a little powdered brown sugar and seed candies to sell to his relatives and friends. Little by little he broke into selling to the small stores that there are in his area. At present they are asking him for a greater assortment which he can not always provide because he does not use machinery to make his work efficient.

That it is why Cuauhtemoc is requesting a loan of $750 that he is willing to pay back in 6 months. With this money Cuauhtemoc will be able to buy a mill and a cane cutter to be able to make his products faster and thus to give him greater stability to his micro-business. With your aid Cuauhtemoc will be able to bring up his family.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La familia de Cuautemoc se dedica a la elaboración de piloncillo desde tu tatarabuelo, sin embargo Cuauhtemoc decidió comenzar a trabajar en otros oficios, lo cual no le sirvió tanto puesto que no sacaba suficiente dinero para pagar los gastos de estudios de sus dos hijos es por eso que Cuauhtemoc decidió seguir la tradición de su familia y aprovechar lo bien que sabe realizar su trabajo. Comenzó con un poco de piloncillo y dulces de semillas para vender entre sus familiares y amigos, y poco a poco se fue abriendo camino entre las tiendas pequeñas que hay en su localidad. Actualmente le están pidiendo mayor surtido el cual no puede en ocasiones cumplir porque no cuenta con maquinaria para eficientar su trabajo.

Es por eso que Cuauhtemoc está solicitando un crédito de US $750 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Cuauhtemoc podrá comprar un molino y una cortadora de caña para poder hacer más rápido sus productos y así darle mayor estabilidad a su micro empresa. Con tu ayuda Cuauhtemoc podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: To buy a mill and a sugar cane cutter

loans.name: Gloria Leticia

texts.es:
Gloria A. is the mother of a 10-year-old boy. She is currently separated from her husband since he would hit her and her son. This is why she had to start a new life with her son, selling shoes among her family members, neighbors, and others. This is how she makes money to support her son.

However, the car in which she travels to sell her products had its tires punctured, so she can't go out anymore to sell shoes. She also lives with her sister-in-law, and she would like to move out because she feels like a burden. This is why she is requesting a loan of $750 that she will repay in 6 months. With this money, she will be able to repair her car so she can go out to sell shoes. She will save the profits she makes to rent a room where she can live with her son. With your help, Gloria will be able to rise above this problem.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Gloria A. es madre de un pequeño de 10 años, y actualmente se encuentra separada de su pareja, puesto que ésta los golpeaba, es por eso que Gloria tuvo que comenzar una vida nueva con su hijo, vendiendo zapatos entre sus familiares, vecinos y recomendados, y así poder sacar dinero para los gastos de su hijo.

Sin embargo el carro en el que sale a vender sus productos se le poncharon las llantas y por lo tanto no puede salir a vender los zapatos. Además de que vive con su cuñada, lo cual ya quiere dejar de hacerlo puesto que se siente una carga. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $750 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Gloria podrá reparar su carro para así poder salir a vender zapatos, y con las ganancias obtenidas poder juntar dinero para poder rentar un cuarto para que vivan Gloria y su hijo. Con tu ayuda Gloria podrá salir delante de este problema.

loans.use: To repair her car so she can sell shoes

loans.name: Lidia Evangelina

texts.es:
Lidia Mendoza is the mother of two kids who are 15 and 8. Unfortunately, she was widowed some time ago, and she was left to care for her children, especially the one who has cerebral palsy. She needs to give him all of her support and to pay for his treatments and therapies. This is why she does extra work cleaning houses and sells shoes in the afternoons.

However, the roof is failing in the place where she sells shoes, and her products will soon be unprotected. This is why she is requesting a credit of $1,125, which she is willing to repay in 6 months. With this money, she will be able to buy a used motorcycle so a family member can help her collect from her clients, and she will also buy more merchandise so she can have a better cash flow for her business. With your help, Lidia will be able to pay her children's expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Lidia Mendoza madre de dos hijos uno de 15 y otro de 8, desgraciadamente Lidia quedó viuda hace tiempo, y ella quedó a cargo de sus hijos, en especial el que tiene parálisis cerebral, a quien necesita darle todo el apoyo además de costearle los gastos de sus tratamientos y terapias, Fue por eso que extra a los trabajos que realiza limpiando casas, por las tardes vende zapatos.

Sin embargo el lugar en el que vende sus zapatos se está cayendo el techo y sus productos se van a quedar desprotegidos. Es por eso que Lidia está solicitando un crédito de US $1,125 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero podrá comprar una motocicleta de segunda que un familiar le podrá ayudar a cobrar todos los pedidos que le hicieron, además de comprar más mercancía y así tener mayor flujo de dinero en su negocio. Con tu ayuda Lidia podrá pagar los gastos de sus hijos.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to be able to collect from her clients and to buy merchandise

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en: Azra B. is married and the mother of five children, two sons and three daughters. Two of her children attend school, and one of son works at a factory. Azra lives in Kamoki, Pakistan, a small, semi-urban town. She and the other members of her group are requesting a group loan of $1,475. Azra will use her loan to repair her husband's truck, which he uses for his transport business.  Rukhsana B. will use her loan to improve her husband's watch and timepiece shop.  Rehana M. will use her loan to help her husband’s cloth business, Zahida Y. will use her loan to expand her husband's tailor business. And Khursheed B. will use her loan to improve her husband's scrap business. All of these women are hardworking and dedicated, and play an important role in bringing income to their families.

loans.use: For improving businesses

loans.name: Ushindi A Group

texts.en:
Mwanaisha, age 24, is married with 2 children (ages 5 and 3). She also takes care of 2 dependents as well (ages 8 and 3). Mwanaisha owns a grocery shop where she sells different food items. She began this business in 2004 and it is now open from 5am to 10pm daily. Every month, she earns about $132 in profit from this business.

In the past, Mwanaisha was able to take out one loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Having paid it back successfully, she now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose. She will be sharing the new loan with her subgroup member Rukia O., who also has a business of selling food items.

loans.use: To buy food stock

loans.name: Nyota Njema A Group

texts.en: Salma, age 31, is a single mother of 2 children (ages 10 and 9) and 2 dependents (ages 10 and 15). She has a business of selling food items, which she began doing in 2002. Now the business is open from 6am to 5pm daily, and she makes a monthly profit of about $176 from this business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more food stock in order to increase her business. She will be sharing this loan with subgroup member Ever T., who also sells food items.

loans.use: To buy food stock

loans.name: Tutashinda_A Group

texts.en: Amina, age 22, is a single mother of 2 children (ages 4 and 1). She is a food vendor, and sells various types of food items at her shop. She began this business in 2006 and now works from 10am to 11pm each day. She hopes for a loan to expand her business and will share this loan with her subgroup member Mariam H., who is also a food vendor.

loans.use: To buy food items for their businesses

loans.name: Marsinah

texts.en: Marsinah is a 44-year-old woman. Before joining MBK, her husband, D., was the only one who worked in the family. But since joining MBK, she started her own business producing bamboo matting at her house. She usually earns about US$ 23 per month. She is requesting a loan of US$ 150 to expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of her bamboo mat business

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en: Nazia A. is from the small town of Kamoki, Pakistan. She is divorced and runs a beauty parlor from her house. This business used to be located in a nearby market, but high operating costs made it necessary to move the business. She also sews clothes for women in her neighborhood. Nazia is the leader of her loan group, and she is requesting a loan to purchase items for her business.  Naheed B. requests a loan to expand her husband's snooker club. Fahmida B. is a widow and will use her loan to improve her beauty parlor business. Bushra B. will use her loan to improve her husband's painting business. All of these women are neighbors, and are very hard working people. These loans will enable them to operate these businesses more efficiently.

loans.use: Buy items for the beauty parlor and improve other businesses.

loans.name: Kartini

texts.en: Kartini is a 33-year-old woman, and together with her husband, H., she started a bamboo mat-making business, earning about US$ 22 per month. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 125 to expand her matting business. Since Kartini joined MBK her business is doing increasingly well. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of her bamboo mat business

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en: Nazira B. is from the mid-sized, industrial city Gujranwala, Pakistan. She is a married mother of five children who all attend school. Her husband is a shoe maker. He creates fashionable shoes and supplies shoe sellers in various cities. He has many clients, and he can improve his profits by buying shoe-making supplies in bulk in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. Nazira is requesting a loan of $825 to purchase these supplies in bulk.

loans.use: To purchase shoe-making material in bulk

loans.name: Dini

texts.en: Dini is a 44-year-old woman who makes a living by producing bamboo matting at her house. She usually earns about US$ 22.50 per month. Her husband, S., has no fixed job. She needs a loan of US$ 150 to expand her business so she can support her family and provide for their needs. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of her bamboo mat business

loans.name: Neneng

texts.en: Neneng is a 30-year-old woman whose husband, M., has no fixed income. So, to cover day-to-day necessities, she sells  foods such as noodles, fried snacks, etc., and usually earns about US$ 2.50 - $3.50 per day. Neneng is a member of MBK and is requesting a US$ 75 loan to buy more goods for her food stall so that she can provide tuition for her children's education. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her stall

loans.name: Rasheeda's Group

texts.en: Rasheeda B. is from the second largest city in Pakistan, Lahore. She is married and the mother of six children; four sons and two daughters. She works as a cook for a local family.
