Her husband drives a van, her eldest son is a turner, the next oldest operates a car tires business, and the third one operates a construction business. Rasheeda is requesting a loan to buy construction supplies for her son's business. She is the leader of her loan group. The other members are: Zarina B., who requests a loan to improve her husband's fruit-selling business; Hameedan B., who requests a loan to buy her husband a rickshaw for his transport business; Saira B., who requests a loan for her cloth and material business; and Sabeeka B. who will use her loan to improve her son's embroidery business. All of these women have proven that these loans do make a difference to their lives, and they are very active and responsible. They always come at the group meetings punctually and never delay their loan installments.

loans.use: To improve businesses

loans.name: Sumiyati

texts.en: Sumiyati is a 38-year-old woman who has a "corner grocery store" where she sells snacks, household goods, cigarettes, rice and many other things. She is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 100 to buy more goods for her store. Her husband, T., has no fixed income, so she has to work hard to provide for her children's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her store

loans.name: Haneefan's Group

texts.en: Haneefan S. is the mother of four children. Three of them attend a local school and the eldest is a tailor. He could not study because of the family's poor financial circumstances when he was of school age. But now, the family's financial circumstances have grown much better. Her husband is a contractor, and he constructs buildings on contract. She will use her loan to buy construction supplies so her husband can build rental units to increase the family's income. Haneefan wishes to help others in her community, so she has become the leader of her loan group, which includes four other women.  Maqbool B. will use her loan to manufacture embroidery frames. Zarina B. will use her loan to help her husband's construction business. Zarina T. will use her loan to improve her husband's scrap business. Salma B. will use her loan to buy toys in bulk for her toy business.

loans.use: To improve businesses

loans.name: Suniah

texts.en: Suniah is a 60-year-old widow. Her husband passed away a long time ago, leaving her to work hard by herself to cover the family's daily needs. She sells vegetables at her stall, earning about US$ 11.50 per week. Previously, she sold other foods, but that business did not grow very well, so she has decided to concentrate on vegetable sales now. She is requesting a loan of US$ 125 to expand her little business and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of her little vegetable stall

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en: Rehana B. has been married to Saleem Maseeh for for 17 years and has five children: three sons and two daughters. They live in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. Saleem has a construction business, and all of her sons work too. Rehana used to work for a boutique, but cannot work anymore due to health problems. She contributes to her family's income by being the leader for her loan group. She will use her loan to purchase items for her husband's business. The other group members are:  Anees L. and Fozia R., who will also use their loans to help their husbands' construction businesses; Suriya L., who will use her loan to purchase a machine for her sewing business;  and Rasheeda B., who will use her loan for her cloth and material business.

loans.use: To improve businesses

loans.name: Aisah

texts.en: AsiaH.is a 45-year-old woman wH. raises ducks at her house. After sH. has raised and fattened them, sH. can sell her ducks. SH. can earn about US$ 50 per month. Her husband has no fixed income. SH. needs a US$ 125 loan to expand her little poultry business. SH. is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 montH..

loans.use: Expansion of her little poultry business

loans.name: Saeedan's Group

texts.en: Saeedan B. is from Lahore, a big metropolis in Pakistan. She is married and has eight children: two daughters and six sons. Currently, only two her children attend school. Her husband has a construction business and is helped by one of their sons. They earn $ 300 a month.  Saeedan is the leader for her group, which includes four other women. Saeedan will use her loan to buy materials for her husband's construction business; Anwer B. will use her loan for her husband's tailoring business; Naymat B. will use her loan to improve her cosmetics business; Zarina B. will use her loan for her sewing business; and Sughran B. will use her loan to improve her son's sanitary store.

loans.use: To improve businesses

loans.name: Naawati

texts.en: Naawati is a 45-year-old woman. She has a small shop where she sells snacks, food and drinks, along with household products. She can earn about US$ 5.50 per day. Her husband, M., has no fixed income. She is requesting a US$ 100 loan to buy more goods for her shop. Naawati hopes that she can increase her income to be able to pay for her children's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her little grocery shop

loans.name: Iim

texts.en: Iim is a 28-year-old woman. She has a small shop where she sells snacks, household goods, cigarettes, rice, and many other things. She can earn US$ 44.50 per month, due to the amount and variety of goods she has in stock. Iim is requesting a loan of US$ 150 to buy more goods for her shop. Her husband, A., has no fixed job, so she has to work hard for the family's needs and her children's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her little general store

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Mrs. Heng V. T., 41, works with her husband on their farmland growing rice and typically earns on average around US$ 6 each day in revenue. She has three children. One of them is employed at a garment factory and the other two are enrolled in school. Mrs. Heng V. T. hopes to use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her farm. She believes this loan will enable her to expand her crops and to raise her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Hartati

texts.en: Hartati is  a 35-year-old woman who has a small shop where she sells snacks, household goods, cigarettes, rice, and many other things. She can earn US$ 44.50 per month, due to the amount and variety of goods she has in stock. Hartati is requesting a US$ 75 loan to buy more inventory for her shop. Her husband, N., has no regular income, so she has to work hard to cover the family's daily needs and her children's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her little "corner grocery shop"

loans.name: Enah

texts.en: Enah is a 40-year-old woman who collects and sells waste and scrap materials. Sometimes she sells spare parts upon request. She can earn about US$ 5 per day and it's just enough to cover their daily needs. Her husband, A., has no fixed income. She needs a  loanof US$ 75 to expand her recycling business and make it more sustainable. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of her recycling business

loans.name: Sayamah

texts.en: Sayamah is a 40-year-old woman. She sells eggs door-to-door around the village. She usually earns about US$ 15 per week. Her husband, M., has no fixed income. She very much wants to get a loan of US$ 150 so that she can earn more income for her children’s education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion  of her ambulant egg-selling business

loans.name: Maesaroh

texts.en: Maesaroh is a 27-year-old woman. She raises goats at her house. She has to care for and feed them every day. She can sell them after six months, earning about US$ 20 per 6 months. Her husband, S., has no fixed income. She is requesting a loan of US$ 125 to expand her little livestock business and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of her livestock business

loans.name: Dy

texts.en: Mrs. Dy C., 47, is the mother of three married children and works with her husband selling traditional medicines in her community, earning collectively about US$ 5 each day in profit. This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle to use for their business transportation and buy more medicines in order to expand their inventory. In the future, Mrs. Dy C. hopes to save a lot of money to keep investing in and expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use for her business transportation and buy more medicines in order to expand her inventory

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Dy Chorn has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Mrs. Keo C. D., 26, is married with two little children who are still too young to attend school. They live in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia. She runs a stand selling ice to the people in her area and typically earns around US$ 4 each day in revenue. Her husband works as a veterinarian and also at carpentry, making on average US$ 10/day in revenue.

Mrs. Keo C. D. has humbly requested a loan to invest in her business and to purchase more veterinary medicines and wood to expand her husband's two businesses. (Her husband is pictured in his carpentry workshop.)

loans.use: To invest in her business and to buy more veterinary medicines and wood for her husband's businesses

loans.name: Alizakir

texts.ru:
Alizakir B. lives in Saatli, Azerbaijan. He is 50 years old, is married and has 3 children. Alizakir is the sole provider for his family and his sole means of income is raising cattle. Every year he purchases young calves from households in nearby villages, then grows them in his household for 8-9 months and afterwards sells them to local butchers.

Today, Alizakir is thinking about expanding his business, as the profits from his current livestock are not enough to support his 3 children. He plans to expand his annual purchase of calves by 5 heads. In order to do this he needs to invest $500 in his business. Alizakir has turned to Normicro – a KIVA partner - in order to receive a loan for this sum.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Mr. Ализакир живет в городе Саатлы Республики Азербайджан, расположенном в Закавказье. Ему 50 года, он женат, имеет 3-х детей. Ализакир является единственным кормильцем семьи и имеет единственный доход от выращивания и продажи крупного рогатого скота на местном базаре. Ежегодно он покупает молодых телок с приусадебных хозяйств близлежащих деревень, выращивает их в течении 8-9 месяцев в своём хозяйстве и затем продаёт уже повзрослевших коров и быков местным мясникам. Сегодня Ализакир думает о расширении своего бизнеса, т.к. дохода с нынешнего стада не хватает для обеспечения необходимых потребностей его 3-х детей. Он планирует расширить ежегодный обьём закупок телят на 5 штук больше. Для этого ему требуется инвестировать в его бизнес около 500 долларов. Чтобы получить эту сумму, Ализакир обратился в микро кредитную организацию "Нормикро" - партнёру КИВА - для получения кредита.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mr. Sim S., 61, is married with four children and lives with his ailing wife in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He works as a taxi driver to generate income and typically earns around US$ 5 each day in profit. Two of his children are employed at a garment factory, while the other two are unemployed.

Mr. Sim S. works very hard every day to earn money for his wife’s medical treatment and also for his family's daily expenses. He is presently requesting a loan to purchase a better car for his taxi business because his current car is frequently broken and he wastes a lot of money getting it repaired over and over.

loans.use: To buy a better car for his taxi business

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Mr. Sim S., 61, is married with four children and lives with his ailing wife in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He works driving a taxi to generate his income and typically earns around $5 each day of profit. Two of her children are employed at a garment factory, while the rest of whom two are unemployed. Mr. Sim S. works very hard every day to economic money for his wife’s treatment and also for his daily’s expense. Recently, he has requested for a loan to change a new car for his business because his current car is frequently fixed and waste him a lot of money.

loans.use: To  change a new car for his business because his current car is frequently fixed and waste him a lot of money.

loans.name: Soa

texts.en:
Mrs. Soa C. O., 42, is the mother of three children and works at a market selling a variety of grocery products and shoes, earning on average around US$ 5 each day. Her husband, meanwhile, works driving a motor-taxi, making about US$ 5/day. Two of her children are enrolled in school and the other is still too young to go to school.

Mrs. Soa C. O. hopes to use this loan to purchase more grocery products to expand her inventory so as to meet her growing customer demands.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to expand her inventory and meet her growing customer demands

loans.name: Amin

texts.en: Mr. Amin is a low-income vulnerable person. He is 41, married with two children, and lives in the village of Saatli city in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Amin owns a small flock of sheep and some cows. The business is going well but needs some improvement. Amin plans to increase the number of lambs he purchases to make his income higher. His family expenditures are increasing as his children grow. Amin has the application to receive a $500 loan approved by the Normicro Saatli branch. He hopes this credit will allow him to change his family life.

loans.use: To buy lambs

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Kouvi A., born in 1981 in Lomé, is married and has two children. A trained beautician, she has a little beauty salon. To equip her beauty salon, she is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 which she plans to use to purchase cosmetics and hairdressing products for her shop so that she can better serve her customers. She also wants to sell these products to her customers. This loan will provide much needed impetus for a devoted entrepreneur who manages her business carefully. It should allow her to increase the income she makes from her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame A. Akouvi est née en 1981 à Lomé, mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Coiffeuse de formation, elle dispose d’un salon. Pour aménager son atelier de coiffure elle sollicite un financement de $1000 qui va lui permettre d’acheter des produits de beauté et de coiffure pour son salon en vue de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Aussi elle veut faire la commercialisation de ces produits. Ce financement lui donnera un grand souffle pour le dévouement dont elle fait preuve et son aptitude à gérer son affaire avec rigueur et surtout améliorer ses prestations et rendement.

loans.use:
Equiping her beauty shop and purchase of cosmetics

Aménagement de son salon de coiffure et achat de produit de beauté

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Born at Bè in Lomé (Togo), Mr. Kodjo A. is a bicycle mechanic. He lives in Hédzranawoé-Sokpanou in Lomé with his wife who does not work outside the home and their two children. As the only breadwinner for his family, Mr. Kodjo A. does not know where to turn to satisfy everyone's needs. He does not have capital to invest in buying more sophisticated tools or the spare parts he needs to sell to his customers. He would like to receive a loan of US$ 800 to use as business capital so that he can improve the service he offers his clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Né à Bè à Lomé et âgé de 24 ans, Monsieur Kodjo A. est un mécanicien à deux roues. Il habite le quartier Hédzranawoé-Sokpanou à Lomé avec sa femme sans emploi et leurs deux (02) enfants. Se trouvant seul face aux besoins de sa famille, monsieur Kodjo A. ne sait à quel saint se vouer pour pouvoir les satisfaire tous. De même, il manque de fonds pour se procurer des matériels de travail bien sophistiqués et des pièces de rechange qu’il vendait à sa clientèle. Il aimerait avoir un crédit de $800 comme fonds de roulement et d’équipement pour améliorer le service qu’il offre à sa clientèle.

loans.use:
Procuring spare parts for bicycles for re-sale

Ravitaillement en pièces détachées

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr:
Born in 1981, Mr. Komi A. is married and the father of three children. A barber by trade, he is asking for a Kiva loan of US$ 1000 which he plans to use to renovate his barbershop and acquire some up-to-date tools of his trade. This should permit him to expand his clientele and make his business more profitable so that he can do better by his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Né en 1981, Monsieur A. Komi est marié et père de trois (3) enfants. Coiffeur de formation, il sollicite à travers ce projet un crédit de $1000 qui va lui servir à rénover son salon et acquérir d’autres matériels de travail plus performant. Ceci lui permettra d’attirer plus de clientèles et mieux rentabiliser son activité afin de mieux s’occuper de sa famille.

loans.use:
Renovation of his workshop and purchase of some tools of his trade

Rénovation de son atelier de coiffure et achat de matériel de travail

loans.name: Miwonougnui

texts.fr:
A tailor by trade, Mr. Miwonougnui A., 31, was born in Vogan (Togo) . He is married and the father of three children. With his limited means, he has a rented workshop where he presently is training some 15 apprentices. With this great number of people dependent on him, he is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 so that he can purchase new machines and enlarge his workshop. This will make things easier for his apprentices as well as for him. Achieving these goals will have a positive effect on his output.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Tailleur de profession, Monsieur Miwonougnui A. est né à Vogan et âgé de 31 ans. Il est marié et père de trois (03) enfants. Avec son moyen de bord, il dispose d’un atelier qu’il a loué et a actuellement une quinzaine d’apprentis. Devant ce grand nombre, il demande un prêt de $1000 pour acquérir de nouvelles machines et agrandir son espace d’activité. Ce qui mettra également à l’aise ses apprentis. La réalisation de ce projet augmentera sensiblement son rendement.

loans.use:
Purchase of new machines and enlarging his workshop

Achat de nouvelles machines

loans.name: Finè

texts.fr:
Mrs. Finè O. is married and the mother of four children. Her principal business venture is selling cooked food (a restaurant serving African cuisine). She needs to be able to stock grains and other foodstuffs for use in her little restaurant. To resolve the problems she encounters in managing her restaurant, she is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 so that she can satisfy her customers' needs in a timely manner. This loan will allow her to buy bags of corn, vegetables, and condiments to have on hand.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 35, Madame O. Finè est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Son activité principale est la vente de denrées alimentaires (restaurant à la cuisine africaine). Son programme à travers ce projet est de s’approvisionner en produits alimentaires et céréales pour son restaurant. Pour résoudre un certain nombre de problèmes qu’elle rencontre dans l’exercice de son activité, elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 afin de pouvoir satisfaire dans les délais les commandes de ses clients. Ceci lui permettra de s’approvisionner en sacs de maïs, légumes, et autres condiments.

loans.use:
Buying food ingredients for her little restaurant

Approvisionnement en produit alimentaire pour son restaurant

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Mrs. Adjo E., born in Ghana, is 34 and the mother of three children. A seamstress by trade, she lives in Hédzranawoé in Lomé with her husband who is an automotive electrician. With the meager income she makes from her work, she helps her husband support the family and especially pay school fees for their children. She is requesting a loan of US$ 800 to refurbish her workshop and purchase new sewing machines and other equipment she needs for her work.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame Adjo E., née au Ghana est âgée de 34 ans et mère de trois (03) enfants. Couturière de profession, elle habite le quartier Hédzranawoé à Lomé avec son mari, un électronicien auto. Avec le maigre revenu qu’elle retire de son activité, elle aide son mari à subvenir aux besoins de leurs enfants et surtout leur scolarisation. Elle sollicite alors un crédit de $800 pour rénover son atelier et acheter des nouvelles machines à coudre et d’autres matériels de travail dont elle a besoin pour mieux faire son travail.

loans.use:
Refurbishing of her workshop and purchase of new sewing machines

Rénovation d'atelier et achat de nouvelles machines

loans.name: Sister

texts.fr:
Mrs. Sister A. was born on July 20, 1962 in Vogan (P/V), Togo. Married and the mother of eight children, she lives with her husband who is a taxi driver. Mrs. Sister A.'s business is selling kindling. She buys it wholesale or else buys a tree trunk and has it split by specialists. This is a flourishing business, but because she lacks capital to invest in it, she is not always able to satisfy the needs of her clientele. She is asking for a Kiva loan of US$ 1000 which will allow her to have a consistant quantity of kindling on hand so that her customers will not have to be turned away.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame A. Sister est née le 20 Juillet 1962 à Vogan (P/V). Mariée et mère de huit (8) enfants, elle vit avec son mari qui est un chauffeur de taxi. Madame A. Sister a pour activité le commerce de fagot de bois. Elle achète en gros ou achète un tronc d’arbre qu’elle fait scier par les spécialistes. C’est un commerce très florissant mais faute de moyens elle n’arrive pas à être à la hauteur de sa clientèle. A travers ce projet, elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 qui servira à faire un stock consistant de fagot de bois afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.

loans.use:
Purchase and re-sale of kindling

Achat et vente de fagot de bois

loans.name: Ayayi

texts.fr:
Mr. Ayayi A. is 32, married, and the father of three children. He lives in Bè-kpota, a neighborhood in Lomé, the capital of Togo, and runs a little restaurant where he prepares only pork, a dish the local inhabitants dearly love. Very ambitious and intent on improving his little business, he is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to refurbish his restaurant and hire some new waitresses so as to better satisfy his clientele. He would also like to sell drinks since his customers are asking him to do so. This will allow him to earn more and thus support his family better.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur Ayayi A. est âgé de 32 ans. Il est marié et père de trois (03) enfants. Il habite le quartier de Bè-kpota et détient un restaurant où il prépare uniquement la viande de porc très apprécié par la population. Très ambitieux et voulant rehausser son activité, il sollicite un financement de $1000 pour l’aménagement de son restaurant et acquérir de nouvelles serveuses pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Il veut aussi associer la vente de boissons sur demande de ses clients. Ceci lui permettra d’accroître son revenu pour le mieux être de sa famille.

loans.use:
Refurbishment of his restaurant

Aménagement de restaurant

loans.name: Folly

texts.fr: Né en 1989 à Lomé, Monsieur A. Folly est élève et fait l’élevage et la vente du porc pour se supporter dans ses études. Il a commencé cette activité depuis bientôt 5 ans mais faute de moyens il n’arrive pas à bien développer son élevage et n’en profite pas assez. Il sollicite un financement de $1000 qui lui servira à acquérir d’autres races de porcs sur les marchés intérieurs. Ceci va lui permettre d’avancer dans ses études et subvenir à ses besoins.

loans.use: Achat de nouvelles races de porcs

loans.name: Folly

texts.fr:
Married and the father of four children, Mr. Folly H. was born on April 17, 1967. He lives in Djidjolé, a district of the capital, Lomé, with his wife, who does not work outside the home. He drives a motorcycle taxi. Presently, his motorcycle is broken and is not in working condition, but he does not have the means to buy another. Faced with this difficult situation, he is obliged to help out a friend who has a mill in order to make ends meet. He is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase a new motorcycle so that he can pursue his chosen business appropriately and support his family so that they will have a brighter future.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Marié et père de quatre (04) enfants, monsieur Folly H. est né le 17 Avril 1967. Il habite le quartier Djidjolé à Lomé avec sa femme, une ménagère. Il est conducteur de taxi moto. Actuellement sa moto est en panne et ne fonctionne plus mais il n’a pas aussi les moyens d’acheter une autre. Devant cette situation il est obliger d’aller aider un ami qui dispose d’un moulin afin de joindre les deux bouts. Il sollicite un crédit de $1000, pour l’achat d’une moto neuve afin de pouvoir exercer convenablement son activité et faire face aux charges du ménage pour un développement meilleur.

loans.use:
Purchase of a motorcycle taxi

Achat de taxi moto

loans.name: Folly

texts.fr:
Born in 1989 in Lomé, Mr. Folly A. is still a student and is raising and marketing pigs to finance his studies. He began this work almost 5 years ago, but because he lacks capital to invest in his business, he is not able to develop it and earn as much from it as he potentially could. He is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 which will allow him to buy some new breeds of pigs at up-country markets. This will permit him to further his studies and support himself.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Né en 1989 à Lomé, Monsieur A. Folly est élève et fait l’élevage et la vente du porc pour se supporter dans ses études. Il a commencé cette activité depuis bientôt 5 ans mais faute de moyens il n’arrive pas à bien développer son élevage et n’en profite pas assez. Il sollicite un financement de $1000 qui lui servira à acquérir d’autres races de porcs sur les marchés intérieurs. Ceci va lui permettre d’avancer dans ses études et subvenir à ses besoins.

loans.use:
Purchase of new breeds of pigs

Achat de nouvelles races de porcs

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akou A. was born in 1977 and is married and the mother of two children. Her main business is selling personal care products which she presently carries through the streets in a basin balanced on her head. Very ambitious and intent on helping her husband provide for their family, she is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 1000 so that she can open a little kiosk where she can display and sell her products. This will free her from the necessity of walking from place to place to sell her wares.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame A. Akou est née en 1977, marié et mère de deux (2) enfants. Son activité principale est la vente des produits cosmétiques qu’elle fait promener dans les quartiers. Très ambitieuse et voulant plus contribuer aux charges du ménagé, elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour ouvrir un petit kiosque et exposer ses produits. Ceci l’épargnera des kilomètres qu’elle parcourt afin de vendre ses produits.

loans.use:
Opening a little kiosk for her personal care products business

Achat et vente de produit cosmétique

loans.name: Valentin

texts.fr:
Married to a housewife and the father of one child, Mr. Valentin A. is 38. He is a tailor by trade and lives in the Toyota Bar area of Lomé, where he has a little tailor shop. He is asking for a loan of US$ 600 to buy a sewing machine, improve the look of his workshop, and add a little notions department. Thanks to this loan, he believes he can improve the attractiveness and interest of his shop and attract a lot more clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Marié à une ménagère et père d’un (01) enfant, monsieur Valentin A. est âgé de 38 ans. Couturier de profession, il réside au quartier Toyota Bar à Lomé où il dispose un atelier. Il sollicite un crédit de $600 pour l’achat des machines à coudre et l’aménagement de son atelier en ajoutant un petit commerce de mercerie. Grâce au financement de ce projet, il va changer l’image de son atelier et attirer beaucoup de clientèle.

loans.use:
Purchase of a sewing machine and remodeling a workshop

Achat de machine à coudre et aménagement d'atelier

loans.name: Zaynab

texts.en: Zaynab is a 25-year-old woman. She is single and lives in the Beirut suburbs. Zaynab loves computers and enjoys working in this sector. She repairs and carries out the maintenance of computers. Zaynab needs $300 to buy the needed material to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy material for her business

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya lives in Pavlograd with two of her grown children. She is a private entrepreneur and sells children’s clothing and footwear in the central city market. Nataliya is a widow and her business is the only source of income for the family. The inventory she offers for sale in her kiosk is very high quality. Nataliya is very friendly which attracts many potential customers to her vending spot. She has been in this trade for 14 years and recently purchased a small store location. Currently, her turnover capital is about $6000. Her net profit is about $800 a month.

Today Nataliya is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase 30 pairs of shoes and 40 children’s suits. She is hoping to continue growing her business and open a new vending facility selling women’s clothing items. Nataliya is very independent. She has learned to figure out solutions on her own, get all aspects of her business running single-handedly and make quick decisions when faced with challenges. We believe Nataliya’s strong will and perseverance will help her succeed and repay this current loan.

loans.use: To purchase 30 pairs of shoes and 40 children’s suits

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married with a 23-year-old daughter. She and her family live in Izyum. Svetlana works in the Kolkhoznyi market near the train station. She sells fresh pork meat which is always in demand, as Ukrainian cuisine is famous for its delicious pork dishes. Svetlana has been in this business for 20 years. After being unemployed for quite awhile, she was looking for job opportunities and decided to start her own business selling pork meat in the local market. Svetlana knows how hard it is to earn the money. She puts in many long hours to get the job done and make sure her business achieves its full potential. She realizes this business is very competitive but is ready to make the effort to succeed and come out on top. She admits she has benefited a lot from the financial assistance she has received through Nadiya Ukraine. Presently, her net profit from her business is about $600-1000 per month. 

Today Svetlana is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase more pigs to sell.

loans.use: To purchase pigs

loans.name: Agbégnigan Mawuna

texts.fr:
Mr. Agbégnigan Mawuna E., 34, is married and the father of two children. He repairs electric motors. He is asking for a loan in the amount of US$ 1000 which he will use to purchase both tools for his trade and accessories to sell, so that he can serve his clientele and also improve his profit margin to better support his family and himself.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agé de 34 ans, monsieur E. Agbégnigan Mawuna est marié et père de deux (2) enfants. Son activité est basée sur le rembobinage des appareils électriques. Il demande un prêt $1000 qui va lui servir d’acheter des fournitures pour son travail et des accessoires à vendre afin de mieux servir à temps les clients et gagner un marge pour subvenir à ses besoins et celui de sa famille.

loans.use:
Purchase of tools for his trade and sale of electronic parts

Achat de matériel de travail et vente des pièces électroniques

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en: Shamim A. lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is marriend and has six children: three sons and three daughters. She works as a cook for a local family, and her husband is a daily wage laborer. One of her sons is a textile artist, and he embroiders clothes for a small wage. He has seven years experience in his work, and Shamim, the leader of her group, will use her loan to help her son start his own shop and hire a few workers. The other members of her group are Shamshad R. who will also help her son with his embroidery business; P. J., who will help her son improve his paint business; Meena A., who will use her loan to improve her husband's fruit business; and Rubina P., who will use her loan to improve her beauty salon. All of these women are very brave and are trying very hard to uplift their family's financial status.

loans.use: To start a business and improve other businesses

loans.name: Dédé Jacqueline

texts.fr:
Mrs. Dédé Jacqueline A. was born on September 25, 1963. A widow, she lives in the area of Djidjolé in Lomé, the capital of Togo, with her two children. She sells shoes, which she presently displays on the roadside. She is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 so that she can open a little shop so as to be able to display and sell various sorts of shoes. With this loan in hand, she will be able to purchase her wares wholesale and thus earn much more profit on each sale. In this way, she will be better able to care for her children. She is counting on your support and help.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame Dédé Jacqueline A. est née le 25 septembre 1963. Veuve, elle habite le quartier Djidjolé à Lomé avec ses deux (02) enfants. Elle est commerçante de chaussures qu’elle expose sur l’étalage au bord de la route. Elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour ouvrir une boutique et pouvoir vendre diverses sortes de chaussures. A partir de ce crédit, elle va réaliser beaucoup de bénéfice sur ses produits en les achetant en gros chez les grossistes, afin de pouvoir faire face à tous les besoins de ses enfants. Elle compte sur votre aide et soutien.

loans.use:
Opening and stocking a little shoe shop

Boutique et ravitaillement en chaussures

loans.name: Akoété

texts.fr:
Mr. Akoété K. was born in Hahotoé on November 11, 1970. Married and the father of three children, he lives with his wife who does hair braiding. Lacking financial means, his parents abandoned him, so he came to live with his brother in Lomé where he was set up in an apprenticeship. He completed the apprenticeship, earning a diploma as shoemaker, and opened a little shop with what meager means he disposed of.

He is presently asking for a loan in the amount of US$ 1000 which he can use to purchase leather and other necessities for his trade so that he can better satisfy the demands of his clientele. He will use the leather and tools he purchases to make shoes and handbags from scratch, and this should help him out of his present difficult situation.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur K. Akoété est né à Hahotoé le 11 novembre 1970. Marié et père de trois (3) enfants il vit avec sa femme qui est une tresseuse ambulante. N’ayant pas suffisamment de moyen, ses parents l’ont abandonné et il rejoint son frère à Lomé qui le ment en apprentissage. Sorti avec un diplôme de cordonnier, il installa son atelier avec son petit moyen de bord.

A travers ce projet, il demande un financement de $1000 qui vont lui servir à l’achat d’autres fournitures et du cuir qui lui manquent afin d’être complet et de mieux satisfaire ses clients. Ce fonds lui servira également à fabriquer des chaussures et sacs pour la vente. Ceci lui aidera à sortir de sa crise.

loans.use:
Purchase of leather and other necessities for his trade as shoemaker

Achat de fourniture pour la fabrication de chaussures

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr:
Mr. Komla K., born on October 22, 1974 in Lomé, is married and the father of three children. After he was obliged to leave school because his parents could not afford to pay school fees, he set up a little shop where he sells motorcycle spare parts. He is presently asking for a loan in the amount of US$ 1000 so that he can pay cash up front to purchase spare parts for his inventory, especially those frequently needed by his customers.

It will be much better if he does not have to purchase on credit the spare parts he resells and if he has a complete inventory of parts at any given time. In this way, he can improve the service he gives his clientele as well as improving living conditions for his family by earning a better profit from his business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Né le 22 Octobre 1974 à Lomé, Monsieur K. Komla est marié et père de trois (3) enfants. Il installa un petit comptoir de vente de pièces détachées moto après avoir déserté les bancs faute de moyens financiers de ses parents. A travers ce projet, il sollicite un prêt de $1000 pour lui servir de s’approvisionner en stock suffisant et au comptant d’autres pièces qui sont souvent demandées par les clients.

Ceci lui facilitera de ne plus acheter à crédit et aussi d’avoir un stock permanent à tout moment afin de mieux servir sa clientèle et aussi favoriser une condition meilleure de vie au sein de sa famille.

loans.use:
Purchase of spare parts for re-sale

Approvissionnement et vente de pieces détachées

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente G., aged 55, has been married to Nimia González, aged 58, for more than 32 years. They live in their own house in a suburb that is around 5km from the town centre. They have three children, all adults who live in different houses.

Vicente has been a security guard for a private company for the last fifteen years in the same area where he lives. But because the salary is not very high and household bills require more money, he decided to open a store with some savings he had managed to accumulate.

This was four years ago, and Vicente doesn’t regret his investment. His business sells all types of store-cupboard essential goods and ingredients such as meat, dairy products, bread, fruit, vegetables, eggs etc.

The loan he is asking for will be used to purchase stock, in particular chicken and beef, as in the suburb where they live there is nowhere to purchase these products and for this reason various customers have requested that he also stock this merchandise, particularly as end-of-the-year festivities are now approaching.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Vicente G. de 55 años de edad esta casado ya hace mas de 32 años con la señora Nimia González de 58 años, ellos viven en casa propia en un Barrio que queda a unos 5 Km. del centro de la ciudad. Tienen tres hijos, todos ya mayores y viven en casas diferentes.

El señor Vicente es guardia de seguridad ya hace 15 años de una empresa privada que esta en el mismo barrio donde vive. Pero como la remuneración salarial no es muy alta y debido a que los gastos de la casa demandan más dinero, él decidió abrir una despensa con unos ahorros que tenía guardado.

Hace ya 4 años que abrió su despensa, y Don Vicente no se arrepiente de su inversión. En su negocio vende todo tipo de insumos de primera necesidad y consumo como por ejemplo: carnes, lácteos, panificados, frutas, hortalizas, huevo, etc.

El crédito que solicita el cliente lo utilizará para la compra de mercaderías como ser: pollos y carne vacuna, pues en el barrio donde se encuentran no hay de donde adquirir estos productos, por lo que fueron solicitados por varios clientes para que también tenga esas mercaderías, mas aun ahora que se aproximan las fiestas de fin de año.

loans.use: Purchase beef and chicken

loans.name: Wilfrido

texts.es:
Wilfrido I., aged 49, is married with four children, one of whom is an adult: two others are currently studying and the youngest is still very little. Wilfrido is the owner of an ice-cream factory and has all the necessary equipment for this job.

His business is located in a strategic place as the area is one with much passing traffic: it is two years old. His wife and one of his children are left in charge of the shop while Wilfrido oversees the ice-cream making process.

The loan that this client is asking for will be used to purchase raw ingredients which he has to import from Brazil, because they are better quality. He will also be able to obtain a very low price if he buys in bulk.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Wilfrido I. tiene 49 años de edad, esta casado y tiene 4 hijos, uno de ellos ya es mayor de edad, otros dos actualmente están estudiando y el último aún es muy pequeño. Wilfrido es propietario de una fábrica de helados y cuenta con todos los equipos necesarios para dicho rubro.

Su negocio esta ubicado en un lugar estratégico por ser una zona de mucho movimiento, tiene una antigüedad de 2 años. Su señora y uno de sus hijos se encargan de la atención del negocio, mientras que Wilfrido se encarga en la elaboración y Fabricación del producto.

El crédito que solicita el cliente es para la compra de materia prima que tiene que traer del Brasil, porque es de mejor calidad, además consigue a un precio muy bajo si compra en cantidad.

loans.use: Purchase of raw ingredients such as : flavourings, essences, colourings, milk powder, cocoa, etc.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es:
Señora Wilma is 36 years old, she lives with her partner and has two children aged 12 and 8: the two are studying at the local public school. They live in their own house which they managed to build with considerable sacrifice.

Wilma has a well-stocked grocery store in her house, from here she sells all sorts of essential goods and supplies, such as sugar, rice, meat, dairy products, bread, tinned goods, etc.

The loan that this client is asking for will be used to purchase merchandise for her business wholesale, as she has already been offered a good price from her suppliers for the end-of-year festivities.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Wilma tiene 36 años, vive en pareja y tiene dos hijos, de 12 años y 8 años, los dos estudian en una escuela publica de la zona, viven en una casa propia que la construyeron con mucho sacrificio.

Wilma tiene una despensa bien surtida en su domicilio, donde vende todo tipo de insumos de primera necesidad tales como azúcar, arroz, carnes, lácteos, panificados, productos enlatados, etc.

El crédito que solicita el cliente es para la compra de mercaderías al por mayor para su negocio, ya que se le presento una buena oferta de sus proveedores por las fiestas de fin de año

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, rice, flour, tinned products and soft drinks.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario is married to Elva: they have three children, all of whom are now adults. Together with his wife, he manages a business selling shoes and sandals for women, men and children.

While his wife and his daughters tend to the shop, Mario travels to different parts of the town offering his merchandise: he also makes some wholesale sales to other businesses in the area.

He wants to invest the loan he is asking for in buying more shoes of different types, sizes and colours.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Mario esta casado con la Sra. Elva, tienen 3 hijos, todos ya son mayores de edad. El negocio que maneja junto con su esposa, es la venta de zapatillas y sandalias para damas, caballeros y niños.

Mientra que su esposa y sus hijas cuidan y atienden el local de ventas, Mario sale a recorrer con las mercaderías ofreciendo en distintos puntos de la ciudad, además de realizar algunas ventas al por mayor a otros negocios de la zona.

El crédito que solicita desea invertirlo en la compra de más calzados de diferentes tipos, tamaños y colores.

loans.use: Purchase leather and rubber shoes and sandals in different sizes and colours.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma is married and has three small children who are still in primary school. The children help Norma with the housework.

Norma has a store from which she sells all types of essential goods. She began her business activities several years ago with a small amount of capital that they managed to save from her husband’s work as a walking salesperson.

Currently, she works attending to business in the store while her husband makes door-to-door sales, delivering their merchandise to other businesses in the area: her husband also works nights as a security guard in a private house.

Norma is asking for a loan in order to buy a freezer, with which she will be able to sell cold drinks which at this time of year in summer are in high demand.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Norma esta casada y tiene 3 hijos menores que están aun en la escuela primaria. Los hijos ayudan a la Sra. Norma en las labores de la casa.

Norma posee una despensa donde comercializa todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad. Inicio sus actividades comerciales hace varios años con un pequeño capital que consiguieron de un trabajo que realizaba su marido como vendedor ambulante .

Actualmente ella se dedica a atender el negocio mientras que el marido realiza ventas a domicilio, repartiendo las mercaderías a otros negocios de la zona; además, el señor trabaja como guardia de seguridad en una casa particular por las noches.

Norma solicita un crédito para comprar un freezer, de este modo podrá vender bebidas bien frías que en esta época de verano son bastante solicitadas.

loans.use: Buy a freezer

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia is single: she has one adult daughter with which she works. Delia started her small business with capital she obtained from selling a property in 2004: later with the help of her daughter the business progressed.

Delia has a rental house with tables, chairs, tablecloths and other equipment for receptions and fiestas. She also makes meals and snacks on request. She tells us that the business is quite profitable and generates a good income.

She wants to continue her business’ expansion, and give her daughter the opportunity of completing her university studies. Delia is asking for credit in order to roof one part of the room: this will create better and more comfortable space.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Delia es soltera, tiene 1 hija mayor con quien ella trabaja. Delia inicio su pequeño negocio con un capital que obtuvo de la venta de una propiedad en el año 2004, luego con la ayuda de su hija fue progresando el negocio.

Delia posee una casa de alquiler de mesas, sillas, manteles, entre otros insumos para recepciones y fiestas. También realizan comidas y bocaditos bajo pedidos. Ella nos cuenta que el negocio es bastante rentable y genera ganancias.

Ella desea progresar cada vez más, y darle la oportunidad a su hija de culminar sus estudios universitarios. Delia solicita el crédito para techar una parte del salón, de este modo tendrá mayor espacio físico y comodidades.

loans.use: Roof one part of the business

loans.name: Cirilia

texts.es:
Cirila is single and has one adult daughter, who works with her in a pharmacy that she owns. The business is ten years old and she tells us that it is going very well.

Cirila is asking for a loan as she wishes to buy stock (medication, make-up, cream, soap etc.) in large quantities. Purchasing them in this form gives an 8% discount on the merchandise, which will help to ensure that her prices are better than those of the competition!

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Cirila es Soltera tiene una hija mayor de edad y que trabaja junto con ella en una farmacia que ella posee. El negocio tiene una antigüedad de 10 años y nos cuenta que les va muy bien.

Cirilia solicita el crédito ya que desea comprar mercaderías (medicamentos, maquillajes, cremas, jabones, etc.) en grandes cantidades, pues adquiriendo de esta forma le conceden un descuento de 8% sobre las mercaderías, lo que le ayuda a que sus precios puedan ser mejores que los de la competencia.

loans.use: Purchase medication, make-up, creams, soap etc.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
Lorenza Benítez is 60 and has been married to Porfirio Benítez, an electrician, for 42 years. They have 3 children, all who are grown and independent professionals.

Lorenza has had a grocery store for 12 years, which she started by selling food to some of the construction workers who worked on a project in front of her house. This activity caused a surge in orders from neighboring vendors who sold basic ingredients. This is how she started her small business.

With the profits generated from her business, she built a salon. Today, apart from her grocery store, she also has a hamburger eatery.

She seeks a loan which will be used to buy products for her store: sugar, meat, milk, noodles, flour, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator

La Sra. Lorenza Benítez tiene 60 años D. edad, esta casada hace 42 años con el Sr. Porfirio Benítez D. profesión electricista, tienen 3 hijos, todos mayores e independientes y profesionales.

Lorenza tiene una despensa con una antigüedad D. 12 años, la cual inició con la venta D. comidas a unos obreros que trabajaban en una construcción frente a su casa; D. esta actividad surgieron pedidos D. los vecinos D. la venta D. algunos productos D. primera necesidad. Así fue como empezó su microempresa.

Con las ganancias que genero la despensa, ella construyo un salón en donD. hoy día, además D. su despensa, también tiene un hamburguesería.

Solicita el crédito para la compra D. mercaderías para su despensa tales como: azúcar, carne, leche, fideos, harina, etc.

loans.use: buy products like sugar, meat, milk, noodles, flour, etc.

loans.name: Clavelina

texts.es:
Clavelina is 36 and has been married to Hermino López for 25 years. She has 2 daughters, both who are young and high school students.

She has a small business where she works hard to buy fish at wholesale and sell at retail. She has been a seasoned vendor 20 years and already has stable client base.

She started out traveling around and selling fish in the small center of Asunción (capital of Paraguay). Later, together with her husband, they bought a motorcycle and sold fish in regions far from their home. Currently, they depend on a truck to distribute fish and furthermore, they opened a small canteen where they offer different types of fast food dishes. The menu varies but is composed of fish and beverages.

The loan they request will be used to buy more fish and vegetables, condiments, and sodas for their canteen.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

La Sra. Clavelina tiene 36 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Herminio López hace 25 años, tienen 2 hijas, ambas menores y estudiantes de la secundaria.

Tienen una microempresa que se dedica a la compra y venta de pescados al por mayor y menor. Mantiene una antigüedad de 20 años y ya posee su clientela formada.

Se iniciaron con la venta de pescado en forma ambulante en el micro centro de Asunción ( Capital del Paraguay ), luego junto con su marido adquirieron una moto y empezaron a vender por las zonas más lejanas a su domicilio, Actualmente cuentan con una camioneta para la distribución y además abrieron un pequeño copetín (comedor) en donde también venden distintos tipos de comidas rápidas, diferentes menús hechos con pescado y bebidas.

Con el crédito desean adquirir más pescados además de verduras, condimentos y gaseosas para el copetín.

loans.use: buy fish, vegetables, condiments, and beverages

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estela is 28 years old, married, and has one daughter who is 10 years old and at primary school.

She has had a small business for several years. It's a small liquor store where she sells different types of drinks. Her business is located in the city center of Mariano Roque Alonso and the name of the business refers to an international route which is called Transchaco.

Because she is in an active busy area, she has very good sales and her customers are usually travelers and residents of neighboring regions

She seeks a loan to invest in her business. She would like to buy different types of drinks like sodas, beers, wines, whiskeys, hard ciders and others since this time of the year, sales increase considerably.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

La Sra. Estela tiene 28 años, esta en pareja y tiene una hija de 10 años que esta cursando la primaria de la educación básica. Posee una microempresa desde hace varios años, es una bodega donde se dedica a la venta de diferentes tipos de bebidas, esta ubicada en el centro de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, y el nombre del negocio es por que se encuentra sobre una Ruta Internacional que se llama Transchaco.

Debido a que se encuentra en una zona de mucho movimiento tiene muy buenas ventas, sus clientes generalmente son viajeros y vecinos de la zona.

Solicita el crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de diferentes tipos de bebidas como gaseosas, cervezas, vinos, whiskys, sidras, entre otros ya que en esta época del año aumenta considerablemente las ventas.

loans.use: compra de diferentes tipos de bebidas como gaseosas, cervezas, vinos, whiskys, sidras, etc.

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is an entrepreneur from the western Ukrainian city of Ivano-Frankovsk. She has a small business selling popular sports clothing at the central produce market in Ivano-Frankovsk. For many years Mariya worked as a baker in a local bakery but she decided to quite her job and start her own business. She has been in business now for seven years. Mariya is divorced and works hard to provide for herself. Her typical monthly income is around $800.

Mariya has requested a loan to help purchase a new supply of hats and sports outfits to sell in her kiosk. This is Mariya’s second loan from Nadiya Ukraine. She benefited from her first loan and was able to increase her inventory. We are glad for this new opportunity to support Mariya in her business endeavors.

loans.use: Purchase inventory of hats and sports outfits

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is a self-employed taxi driver. He lives in the Ivano-Frankosvk region of western Ukraine and works primarily in that area but will take passengers all over Ukraine if necessary. Sergei is married. He and his wife, Victoriya have a little three year old daughter. Driving a taxi has been a good way for Sergei to support his family. He makes about $40-$50 per day after expenses, which is a decent middle wage income.

Sergei has requested a loan to have some repairs and repainting done on his taxi after an accident he had. Sergei has proven to be a reliable loan client with Nadiya Ukraine in the past. We are happy for another opportunity to help this hard-working entrepreneur with his business and livelihood.

loans.use: Taxi repairs and repainting

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya owns a children’s clothing business located at the Europe Market in Kharkov, Ukraine. She is an experienced entrepreneur, having been in business for ten years. With hard work, a sharp business mind and a love for children, she has built a successful, growing business. Divorced with a young son, she uses her business is her main means of supporting her small family.

Natalya has requested a loan of $2000 to help open a new sales location. She hopes to further increase her sales and income and continue her business expansion.

loans.use: To open a new sales location

loans.name: Raisa

texts.en:
Raisa is a successful entrepreneur from the Kharkov region in eastern Ukraine. For the past twelve years, she has operated a successful sales business at the busy Central Market in Kharkov. Raisa is married and has a daughter. Her business has been a good source of income for her family.

Raisa has requested a loan to help develop a new business venture. This is her sixth loan from Nadiya Ukraine. She has big plans for the future and we are excited to help her turn her vision into a reality.

loans.use: To start a new business venture

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana has a business selling women’s lingerie at the Central market in Pavlograd, Ukraine. Her sales kiosk is located at a busy crossing between the clothing and produce sections of the market so she has heavy people traffic and high visibility. Tatyana is an attentive business owner. She is able to rapidly change her assortment of inventory to match changing sales trends. Tatyana is married and has two daughters who are currently attending college.

Tatyana experiences rapid inventory turnover with her business and normally re-supplies her shelves every week. She has requested a loan of $1200 to help purchase new inventory so that she can increase her profits. In the future, Tatyana would love to purchase a car. With the continued success of her business, this and other goals should be within her reach.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Bernabela Del Socorr

texts.es:
Bernabela del Socorro R.is married and has one son, who is in sixth grade. She has a small grocery store, which is located in her home. She started it when her husband retired from the company where he used to work. She has always been a strong woman. She had this business previously but closed it due to health problems. She picked it up again when she saw that their income wouldn't be as much as when her husband was working.

She has worked with CEPRODEL for a year now, and she tells us that she feels very happy with the credits offered to her. They have been timely and offered in an agile manner, and they have let her further supply her business. Currently, her business is in her home, and her husband also helps her with her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Bernabela del Socorro Rodríguez, es casada con un hijo y esposo, curso hasta el sexto grado de primaria, tiene ubicado el negocio de pulpería en su casa de habitación, el negocio lo comienza cuando su marido lo jubilan en la empresa donde trabajaba, ella siempre ha sido una mujer de trabajo fuerte, el negocio lo había tenido anteriormente pero lo había quitado por problemas de salud, lo reactiva cuando observa que los ingresos ya no sería iguales como cuando su marido trabajaba.

Trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace un año, nos manifiesta que se siente muy bien con los créditos otorgados pues han sido muy oportunos y brindados de manera muy ágil, y que en su momento le sirvieron para surtir mas el negocio.

Actualmente este negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación, el esposo también le ayuda en el negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Berta Rosa

texts.es:
Berta Rosa E. G. is married and has two children. She sells bread at home. Nine years ago, when she got married and moved to her current place in Chinandega, she started this business when she noticed there were no bakeries in the area. Yet another motive to open the bakery was to help her husband with the household expenses.

This client has done business with CEPRODEL for five years and is very satisfied with the loans, as they have been timely and granted quickly. Moreover, they helped her improve her business and were useful in face of the current energy problems, when she was forced to buy a generator to deal with power failures.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Berta Rosa E. G. es casada y con dos hijos. Tiene ubicado un negocio de venta de pan en su casa de habitación. El negocio lo comienza cuando se casó con su marido y se mudó a vivir a este lugar en Chinandega hace nueve años, ya que observó que no había ninguna panadería en este lugar. Otro de los motivos por los cuales decidió instalar la panadería fue para ayudar a su marido con los gastos del hogar.

Esta cliente trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace cinco años y nos manifiesta que se siente muy bien con los créditos otorgados pues han sido muy oportunos y brindados de manera muy ágil, y que en su momento le sirvieron para impulsar el negocio, y ahora aún más ya que con los problemas de energía, tuvo que comprar un generador para cuando esta falla.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials.

loans.name: Carla Eloisa

texts.es:
Carla Eloisa A. V. is a young, single professional, who was able to finish her career as Civil Engineer at the UNI in Managua. She runs a grocery store at home. She started this business six years ago, with the help of an older sister, as she had not been able to find a stable job for the past seven years. She is presently very proud of her business.

She has been doing business with CEPRODEL for three years and is very satisfied with the loans, as they have been timely and granted quickly. Moreover, they helped her to make progress, as the income generated by this business has allowed her to improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Carla Eloisa A. V. es una joven profesional, soltera, quien logró coronar su carrera de Ingeniería Civil en Managua en la UNI. Esta clienta tiene ubicado su negocio de pulpería en su casa de habitación desde hace seis años. Decidió emprender el negocio, con la ayuda de una de sus hermanas mayores, debido a las condiciones en las que se encontraba, habiendo pasado más de siete años sin tener un trabajo estable. Hoy en día ella se siente orgullosa de su negocio.

Ella trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace tres años, y nos manifiesta que se siente muy bien con los créditos otorgados pues han sido muy oportunos y brindados de manera muy ágil, y le han servido para salir a delante, ya que a través de los ingresos generados por su negocio, ha podido mejorar las condiciones de su casa.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: David Salomón

texts.es:
David Salomón Marica U. is a married young man, with two children, who finished his secondary education. He runs a wood and cabinet-making shop at home. He got into this business when he finished high-school, was unable to continue his studies and could not find a job. He started as an apprentice at one of the most important shops in the city. At some point, he felt he could work independently, so he started his own business with the savings he had accumulated.

He has been doing business with CEPRODEL for two years and is very satisfied with the loans, as they have been timely and granted quickly. Moreover, they helped him improve his business and offer more products. His business is presently located at his home, strengthened by the granted loans.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

David Salomón Marica U. es un joven casado con dos hijos, quien cursó hasta el quinto año de secundaria. Este cliente tiene ubicado el negocio de ebanistería y carpintería en su casa de habitación, habiendo comenzado en este negocio cuando sale de su bachillerato, ya que no pudo seguir estudiando y no encontraba trabajo. Él comenzó a trabajar como ayudante de carpintería en uno de los talleres más importantes de la ciudad. Llegó un momento en que él sintió que ya podía trabajar por su cuenta y fue cuando decidió iniciar el negocio, con ahorros que había obtenido.

Este cliente trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace dos años, y nos manifiesta que se siente muy bien con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido muy oportunos y brindados de manera muy ágil, y que en su momento le sirvieron para impulsar aún más el negocio y ofertar más productos. Actualmente este negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación, obviamente fortalecido por los créditos otorgados.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Elizabeth Del  Socor

texts.es:
Elizabeth del Socorro A. G., married, has three children under her charge, all of them studying. She completed high-school. Always looking for a way to help the family and cover the household expenses, she decided to start selling meat, in order to increase her income and provide for her children. Her husband, faced with the lack of job opportunities, was forced to emigrate to another country.

As the money sent by her husband was not enough, in order to make ends meet, she started selling meat 16 years ago. She used to be a housewife, but she presently runs an established business at the municipal market.

With 17 loans received to date, she relates that she had not worked with credit before, because she didin’t know how loans worked. Ms. A. has been doing business with CEPRODEL for two years and is very satisfied with the loans, as they have been timely and granted quickly. Moreover, they have helped her make a living for her and her daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Elizabeth del Socorro A. G., casada, tiene tres hijos a su cargo, todos ellos estudiando. Ella cursó hasta el quinto año de bachillerato. Buscando siempre una forma de ayudar a la familia para poder cubrir las necesidades del hogar, ella decidió comenzar a vender carne de res para obtener mayores ingresos y de esta manera darle a sus hijos lo que les faltara, ya que su marido, al no encontrar trabajo, tuvo que emigrar a otro país.

Como sentía que lo que su marido le enviaba era poco, sintió la necesidad de salir adelante y comenzó a vender carne desde hace dieciséis años. Ella era ama de casa, más hoy ya tiene establecido su negocio en el mercado municipal.

Con diecisiete créditos obtenidos, ella nos expresa que nunca había trabajado con crédito por que no tenía idea de cómo se manejaba esto de los créditos. La señora A. trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace tres años, y nos manifiesta que se siente satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido muy oportunos y brindados de manera muy ágil, y que en su momento le sirvieron para salir adelante con sus hijas.

loans.use: Purchase of meat.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara has been married for 5 years. Her husband works as a public transportation driver. They have 2 children. She dedicates herself to clothing sales. She gets the merchandise from the city of Clorinda in Argentina - a city that borders our country and can be reached within minutes.

She has been a long client and has very good payment behavior. Previously, she had no commercial references. La Fundación was the first institution that provided her a loan and thanks to it, she was able to uplift her business.

Currently, she seeks a new loan which will be used to buy clothing at wholesale and at greater discounts.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

La Sra. Sara esta casada hace 5 años, su marido trabaja como chofer de un transporte público, tiene 2 hijos. Ella se dedica a vender ropas, y las compras de los mismos la realiza en la ciudad de Clorinda – Argentina, ciudad que limita con nuestro país y se encuentra a pocos minutos.

Es una clienta muy antigua y con muy buena moral de pago. Anteriormente no tenia referencias comerciales y La Fundación fue la primera institución que le brindo un crédito, y gracias a eso ella pudo levantar su negocio.

Ella hoy solicita un nuevo crédito con lo que podrá adquirir ropas en mayores cantidades y así obtener mayores descuentos.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, pants, skirts, blouses, shorts, and clothing for kids

loans.name: Freddy Alberto

texts.es:
Freddy Alberto Chavarria M. is a married man with one son. He sells new and used clothing in Chinandega city. He began this business 7 years ago, and has worked with Ceprodel for 3 years. He says he began this business when he was without work for a while, and with these sales he could take care of his son.

Since working with Ceprodel for three years, he says he feels good about the previous loans as they have been very timely and accessed easily, and have enabled him to purchase merchandise that he didn’t have.

This business is located near the main bus station in Chinandega.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Freddy Alberto Chavarria M. es un señor casado y con un hijo a su responsabilidad, este cliente tiene ubicado el negocio de venta de ropa nueva y usada en la ciudad de Chinandega. Lo comienza hace siete años, tiene de trabajar con CEPRODEL tres años, dice que este negocio lo emprendió cuando queda sin trabajo por una temporada, y que de esa venta pudo preparar a sus hijos.

Este señor, trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace tres año, nos manifiesta que se siente muy bien con los créditos otorgados pues han sido muy oportunos y brindados de manera muy ágil, y que en su momento le han servido para compra de mercadería que no la tenia en existencia.

Actualmente este negocio está ubicado cerca de la estación principal de buses en Chinandega.

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Inés Maria

texts.es:
Ines Maria Davila C. is married, has completed through the sixth year of primary school and has three children of school age. As all Nicaraguan women she is the pillar of her home and always looking for ways to help her family cover their living expenses.

Eighteen years ago, as a result of her desire to get ahead, she started selling seafood. She started as a peddler selling her products in the streets. She has now established her business in the municipal market with the proceeds of twenty loans that she obtained. She tells us that the goals that she achieved were due to the loans that she obtained from Ceprodel.

This business started with a very small amount of inventory. In time she has acquired more and her sales have increased. Her initial investment was of C $2,000 cordobas (approximately USD $110), which were loaned to see how her business would turn out.

Mrs. Davila has been working with CEPRODEL for three years. She is satisfied with the loans that she has received, they have been appropriate and processed in a timely manner. They have enabled her to cover the expenses of her business and satisfy her clients. She has a history of twenty loans.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Inés Maria D. C. es una señora casada, cursó hasta el sexto grado de primaria, tiene 3 hijos, los tres se encuentran en la edad escolar. Como todas las mujeres Nicaragüenses siempre están siendo el pilar de la casa y buscando siempre una forma de de cómo ayudar a la familia para poder cubrir las necesidades del hogar.

Producto de la necesidad de salir adelante ella comenzó a vender Marisco hace Dieciocho años, comenzó a vender de manera ambulante, es decir andaba en las calles con su pana, en la actualidad ella ya tiene establecido su negocio en el mercado municipal, con veinte créditos obtenidos, ella nos expresa que los logros alcanzados han sido a través de los créditos que ha obtenido en Ceprodel.

Este negocio lo comenzó con una pequeña pana, con el tiempo fue obteniendo más hoy en día sus ventas han incrementado, su capital inicial fue de C$ 2,000 (córdobas) los que un día presto para ver como le iba, fue a si que comenzó con la venta de marisco.

La señora D. trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace tres año, nos manifiesta que se siente satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido muy oportunos y brindados de manera muy ágil, los cuales le han servido para suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela, Ella tiene un record de 20 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase of seafood.

loans.name: Leonel

texts.es:
Leonel M. A. is a married man, but his children no longer depend on him. He has his business located in the municipal market. He has sold cheese for 30 years and has worked with CEPRODEL for 7 months. He tells us that he started his business when he had to retire from his job, and he used this business to take care of his children.

Leonel tells us that he feels very satisfied with the credits that have been offered to him, and they have been timely and offered in an agile manner. They have let him buy more merchandise that he didn't used to have. Currently his business is located in the municipal market of Chinandega.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Leonel M. A. es un señor casado pero sin hijos a su cargo, este cliente tiene ubicado el negocio en el mercado municipal, el negocio de el es venta de queso lo comienza hace 30 años, tiene de trabajar con ceprodel 7 meses, dice que este negocio lo emprendió cuando lo jubilan de su trabajo, y de esa venta pudo preparar a sus hijos.

Este señor, trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 7 meses, nos manifiesta que se siente muy bien con los créditos otorgados pues han sido muy oportunos y brindados de manera muy ágil, ya que en su momento le han servido para compra de mercadería que no la tenía en existencia. Actualmente este negocio siempre esta ubicado en el mercado municipal de Chinandega.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Marlenis

texts.es:
Mrs. Merlenis R. is 41 years old, originally from Bluefields, married, and has two children. She has been selling products such as children’s clothing, men’s cologne and women’s undergarments among other products, for the past 5 years. Marlenis also is an elementary school teachers, but because of the low salary that teachers receive she also has to sell these products. In order to sell the products Marlenis has some acquaintances who give her orders for products and she then provides easy ways to pay for the products. She makes her sales when she visits her customer’s homes and also sells to her colleagues at work, in other words other teachers. She purchases products in the capital, Managua, where she gets them at a good price, and she travels there every 3 or 4 months depending on her orders. 

Mrs. R., the small businesswoman, needs financing to purchase the following items: 1 dozen women’s sandals at US$108/dozen, 1 dozen children’s sandals at US$96/dozen, 1 dozen cloth shoes at US$48/dozen, 1 dozen children’s blouses at US$36/dozen, and 1 dozen perfumes at US$48/dozen.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Merlenis R. tiene 41 años de edad es originaria de Bluefields, es casada, tiene dos hijos y desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de productos tales como ropa para niños, perfumes para hombres y mujeres ropa interior para mujeres entre otras cosas. Marlenis tambien se dedica a impartir clases en el nivel primario pero por el bajo salario que reciben los maestros tiene tambien que vender los productos mencionados. Cabe señalar que para la venta de sus productos Marlenis cuenta con algunas personas conocidas quienes le hacen encargos de los productos y ella les da facilidades de pago. Su venta la realiza visitando las casas de sus clientes entre estos sus mismos compañeros de trabajos o sea los maestros y maestras. Sus compras las realiza en la capital Managua en donde las obtiene a un menor precio y hace sus viajes cada 3 o 4 meses en dependencia de sus pedidos.


 La microempresaria R. necesita el financiamiento para comprar lo siguiente: 1 docena de sandalias de mujer a US$ 108 dolares cada docena,  1 docena de sandalias juveniles  a US$ 96 dolares cada docena, 1 docena de zapatos suave a US$ 48 dolares cada docena, 1 docena de blusas juveniles a US$ 36 dolares cada docena y 1 docena de perfumes a US$ 48 dolares la docena.

loans.use: Purchase 1 dozen women's sandals, 1 dozen children's sandals,  1 dozen cloth shoes, 1 dozen children's blouses and 1 dozen perfumes.

payments.comment: La cuota real es de 31.36 dólares
Hubo error en el reporte anterior lo correcto era US$ 28 por eso estamos reportando solo US$ 25 para totalizar en las dos primera cuotas US$ 56, los proximos pagos se reportaran de US$ 28 dolares.

loans.name: Leyla Corina

texts.es:
Leyla is a woman who has four school-aged children. Her children are the reason that she strives to succeed and why she has worked so hard to offer them a stable family and an education for their future. Leyla Corina has sold beef for 31 years. It's important to point out that this is a good business right now, and her sales have increased considerably through the years. Her initial capital was 10,000 córdobas that she obtained through the support of ther mother.

Leyla Corina has worked with CEPRODEL for 14 months, and she feels very satisfied with the credits offered to her because they have come at opportune moments and have helped her supply what she needs to her business and satisfy her clientele's daily demands. She has a record of 8 credits.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Leyla es una mujer acompañada con cuatro hijos los cuales se encuentran en la edad escolar. Sus hijos han sido la razón para que ella se superara y por ellos es que ella se ha esforzado, brindándoles así una familia estable y una educación para el futuro de ellos. Desde hace 31 años Leyla Corina se dedicaba a vender carne de res.

Es importante señalar que este es un buen negocio hoy en día en su sector, sus ventas incrementaron considerablemente al paso de los años. Su capital de inicio fue de C$ 10,000 (córdobas) los cuales los obtuvo por aporte de su mamá.

Leyla Corina trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 14 meses y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados ya que les han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando así a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. Ella tiene un record de 8 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase of meat

loans.name: Luvy Maria

texts.es:
Luvy Maria B. Lopez is married, finished through the second year of high school and has no dependents. Her economic condition appears to be easy; however, she tells us that she is always looking for ways to help her family since she feels uncomfortable depending on others.

Because she wanted to get ahead, she started to sell milk products five years ago. She started selling as a peddler, that is, she would go around the streets with her friend selling her products. She has now established her business in the municipal market with eighteen loans that she has acquired. She says that she feels very well after being able to improve her living conditions with the loans that she received.

She started this business with a small tray selling milk curds worth about one Cordoba (about USD $.06). Now she sells the milk curds in units and pounds and also sells cream. This of course has increased her sales. Her initial investment was of approximately C$500 (about USD $30).

Mrs. B. has been working with CEPRODEL for three years. She tells us that she is very satisfied with the loans that she has received; they have been convenient and timely. They have enabled her to provide for the needs of her business and to satisfy her clients daily. She has a history of eighteen loans with the institution.
