Translated from Spanish by Mayra Villegas, Kiva volunteer.

Casilda, es una mujer que día a día trabaja incansablemente con el propósito D. procurarles bienestar a su familia, su esposo también labora firmemente en las actividades D. siembra y cosecha D. sus campos D. cultivo y aunque muchas veces Casilda ha estado en situaciones D. pérdida por el bajo precio D. sus productos, sigue esforzándose porque quiere trabajar.Ella se considera una agricultora desD. su nacimiento debido a que proviene D. una familia se ha dedicado a estas labores y como siempre ha estado inmersa en este campo D. trabajo hoy por hoy las actividades agrícolas son su única fuente D. sobrevivencia ya que con esta actividad por años ha podido ofrecerles lo mejor a sus queridos hijos. Tiene planes D. incrementar el valor nutricional D. los alimentos que ofrece a sus queridas vaquitas, adquirir mayor cantidad D. abonos y fertilizantes para sus campos D. cultivo e invertir en la implementación D. una pequeña bodega para que ésta pueda otorgar ingresos adicionales a su hogar que le permitan incrementar su nivel D. vida familiar.Posibilitemos su petición para que esta familia pueda progresar.

loans.use: Purchase of food for her cows, compost and fertilizer for her field for growing crops and the implementation of a small grocery store, which will be in partnership with her daughter.

loans.name: Sonia Yanira

texts.es:
Señora Rodríguez has her business in La Libertad in a very strategic place in front of the bus station for the province's busses. She has two children, for whom she fights to get ahead. She started her business selling food, but after having some problems, she discontinued it. She didn't give up, though, and restarted it with $7. Now she has 17 years of experience selling traditional food, agua D. coco (the water that is found in coconuts), beverages, and fast food. She uses her profits to buy necessary things: she started with a plot of land and then constructed her house. Her financing has helped her keep her business going, and she has invested her profits in her home. She has had five credits with this institution, and all of them have been paid back in a punctual manner. The investments she has maD. in her business are noticeable, and she has improved it with her previous credits.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La Sra R., tiene su negocio en La Libertad en un punto muy estratégico ya que esta frente al punto D. buses departamentales, su familia esta compuesta por dos hijos que es por los cuales lucha para salir adelante inicio con venta D. comida pero por algunos problemas lo descontinuo , pero no se dio por vencida y lo reinicio con siete dolares, hasta la fecha tiene diecisiete años D. dedicarse a la venta D. comida típica y agua D. coco, refrescos y comida rápida, D. las ganancia D. su negocio a podido ir comprando cosas necesarias, comenzó con un terreno y luego construyo su casa los financiamientos le han ayudado en gran manera para sostener su negocio y a si ir invirtiendo D. la ganancia en su vivienda,, a tenido cinco créditos con la institución y todos los a cancelado D. forma puntual, y se ve su inversión en el local que tiene y como la a mejorado con los financiamientos anteriores.

loans.use: With the financing, she want to finish buying furniture for her business like benches, chairs, and tables so she can attend to her clients better

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Since marrying her husband 24 years ago and when the responsibility became urgent to Victoria, her husband became independent of his parents with the purpose of growing products in his own fields of crops to create together with his dear wife a strong family. God blessed them with three children, who also now have become important support in the labor. Nowadays they wake with much enthusiasm to continue with the daily work eventhough there is certain distrust due to the climate change that plague the land and habitat nowadays, the increase of rain is a risk for her and all her neighbors but nobody loses hope that the situation will get better. To survive one can’t only dedicate themselves to growing potatoes, peas and barley, they also raise lambs to sell on the weekends at the market of Acostambo. Thanks to this activity she can support the economy of her home when they suffer losses. She desires to purchase fertilizer and insecticiD. for the fields of crops to better the quality of her products. Show your solidarity with Victoria who works for a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

DesD. que contrajo matrimonio con su esposo ya hace 24 años y cuando L. responsabilidad apremiaba a Victoria, su esposo se independizó D. sus padres con el propósito D. sembrar productos en sus propios campos D. cultivo a fin D. forjar junto a su querida esposa una sólida familia.Dios los bendijo con tres hijos, que también ahora se han convertido en un importante apoyo D. sus labores. Actualmente se levanta con mucho entusiasmo para continuar con su cotidiana labor aunque con cierta desconfianza y desacierto debido al cambio climático que sufre actualmente L. tierra que habita, L. escasez D. lluvia es un riesgo para elL. y todos sus vecinos pero aún así no pierD. las esperanzas D. que mejorará esta situación.Para sobrevivir no sólo se dedica a L. siembra D. papa, arveja y cebada, también cría ovejitas para luego venderlas los fines D. semana en L. feria D. Acostambo. Gracias a esta actividad elL. pueD. sostener L. economía D. su hogar cuando ocurran pérdidas. Desea comprar abonos e insecticidas para sus campos D. cultivo a fin D. mejorar L. calidad D. sus productos.Solidarízate con Victoria que trabaja por un futuro mejor.

loans.use: The purchase of fertilizer and insecticide to better the quality of her products.

loans.name: Teodora Marcelina

texts.es:
Teodora Marcelina Martinez is a single mother of four children who are in school, reason for which she needs to watch out for their development and education. She has a business selling plastic bags in the Municipal Market. She started this business when her husband left her, because the money he gave her was not enough and is only enough to cover food expenses. For this reason, seeking for a way to support her children, she decided to start this business.

Mrs. Martinez has been working with CEPRODEL for three years. She tells us that she feels very good with the loans she has received because they have come at an opportune time, quickly, and have allowed her to support her children, and in addition to improve her house and her business.

Currently this business is one of the strongest in the field of plastic bags sales.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Teodora Marcelina M. es madre soltera de cuatro hijos los cuales están estudiando por lo que debe de velar por su desarrollo y educación. Tiene su negocio de venta de bolsas plásticas en el Mercado Municipal, ella comienza el negocio una vez que su marido la abandona, ya que el ingresos que el marido le pasa es muy poco y solo le alcanza para la comida, por tal razón, buscando la manera de ayudar a sus hijos es que ella decide emprender este negocio.

La señora M., trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace tres año, nos manifiesta que se siente satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido muy oportunos y brindados de manera muy ágil, y que en su momento le sirvieron para salir a delante con su hijos, estos a demás le han servido para el mejoramiento tanto para embellecer su casa, como para fortalecer su negocio.

Actualmente este negocio es uno de los más fuertes en lo que respecta a la venta de Bolsas plásticas.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (Compra de Mercadería)

loans.name: Justo

texts.es:
Don Justo was born in a farming family, it is natural of Quebrada Imperial and he always wished to become a great farmer, he feels he focuses on the cultivation of potatos and peas, until now he conserved his optimism for progress and thinks that the losses of the past year are not for consideration and observes with much optimism his future. Don Justo doesn’t neglect his role as a father and many times he sacrifices during long hours of endless working days with the objective of the wellbeing of his family. These days his dear wife confronts a delicate situation, due to a health condition she has deteriorated considerably. He is father to three children whom he has trained with a lot of care to forge in them the useful values of correct involvement in the community. He wished to buy fertilizer for his crops and fortified seeds for this sowing season. We consider the petition so that this father of a family can increase his profits and give his dear companion adequate medical treatment.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Justo nació en una familia netamente agrícola, es natural de Quebrada Imperial y siempre anheló convertirse en un gran agricultor, su siembra se concentra en el cultivo de papa y arveja, hasta ahora conserva ese gran optimismo por progresar y piensa que las pérdidas del año pasado no son de consideración y observa con mucho optimismo su futuro. Don Justo no descuida su rol de padre y muchas veces se sacrifica durante largas horas de interminables jornadas con el objetivo de otorgarle bienestar a su familia. En estos momentos su querida esposa enfrenta una situación muy delicada, debido a que una afección en su salud la ha deteriorado notablemente. Es padre de tres hijos a los que ha instruido con mucho cariño a fin de forjar en ellos valores muy útiles para su correcto desenvolvimiento dentro de su comunidad.Anhela comprar abonos de granja para sus cultivos y semillas mejoradas para esta época de siembra. Posibilitemos su petición para que este padre de familia incremente sus ganancias y pueda otorgarle un adecuado tratamiento a su querida compañera.

loans.use: The purchase of fertilizer for his farm lands and fortified seeds to increase the quality of his products.anhelo

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina has lived entirely off agricultural activities over the last 20 years growing potatoes, peas, barley and broad beans; she desires to continue in her noble management because she wants her four children to continue to study until they can create a prominent future for themselves. She thinks this year she will directly market the products of her harvest, before she did it through intermediaries who reduced the prices of her products and she didn’t see the profits that she deserved for the arduous work that she did. Alejandrina and her husband leave their home when the first rays of the sun appear to check the growth of their vegetables, checking daily if the presence of a plague or sickness appears in their fields, they carefully fertilize so that they grow strong while letting the animals go free so that they can obtain their daily sustenance from mother nature. This last activity is important to support of the family economy and with the objective of bettering the breed of their dear little animals; they solicit the help of your noble heart.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Alejandrina, vive enteramente D. las actividades agrícolas desD. hace 20 años sembrando papa, arveja, cebada y habas, desea continuar en su noble desenvolvimiento porque quiere que sus cuatro hijos sigan dedicándose a estudiar a fin D. que puedan forjarse un futuro prominente. Piensa este año comercializar directamente los productos D. su cosecha, antes lo hacia por medio D. intermediarios que abaratan los costos D. sus productos y no veía las ganancias que merecía por el arduo trabajo que realizaba.Alejandrina y D. esposo abandonan su morada en cuanto los primeros rayos del sol se hacen presente para verificar el crecimiento D. sus vegetales, verificando diariamente si existe la presencia D. alguna plaga o enfermedad en sus campos, los abonan cuidadosamente para que crezcan fuertes mientras dejan libres a sus animalitos para que éstos obtengan su alimento diario D. la madre naturaleza. Ésta última actividad es el importante soporte D. su economía familiar y con el objetivo D. mejorar la raza D. sus queridos animalitos, solicita la ayuda D. vuestro noble corazón.

loans.use: Ther purchase of young animals of a better breed.

loans.name: Vilma Leana

texts.es:
Vilma Leana Ramirez is a hardworking lady, married, with three children. Currently she has a clothes selling business located in the county market. She started this business six years ago, having started this business during a time in which her husband was unemployed. Through her sales she was able to offer her children the education they need.

She has been working with CEPRODEL for two years now. She tells us that she feels very good with the loans she has received because they have come at an opportune time, quickly, and have allowed her to buy the merchandise she has needed to stock.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Vilma Leana R. es una dama muy esforzada, casada y con tres hijos. Actualmente tiene ubicado el negocio de venta de ropa en el mercado municipal, el negocio de ella lo comienza hace seis años y según cuenta, este negocio lo emprendió cuando el esposo queda sin trabajo por una temporada, y que de esa venta pudo preparar a sus hijos brindándoles la educación que necesitan.

Esta señora, trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace dos año, nos manifiesta que se siente muy bien con los créditos otorgados pues han sido muy oportunos y brindados de manera muy ágil, y que en su momento le han servido para la compra de mercadería que no la tenia en existencia.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (Compra de mercadería)

loans.name: Rosa Esmeralda

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosa lives La Libertad, she does not own a house at the moment. Her two children are her source of inspiration to keep going. She is a single mother, and because of this she needs to get an income to support her children and offer them an education. She started her business with a small griddle, on which she could only cook 20 tortillas at a time. As she became better known among her customers, she increased her business and thus had to buy a larger griddle. Currently, this larger griddle is not enough, so she needs to buy another one to be able to fulfill her customers demand, and this is why she is requesting this loan. Her business has continued to grow, and she has had to hire another person to help in her business to she can cover all the orders she has and offer a better service to the people to whom she owes her success, her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. vive en la libertad no tienen casa propia por el momento ,sus dos hijos son la fuente D. inspiración para salir adelante es madre soltera debido a eso se le hace necesario el poder conseguir ingresos para mantener a sus hijos además D. darles una buena educación , inicio su negocio con una plancha pequeña en la cual únicamente podía tener veinte tortillas en cocimiento , conforme se dio a conocer con sus clientes fue incrementando sus negocio y por enD. tubo que comprar una plancha cocina mas granD. hasta la fecha esta no le da abasto, a si que tiene comprar otra para poder atender la demanda D. sus clientes y es por eso que esta solicitando el financiamiento, su negocio se a ido expandiendo y a tenido que contratar a otra persona para que le ayuD. con este y a si poder atender todos los pedidos que le hacen y prestar un mejor servicio a quienes se debe sus clientes .

loans.use: Buying a kitchen griddle to expand the tortilla-making capabilities she has in her home. (Comprara una cocina plancha para poder ampliar mas la Tortilleria que tiene en su vivienda)

loans.name: Teresa Cesaréa

texts.es:
Teresa, is from a natural born agriculture family, with immense strength she has observed that only labor with much dedication awards good fruits, with this conception she has worked her lands cultivating products native to the region such as the potato, corn, among others. Now that she is a mother of a family of 4 small children she has and feels more responsibility to continue with her daily labor, in another manner some time ago she acquired a small quantity of little animals to calm the hunger of her family in an epoch of shortage, while watching the cultivated lands she leaves the little animals free so that they can locate their daily sustenance. On the other hand, the health of her husband has deteriorated and they are worried a lot and to counteract the sickness that he suffers, he needs a demanding medical treatment, for this reason she has decided to increase the quantity and quality of her acquired products for the next season with improved seeds and balanced nutrition for the little animals. We consider the petition of a preoccupied wife who wishes to better the husband of her loyal companion with her work and sacrifice.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Teresa, es de una familia netamente agricultora, con inmenso esfuerzo a través del tiempo observó que sólo una labor con mucha dedicación otorga al final buenos frutos, con esta concepción ha trabajado sus tierras de cultivo sembrando los productos oriundos de la zona como la papa, el maíz, entre otros.Ahora que es una madre de familia de cuatro pequeños tiene y siente aún más la responsabilidad de continuar con su cotidiana labor, de manera adicional hace tiempo atrás adquirió una pequeña cantidad de animalitos para aplacar el hambre de su familia en época de escasez y mientras realiza el cuidado de sus campos de cultivo deja libre a sus animalitos para que estos ubiquen su sustento diario.Por otra parte la deteriorada salud de su esposo la preocupan mucho y para contrarrestar la enfermedad que padece hace falta un exigente tratamiento médico, por esa razón ha decidido incrementar la cantidad y calidad de sus productos adquiriendo para la próxima época de siembra semillas mejoradas y alimento balanceado para sus animalitos.Posibilitemos la petición de esta preocupada esposa que desea mejorar la salud de su fiel compañero con su trabajo y sacrificio.

loans.use: The purchase of fortified seeds and balanced nutrition for her dear little animals

loans.name: Efraín

texts.es:
Efraín is a very courageous man who strives every day to give his best in every job that he does. These values have been instilled in him since his childhood, and now that he is the father of 3 loving children, he wants to keep striving to give them security, comfort, and well-being. He makes a living by farming potatoes, barley, maca, peas, and beans. In these last few days, due to the severe changes in weather, he has seen his profits diminish. With time, he will continue working and will also search for other options that will let him make additional profits so his school-aged children can keep developing without difficulty. During this harvest season, he needs to rent the services of a tractor and to buy a larger quantity of fertilizer, which is why he needs a loan. Remember that your help is important to make this dream a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Efraín, es un hombre de mucho coraje que cada día a día se esfuerza por dar lo mejor de sí en cada trabajo que realiza, estos valores han sido inculcados en él desde su niñez y ahora que se ha convertido en padre de tres cariñosos niños, quiere seguir esforzándose para otorgarles seguridad, comodidad y bienestar. Se dedica a la producción y cultivo de papa, cebada, maca, arvejas y habas. En estos últimos días por el severo cambio climático ha visto decrecer las ganancias, aún con el tiempo en contra seguirá trabajando y también buscará otras opciones que le permitan obtener ganancias adicionales para que sus hijos que aún se encuentran en edad escolar se desenvuelvan sin ninguna dificultad.Para esta época de siembra necesita alquilar los servicios de un tractor y comprar mayor cantidad de abono, por tal fin requiere de un préstamo. Recuerda que tu apoyo es importante para la cristalización de este deseo.

loans.use: To rent a tractor and purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Mr. P. began his business four years ago, his wife had a tortilla business in their home which generated many well-served customers. They added some food products, invested approximately fifty dollars, and when they saw their customers asked for more items that they didn’t have they decided to formalize the store. Currently their inventory is very good and previous loans have helped Mr. P. to be able to improve way of life. This loan is needed to purchase eggs as their customers are requesting them; in addition they will purchase detergent and other food items.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

El señor P. inicio su negocio desde hace cuatro años, su esposa a mantenido una tortilleria en su vivienda lo cual le generaba la presencia de algunos clientes que podían ser bien aprovechados y pusieron algunos productos de consumo, invirtió aproximadamente cincuenta dolares, cuando vio que los clientes le pedían otros que no tenia decidido formalizar la tienda, hasta la fecha sus inventarios son muy buenos y las inversiones de los créditos anteriores le a ayudado incluso para poder mejorar su vivienda de habitación, este financiamiento lo necesita para comprar huevos ya que sus clientes se lo piden por mayor además de invertir en detergentes y otros artículos de consumo .

loans.use: Purchase eggs at wholesale prices, detergent, and other food items to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda Niño

texts.es:
Selling curd and cheese is an important business because people eat these products daily. Knowing this, Mrs. Yolanda Niño R., married with 2 children, has been selling curds and cream in Chinandega city for over 12 years.

This business is one of the most unique today in her area, her sales have increased considerably over the years, and she has expanded her locale and improved the facility. Her initial investment was C$10,000 (córdobas) from her savings.

Yolanda Niño has worked with Ceprodel for 3 years and feels very satisfied with the loans she has received as they have been awarded at opportune moments, helping her meet her business’s needs and satisify her customers daily. She has a history of 18 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La venta de cuajada y queso es un negocio muy importante porque a diario las personas consumen este producto. Consiente de esto la señora Yolanda Niño R. casada y con 2 hijos hace más de 12 años se ha dedicado a su venta de cuajadas y crema en la ciudad de Chinandega.

Este negocio es uno de los mas destacados hoy en día en su sector, sus ventas incrementaron considerablemente al paso de los años, ya que ella ha ido ampliando su local y mejorando la estructura del mismo. Su capital de inicio fue de C$ 10,000 (córdobas) los cuales una parte eran sus ahorros.

Yolanda Niño trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 3 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando así a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. Ella tiene un record de 18 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase milk

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
The committee called "Mujeres Emprendedoras de Santa Rosa" (Enterprising Woman of Santa Rosa) was formed through a contact who was interested in the program but who ultimately could not join for personal reasons. They had 4 meetings before obtaining their first credit in the home of one of the members who is now the general director of the committee. Seventeen women attended the meetings, of whom 15 agreed to the conditions of the program.

Currently, they are in their eighth cycle. Each woman has a different occupation: the majority sell fast food; others are street vendors who sell different items like perfume, makeup, sheets, clothing, etc.; others sell fruit or homemade cheese; and one has a laundromat.

They hope to invest the credit they are requesting in the purchase of raw materials and merchandise like: clothing, sheets, towels, shoes, detergent, bleach, athletic shoes, candies, meat, cheese, trinkets, perfume, vegetables, fruit, etc.

On the day that this picture was taken, not everyone could attend the meeting. The majority of the women are street vendors, so they were in different parts of the city working. They do this work with a lot of love since it is their main source of economic support, and they come from very humble families.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

El comité denominado “MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS DE SANTA ROSA” del Barrio del mismo nombre, se formo a partir de un contacto quien inicialmente estaba interesada en el programa pero que finalmente no pudo integrar por motivos personales. Se realizaron 4 reuniones previas al crédito en casa de una de las integrantes quien ahora es la Directora General del comité. En las reuniones asistieron 17 señoras de las cuales solo 15 estuvieron de acuerdo con los compromisos del programa.

Actualmente se encuentran en el 8vo ciclo, cada una tiene un rubro diferente al que se dedican, la mayoría vende comidas rápidas, otras se dedican a la venta ambulante de diferentes artículos como perfumes, maquillajes, sábanas, ropas, etc. otras venden frutas, queso casero y una posee una lavandería.

El crédito que solicitan desean invertirlos en la compra de materia prima y mercaderías como: ropas, sabanas, toallas, zapatos, jabón en polvo, lavandina, enjuague para ropa, zapatos deportivos, golosinas, carne, queso, bijouterie, perfumes, verduras, frutas, etc.

El día de la reunión para la toma de la fotografía no pudieron asistir todas, ya que como la mayoría son vendedoras ambulantes se encontraban en distintos puntos de la ciudad realizando su labor, que con mucho amor lo hacen ya que representa el sustento de ellas pues todas provienen de familias muy humildes

loans.use: Purchase of raw material and merchandise like:  clothing, sheets, towels, shoes, detergent, bleach, athletic shoes, etc.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
Every day Leonardo undertakes the hard tasks of agricultural labour with happiness, because he knows that only with strenuous effort will he be able to ensure a good income. The costs of a decent education for his children and meeting essential household costs are the major causes of his complete dedication to the cultivation of potatoes, barley and peas, as well as the raising of livestock to sustain them in periods of crisis. On several occasions, he has suffered numerous losses in his fields as a result of bad weather.

His desire to improve his family’s quality of life has driven him to ask for help from your sympathetic heart in order to acquire 10 sacks of fertilizer, in order to improve the quality of his produce. Let us satisfy his request so that in a short time this desire will be realised.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Las duras tareas del campo las realiza diariamente con mucha alegría Leonardo, porque sabe que sólo con un esfuerzo arduo podrá lograr buenas ganancias. Los costos D. una adecuada educación para sus hijos y L. satisfacción D. las necesidades D. su hogar son las causas principales D. su entera dedicación a L. siembra D. papa, cebada y arveja y también a L. crianza D. animales que lo sostienen en época D. crisis.En muchas ocasiones han surgido cuantiosas pérdidas en sus campos D. cultivo por L. inclemencia del tiempo.

Su anhelo D. mejorar L. calidad D. vida D. su familia lo conducen a solicitar L. ayuda D. tu solidario corazón para adquirir 10 sacos D. abono a fin D. incrementar L. calidad D. sus productos.Posibilitemos su petición para que dentro D. poco este deseo se cristalice.

loans.use: Purchase ten sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Ricardina

texts.es:
Ricardina works hard every day to provide a better life for her four children. At the break of dawn, she begins her day by feeding the kids and taking care of the house. By early morning she sets off with her loyal donkey to tend to the fields all day creating excellent produce.

She wants to purchase manure and pesticides to improve her harvest. The animal feed is for the farm animals that she has in her house as a backup in case the harvest does not go as planned.

Please help Ricardina, a mother that is working hard to provide a better future for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase manure, pesticides, and animal feed

loans.name: Petra María

texts.es:
Petra began selling shoes when her husband’s taxi was stolen, and they had to look for an alternative source of income. Today her husband rents a taxi in order to continue earning money and Petra continues selling shoes in a business that has grown little by little.

Nevertheless the store where they store their shoes is not in very good condition and that is why Petra is asking for a loan of US$925 which will be repaid in 6 months, and with this money Petra will be able to repair the store’s roof as well as the small vehicle which she uses to sell in the neighborhoods. With your help, Petra will be able to be successful with her business and family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Petra comenzó en la venta de calzado, debido que a su esposo le robaron el taxi en el que trabajaba, y por lo tanto tuvieron que buscar otra alternativa para poder obtener ingresos. Y actualmente su esposo pudo conseguir la renta de un taxi para poder seguir ganando dinero y Petra continúa con la venta de zapatos que poco a poco ha ido creciendo.

Sin embargo la bodega en donde guardan los zapatos no está en muy buenas condiciones es por eso que Petra está solicitando un crédito de US $925 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Petra podrá reparar el techo de la bodega, así como la camioneta con la que sale a vender en las colonias. Con tu ayuda, Petra podrá sacar adelante su negocio así como a su familia.

loans.use: Repair her store's roof

loans.name: Silveria

texts.es:
Mrs. Silveria previously was a vendor in the city’s municipal market, but that activity didn’t go well so she traveled outside the county to look for work.

She learned many things while abroad, among those, to make all kinds of clothing. She returned to her country and opened her own shop, where today she makes shirts, pants, dresses, and uniforms among other items.

Silveria wants to obtain a loan to be able to buy materials with which to work such as fabric, thread, zippers, and buttons, as she has several orders for business uniforms due at the end of January.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Silveria anteriormente era vendedora en el mercado municipal de la cuidad, pero dicha actividad no le resulto por lo cual viajo al exterior en busca de trabajo.

Aprendió muchas cosas estando fuera, entre ellas, a confeccionar todo tipo de prendas. Volvió al país y monto su propio taller, donde hoy día confecciona camisas, pantalones, vestidos, uniformes entre otros.

Silveria desea adquirir un crédito con el que podrá comprar materiales para trabajar como telas, hilos, cierres y botones, ya que tiene varios pedidos de uniformes de empresas para entregar a fines del mes de enero.

loans.use: Purchase fabric, thread, zippers, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Sanober

texts.en:
Sanober B. lives in the second largest city of Pakistan, Lahore. She has three daughters and two sons. Her eldest daughter has finished tenth grade and is now married. Her eldest son works with his father in a tiles and marble factory. Her other children, except for the youngest son, have dropped out of school due to high education costs, while Sanober's youngest son is currently too sick to attend school, but will hopefully be able to continue. 

Recently, Sanober has been busy preparing for her eldest daughter’s wedding, but now that the wedding is over, she has time to re-start her business in making traditional textiles. Sanober needs a loan of US$250 to purchase raw materials, including cloth and thread. In addition, she will use some of the money to pay wages to the workers who she has hired from the community, including dyers and designers. Sanober's two daughters who live with her also design and embroider clothes. She then sells these traditional clothes in Lahore and other surrounding cities with the help of her son-in-law. Sanober is very hopeful that she will receive the loan and be able to re-start her business.

loans.use: Purchase of cloth and thread

loans.name: Venancia

texts.es:
Mrs Venancia is married and has 3 small children. Her husband works as a employee in a refrigeration company in the area. Venancia was a saleswoman of lotteries and games of chance and, thanks to loans offered by the Paraguayan Foundation, she was able to begin her micro-business, a pantry.

Venancia is an enterprising and sacrificing woman. With a lot of effort she has already built up her business. With the profits she was able to build her own house that before was made only of wood and sheets.

She markets all kinds of consumer goods, primarily sugar, milk, noodles, carbonated waters, fruits, and vegetables, among others. Today she requests a new loan with which she will be able to acquire said merchandise in large quantities.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra Venancia es casada y tiene 3 hijos pequeños; su marido trabaja como empleado en un frigorífico de la zona. Venancia era vendedora de loterías y juegos de azar y gracias a créditos otorgados por la Fundación Paraguaya, ella pudo montar su microempresa, una despensa.

Venancia es una mujer emprendedora y sacrificada, ya que con mucho esfuerzo logro sacar adelante su negocio y con las ganancias pudo construir su propia casa que antes era solo de madera y chapas.

Ella comercializa todo tipo de artículos de consumo primario tales como azúcar, lácteos, fideos, gaseosas, frutas, hortalizas, entre otros. Hoy día solicita un nuevo crédito con el que podrá adquirir dichas mercaderías en grandes cantidades.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as sugar, flour, rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Whadeean

texts.en:
Whadeean B. lives in Lahore and has six children. Not all of  her children have been at school for extended periods of time: Whadeean and her husband could not give much education to their daughters, since Whadeean's father-in-law was opposed to sending girls to school. However, once the family moved to Lahore, Whadeean made sure her daughters learnt some skills. In addition, also one of her sons managed to attend some school. 

Whadeean is a textile designer and makes traditional embroidered shalwar kameez, which she has been doing for many years. She buys cloth from the market and hires workers to embroider them. Whadeean sells about 20 outfits per month and makes US$15 to US$25 in profit per outfit. She currently needs a loan of US$250 to be able to purchase cloth in bulk.

loans.use: Purchase of cloth for a textiles business

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
Mrs. Zulma has 3 teenage children, her husband sells food products in the country’s interior. Zulma was an employee of a business in the municipal market, and little by little she saved her money to be able to open her own business.

She began selling sugar, flour, and some other groceries, and with the earnings she was able to continually expand her business. Today she has a good number of customers that daily do their shopping in her store.

Zulma wants to continue to grow and expand her business, so today she is asking for a loan in order to be able to purchase merchandise at wholesale prices, especially drinks such as soda pop, juices, beer, and wine as these products are in high demand this time of year.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra Zulma tiene 3 hijos adolescentes, su marido es vendedor de productos alimenticios en el interior del país. Zulma era empleada de un negocio en el mercado municipal y de a poco con unos ahorros que iba juntando logro obtener el capital suficiente para abrir su propio negocio.

Empezó vendiendo azúcar, harina y algunos que otras mercaderías, y con las ganancias que obtenía iba surtiendo cada vez más el negocio. Hoy día ya posee una buena cantidad de clientes que diariamente van a hacer compras a su despensa.

Zulma desea seguir progresando y expandiendo el negocio, por lo que hoy solicita un crédito con el que podrá adquirir mercaderías al por mayor especialmente bebidas como gaseosas, jugos, cervezas y vinos pues estos son los de mayor demanda en esta época de año.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise such as soda pop, beer, juice, and wine.

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en: Jameela B. lives in Lahore, the second largest city of Pakistan, with her family. Together with her husband, Jameela wants to purchase a second-hand Rickshaw, a three-wheeled local vehicle, so that her husband can provide transportation services part-time (during the day he works at a school).  So far, he has been able to make about US$5 a day from the transportation services. To supplement the family's income, Jameela stitches clothes for people in the city. She hopes that the loan will help her family increase their earnings.

loans.use: Purchase of a rickshaw

loans.name: Kausar

texts.en: Kausar lives in Lahore, a metropolitan city in Pakistan, with her husband and five children. Her two eldest sons could not attend school, since the family could not afford it at the time. Kausar's husband purchases scrap metal, melts it, and then sells as raw metal. Kausar and her husband would be very thankful for a loan of US$425 to purchase more scrap metal for this purpose. They have borrowed money before and have been able to re-invest it in their business.

loans.use: Purchase of scrap metal

loans.name: Liduvina

texts.es:
Mrs. Liduvina Argüello is 60 years old and lives with her 55 year old sister, Juana. She is a single mother, her daughter is 32 years old and has successfully completed her university studies with a bachelor degree in Business Administration. 

Liduvina has been able to save money by working as a seamstress for over 30 years and showing her items that she made on a little table in front of her house. Upon seeing the need to have more income upon the birth of her daughter, she decided to open a small general store in her home. 
In her store she sells merchandise for gifts – things like games, women and children’s clothing, shoes, wallets, buckles, and hair bands, in addition to the clothing that she makes.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Liduvina Argüello tiene 60 años, vive con su hermana Juana de 55 años. Ella es madre soltera, tiene una hija   de 32 años que ha culminado exitosamente sus estudios universitarios recibiendo el titulo de licenciada en Administración de Empresas.

 Liduvina ha guardado ahorros trabajando como modista durante mas de treinta años y exhibiendo las prendas que confeccionaba en una mesita frente de su casa; pero luego, viendo la necesidad de generar mayores ingresos, ya que nació su hija, ella decidió abrir una mercería en su casa.

En el negocio vende mercaderías especialmente artículos para regalos como juguetes, ropas para damas y niños, algunos tipos de calzados, carteras, hebillas y gomas para el pelo, además de las prendas que ella confecciona.

loans.use: Purchase games, perfume, shoes, various items for the home, etc. to sell in her store

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.es:
Ninfa is 44 and her husband, Nelson Ruiz, is 37. They live in a very nice house with their three children and Ninfa's mother in the Golondrina neighborhood in the city of Villa Hayes-Chaco.
Ninfa tells us that, thanks to some savings she had, she was able to open a convenience store where she sells different kinds of basic goods such as sugar, flour, fruit, vegetables, pasta, etc.
For the past few years she has worked with loans that Fundacion Paraguaya has granted her, and this time she is requesting a new loan with which she will acquire a greater variety of goods for her business, since due to the year-end holidays her customers demand a greater amount of products.
Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ninfa tiene 44 años, y su esposo Nelson Ruiz tiene 37 años de edad, ambos viven en una casa muy bonita con sus tres hijos y la madre de doña Ninfa en el barrio Golondrina de la ciudad de Villa Hayes - Chaco. 

Doña Ninfa cuenta que gracias a un pequeño ahorro que tenía pudo abrir su despensa, donde vende distintos tipos de artículos de primera necesidad como azúcar, harina, frutas, hortalizas, fideos, etc. 

Hace varios años que trabaja con los créditos que le otorga la Fundación y en esta oportunidad está solicitando un nuevo crédito con el que surtir de mayor variedad su negocio, pues como se acercan las fiestas de fin año sus clientes demandan mayor cantidad de productos.

loans.use: Purchase bakery goods, canned goods, wine, soft drinks, cider, sweet bread, candy, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Andrea De La Cruz

texts.es:
Andrea M. is a single mother of two school age children for whom she is responsible. Her children have been the reason for which she works very hard selling basic grains in Chinandega.

Sixteen years ago, Mrs. M. started her business of basic grains. She has distinguished herself as an excellent merchant. Her goal is for her children to become professionals and this is why she puts a lot of effort into her work.

This is a remunerable business for her, because her sales have increased considerably with the years.

She has been working with Ceprodel for a year now and she feels very satisfied with the loans received because they have come at an opportune time, helping her satisfy her business' needs as well as her customers every day. She has a record of 4 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Andrea M. es una madre soltera y con 2 hijos a su responsabilidad el cual se encuentran en la edad escolar. Sus hijos han sido la razón por la que ella muy esforzadamente trabaja en la venta de granos básicos en Chinandega.

Desde hace 16 años la señora M. inicio su negocio de granos básicos por lo que se ha destacado como una excelente comerciante cuya meta es llegar a tener hijos profesionales y por este motivo es que día a día se esfuerza en su labor.

Este negocio es muy rentable para ella, hoy en día sus ventas han incrementado considerablemente al paso de los años.

Trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace un año por lo que se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando así a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela, Ella tiene un record de 4 créditos.

loans.use: Investing in her business (Inversión al negocio)

loans.name: Brenda

texts.es:
Brenda Espinal is a young mother with responsibility for 2 school-age children. Her children have been the reason why she works so hard selling clothing in Chinandega.

Brenda started her clothes-selling business 8 years ago, but in order to start this business she had to quite studying, because her family's situation was becoming more and more difficult and her little ones were being born.

The business is very profitable for her. Sales have increased considerably each year and she has been able to invest more into the business.

She has worked with CEPRODEL for the past two years and is pleased with the loans she has received as they have been given to her in opportune moments, helping her to meet the needs of her business and those of her clients. She has a record of 10 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

Brenda Espinal es una joven madre con 2 hijos a su responsabilidad el cual se encuentran en la edad escolar. Sus hijos han sido la razón por la que ella muy esforzadamente trabaja en la venta de ropa en Chinandega.

Desde hace 8 años Brenda inicia su negocio de venta de ropa en su localidad pero para poder haber iniciado este trabajo tuvo que dejar de estudiar porque la situación de su familia se ponía cada vez más difícil y además estaban naciendo sus pequeños.

Este negocio es muy rentable para ella, hoy en día sus ventas han incrementado considerablemente al paso de los años y ha podido invertir más en su negocio.

Trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace dos año por lo que se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando así a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. Es importante destacar que ella tiene un record de 10 créditos.

loans.use: Investment in her business.

loans.name: Candida

texts.es:
Miss Candida M. is a young entrepreneur who has been selling shoes in the Chinandega central market for three years.

She began her business with US$300 that she received as a gift from her mother, and she decided to go in to this business until she can improve her standard of living.

Her plans, if God is willing, is to use her business to enable her to complete her education and university studies in order to become a great businesswoman in the market.

She has been working with Ceprodel for a year and a half and she feels very satisfied with the previous loans as they have been dispersed at opportune times, helping her acquire what her business needed and serving her customers daily. It is important to note that she has a history of 8 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señorita Candida M. es una joven muy emprendedora ya que desde hace tres años se dedica a la comercialización de zapatos en el mercado central de Chinandega.

Comenzó su negocio con un capital de U$ 300 que los obtuvo como regalo de su mama y decidió de manera personal dedicarse a este negocio hasta poder progresar y mejorar su nivel de vida.

Son sus planes si Dios así se lo permite y poniendo de su empeño poder realizar sus estudios y profesionalizarse para poder llegar a ser una gran comerciante en el mercado de su localidad.

Trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace año y medio por lo que se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando así a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. Es importante destacar que ella tiene un record de 8 créditos.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Fátima

texts.es:
Fatima M. is a hard-working lady with a great drive to improve. Five years ago she started a business selling shoes in the area around the central market of Chinandega, using a small table to set out her products.

She started her business when she was very young, at first she concentrated on her secondary school studies but because of the need to support herself she decided to start her business.

Fatima has worked with CEPRODEL since a year ago, and has been the beneficiary of loans that have helped her business, as now she has been able to get her own stand inside the market and in addition has been able to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Fátima M. es una dama muy esforzada y con gran espíritu de superación. Desde hace 5 años inició su negocio de venta de zapatos en las afueras del mercado central de Chinandega usando una mesita para poner sus productos.

Comenzó su negocio desde muy joven, primeramente se dedicaba a los estudios de secundaria pero por la necesidad de manutención decide inaugurar el negocio.

Hoy en día la señora Fátima trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace un año habiendo sido beneficiada con créditos que le han beneficiado en su negocio ya que ha podido conseguir un local propio dentro del mercado y además ha podido sostener su núcleo familiar.

loans.use: Investment in her business.

loans.name: Jorge Rafael

texts.es:
He has been an auto mechanic since he was fourteen years old. He started his shop with some friends and acquaintances. Due to the quality of service provided, the shop has been expanding. Currently it has an average of thirty clients a month that come buy constantly for service and preventative maintenance. He has three people working with him in the shop. The purpose of the loan is to maintain his own vehicle in good condition since that is the way he gets around the fastest to purchase parts. Also there are times that he needs to go where the damaged cars are to fix them there and then move them to his shop. His car is very necessary to him and therefore he considers it very important keeping it in good condition.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Es mecánico desde hace catorce años, el taller lo inicio con algunos amigos y conocidos pero al ver el servicio y la calidad que prestaba se a ido ampliando con el negocio hasta la fecha tiene un promedio de treinta clientes mensuales, que lo visitan constantemente para darles entre revisiones y mantenimiento preventivo tiene tres personas que trabajan con el en el taller la finalidad con el crédito es tener su vehículo personal en buen estado ya que le sirve para movilizarse para hacer la compra de repuestos de manera mas rápida e incluso en muchas ocasiones tiene que trasladarse hasta donde se quedan los vehículos con desperfectos y repararlos en ese lugar para luego trasladarlos a su taller, el vehículo le es muy necesario por eso considera que tenerlo en buenas condiciones es importante .

loans.use: Mr. Ramirez needs to repair his automobile. With the loan he will buy rings for the motor and a set of caps

loans.name: Guadalupe Acosta

texts.es:
Guadalupe Acosta P. is the mother of a school-age boy. She is a very hard-working lady who for the past 8 years has owned a business selling footwear for both sexes.

She started the business when she was very young. At first she had been concentrating on her secondary school studies, but because of the need to support herself decided to start up her business.

We should not forget that Guadalupe has been working with CEPRODEL for the past year, she has been the beneficiary of 9 loans which have helped her business as she has greatly increased her sales and as such, her profit. Her goal is to become a great businesswoman in the footwear market and, at the same time, give her child a university education.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Guadalupe Acosta P. es madre de un niño de edad escolar. Ella se caracteriza por ser una dama muy esforzada ya que desde hace 8 años es dueña de un negocio de venta de calzados para ambos sexos.

Comenzó su negocio desde muy joven, primeramente se dedicaba a los estudios de secundaria pero por la necesidad de manutención decide inaugurar el negocio.

No podemos pasar por alto que actualmente la señora Guadalupe trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace un año habiendo sido beneficiada con 9 créditos que sorprendentemente le han beneficiado en su negocio ya que ha aumentado sus volúmenes de venta y por ende sus utilidades. Su meta es convertirse en una gran comerciante en el mercado de calzados y a la vez que su pequeño pueda coronar una carrera universitaria.

loans.use: Investment in her business.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
Mrs. Amelia L. is 38 years old and has been married for 19 years to Mr. Porfirio L., who is also 38. The couple has 4 children, the oldest is 18 and studying the first year of a degree in nursing. The others are 15, 13 and 11 years old, respectively, and are studying at schools in the city.

Amelia has her own convenience store, which she attends to personally, offering excellent service to her customers. She started this business 5 years ago with capital from her husband, who owns an upholstery store, and in this way she has been able to increase the family's income.

She is requesting a loan to buy sugar, yerba mate, oil, flour, pasta and articles for Christmas, as during this time of year the demand for these products increases considerably.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Amelia López de 38 años de edad esta casada hace 19 años con el Señor Porfirio López también de 38 años de edad. El matrimonio tiene 4 hijos, la mayor tiene 18 años y esta cursando el 1er. Año de Licenciatura en Enfermería, los otros tienen 15 años 13 y 11 años respectivamente y están estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad.

Doña Amelia tiene una despensa propia, el cual atiende de forma personalizada ofreciendo de ésta manera a sus clientes una excelente atención. Se inicio en este negocio hace 5 años con un capital que le facilitó su marido que es propietario de una tapicería y de ésta aumentar los ingresos de la familia.

La clienta solicita el préstamo para la compra de azúcar, yerba, aceite, harina, queso, fideos y en especial para la compra de artículos navideños; ya que como estamos en época de fin de año la demanda de estos artículos aumenta considerablemente.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, yerba mate, oil, flour, cheese, pasta and articles for Christmas.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Isabel started her business with a total of thirty dollars, which were lent to her by a family member, and were a tremendous help to her in undertaking this new challenge. Her good investment of the money and the good relations with her customers has given her a loyal client base. With the help of loans that she has received from financial institutions, including Integral, she sells all types of vegetables. She has a good location in the main streets of La Libertad, and also has ten years of experience in this business. Her experience is apparent in her manner. The income that she has and good management have made her able to invest in her home that she has been able to build and maintain her level of sales. She can in this way provide the products that her customers ask for. The loan that she needs is for the purchase of certain vegetables that sell well during the end of year season, such as tomatoes, cabbages and others.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Isabel inicio su negocio , con un monto de treinta dolares, los cuales un familiar le presto,y que le ayudaron en gran manera para poder emprender este nuevo reto , pero su buena inversión del dinero y el buen trato con los clientes le ayudado para que estos se fidelicen con ella además de el apoyo con los financiamientos que a recibido por instituciones financieras ,incluido Integral ella vende todo tipo de verduras en el negocio, ya que tiene una buen ubicación en las calles principales de La libertad, además cuenta con diez años de experiencia en este negocio, lo cual hace que se exprese con mucha experiencia , los ingresos que tiene y la buena administración le ayudado a invertir en su vivienda ya que con esfuerzos a podido construirla y tratar de mantenerse en sus ventas ,y a si siempre tener los productos que sus clientes le solicitan, el financiamiento lo necesita para poder comprar algunos verduras que son muy vendibles tales como la los tomates repollo y otros debido a la época de fin de año .

loans.use: She needs a loan to buy vegetables, tomatoes,carrots, potatoes,cabbages, plantains, etc.

loans.name: José Alfredo

texts.es:
For the last seven years, Jose Alfredo Hernandez commonly known as chepito sells basic grains in the city of Chinandega. His story is powerful in that several years ago he lost his wife. On becoming a widower he looked for ways to handle his situation since she was the one that attended to him with his meals and care and was his very capable helper.

Currently Mr. Jose Hernandez (chepito) has been able to move forward thanks to the loans that he received from Ceprodel ( 5 loans). These have helped him cover some expenses and also increase his profits.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

José Alfredo H. conocido comúnmente como chepito se dedica a la venta de granos básicos en la Ciudad de Chinandega desde hace siete años. Su historia es muy impactante ya que hace unos años perdió a su esposa y al quedar viudo buscó la manera de jugársela solo por lo que la esposa era la que le atendía con sus alimentos y atención por ser su ayuda idónea.

Hoy en día el señor José H. (chepito) ha podido salir adelante gracias a créditos que le ha otorgado Ceprodel (5 créditos) los cuales le han beneficiado para suplir algunos gastos y además aumentar sus utilidades.

loans.use: Investment in the business

loans.name: Ana  Isabel

texts.es:
Mrs. M. started as a traveling saleswoman selling clothes. She then started selling clothes out of her home to her neighbors and soon decided to put a display case in her business to show off the clothes. This allowed her to increase the styles and designs that she offered her clients until she had a well established business. Her objective in life with the help of her husband is to be able to proviD. her three children with a good education and better development opportunities that they didn’t have. Her husband helps her cover part of the family expenses but with what she brings in with her business she is able to adequately cover their necessities. The loan will be used to by new clothing styles and increase size inventory as this is the only clothing business in the area and it’s a shame for the clients to look elsewhere for clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. M. inicio con ventas ambulantes D. ropa luego comenzó llevando ropa a su vivienda y propuso a algunos vecinos este producto, después decidió poner una vitrina en su negocio para exhibir la ropa D. manera que fue ampliando los estilos y diseños que ofrecía a sus clientes, hasta llegar a tener el negocio bien formado como en la actualidad, su objetivo en la vida es poder dar junto a su esposo una buena educación a sus tres hijos que tenga mejores oportunidades D. desarrollo que ellos no tuvieron, el esposo le ayuda a cubrir parte D. los gastos del grupo familiar pero con lo que ella aporta con el negocio cubren a cabalidad sus necesidades, el objetivo con el crédito es poder comprar nuevos estilos D. ropa tener un mejor inventario en tallas y modelos ya que es el único negocio en la zona y es una lastima que los clientes busquen otros lugares D. venta .

loans.use: The loan wil be used to buy shoes, new clothing styles for women and children, toys, and used clothes which her clients request.

loans.name: Estanislaa

texts.es:
Mr. Estanislao Z. is 43 years old, happily married for 23 years to Mrs. Milda Paniagua who is 38 years old. They have three daughters, the eldest is 21 years old and works as a nurse, another one is 19, married and lives independently, and the youngest is 17 years old and is a masseuse.

Mr. Estanislao is a traveling salesman. He goes out to sell his merchandise in his van, all around the northern area of the country. He started in this business 7 years ago, with a capital saved from his previous job in which he was an employee for a company. His wife tends to a clothing store they have in a locale together with their youngest daughter.

Mr. Estanislao requests the loan to buy t-shirts, shorts, dresses, skirts, shoes, underwear, and towels.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

El Señor Estanislao Z. de 43 años de edad esta felizmente casado hace 23 años con la Señora Milda Paniagua de 38 años. El matrimonio tiene tres hijas la mayor de ellas de 21 años que se desempeña como enfermera, otra de 19 años que esta casada y vive en forma independiente y la última de 17 años que es masajista.

Don Estanislao es vendedor ambulante, sale a vender su mercadería en su camioneta, por la zona Norte del país. Se inicio en este oficio hace 7 años con un capital ahorrado de su antiguo trabajo en el cual se desempeñaba como empleado de una empresa; mientras su señora se queda al frente de la ropería que poseen en un local junto con su hija menor.

El Señor Estanislao solicita el préstamo para la compra de remeras, short, vestidos, faldas, calzados, ropa interior y toallas.

loans.use: Buying merchandise such as t-shirts, shorts, dresses, skirts, shoes, underwear, and towels. (para la compra de mercaderías como: remeras, compra de short, compra de vestido, compra de polleras, compra de calzados, compra de ropa interior y toallas.)

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia is 48 years old, separated, and lives in Santani with her 3 children; 2 are adults and one is school age.

For 11 years, she has been working selling clothing for women and children, in the streets of Santani. Because of her hard work and dedication, she now has a well-established clientele.

Her hard work allowed her to achieve on of her most satisfying goals, owning her own home where she lives with her children.

Now she has a set goal, because she has worked in the streets for years, under harsh weather and in unfavorable physical conditions, she wants to build a store in her home. There she will sell to the public, maintaining her current activity of selling clothing, and adding a new one, selling grocery items.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Antonia es una mujer separada de 48 años, vive en Santani con sus 3 hijos; 2 son mayores de edad y 1 esta en edad escolar.

Desde hace 11 años se dedica a la venta de ropas para damas y niños, en forma ambulante en toda la zona de Santani, debido a su trabajado y dedicación hoy cuenta con una muy buena clientela formada.

Su gran esfuerzo la llevo a uno de los logros mas satisfactorios, el tener su casa propia donde vive con sus hijos.

Ahora tiene un objetivo trazado, ya son años de andar por las calles bajo condiciones climáticas o físicas no siempre favorables, por ello, en su casa quiere construir un salón comercial de venta al publico, manteniendo su actual rubro de venta de Prendas de Vestir y además agragarle el rubro de Despensa.

Con el crédito desea adquirir mercaderías tales como: pantalones, faldas, remeras, camisas, accesorios para damas.

loans.use: Buying pants, skirts, shirts, and accessories for women (Compra de pantalones, faldas, remeras, camisas, accesorios para damas.)

loans.name: Silvia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mrs. M. is a single mother and lives in her in own house in La Libertad. She started the business to provide her son every opportunity. Her inventory has been growing as she’s been able to become less dependent on her suppliers and been able to buy her products at lower prices which have increased her profits. The loan will be used to increase the variety of perfumes and clothes as she has a small amount of these products but not enough to satisfy the demand for new products. In the case of the clothes she would like to invest a good sum of money in order to be able to go to the border and purchase a large amount of styles.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. M., es madre soltera vive actualmente en casa propia en La libertad, lo que la decidió a emprender el negocio fue la necesidad de poder sacar adelante a su hijo, en la actualidad su inventario a ido creciendo a podido ir independizándose de los proveedores que la visitan y a si poder comprar con precios mas baratos sus productos lo cual le deja mejor nivel de ganancia, el financiamiento lo necesita para ampliar el surtido de perfumería y ropa ya que tiene hasta la fecha algunos productos pero no es lo suficiente y quiere ofrecer variedad de productos nuevos, además en el caso de la ropa quiere invertir una buena cantidad de dinero para poder ir a la frontera y hacer una compra mas grande.

loans.use: To buy basic necessities to sell in her store.  To increase perfume sales and buy clothes.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
For two years Juana E. has worked selling clothing in the central market of Chinandega. She is the mother of four children and she and her husband are responsible for providing them with an education and food.

She started her business with an investment of $800 to purchase merchandise and despite the high level of competition in this business she has gradually increased her income.

Mrs. E.' immediate dream is to invest more in her business in order to acquire merchandise for sale. We cannot ignore the fact that CEPRODEL has given loans for four years and despite the high competition in the business she has started to see better results. For this reason she has decided to continue requesting loans in order to achieve her dream of being the best saleswoman in clothing sales.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace dos años a señora Juana E. se dedica a la venta de ropa en el mercado Central de Chinandega. Es madre de cuatro hijos a los que junto con su esposo tiene la obligación de brindarle su educación y alimentación.

Comenzó su negocio con una inversión de U$ 800 para invertir en mercadería sin embargo por la gran competencia de este negocio ha ido mejorando sus ingresos pero lentamente.

El sueño inmediato de la señora E. es invertir mas en su negocio para adquirir mercadería para comercializarla. No debemos obviar que con CEPRODEL ha realizado préstamos desde hace cuatro años y a pesar de la fuerte competencia en su negocio ha comenzado a ver mejores resultados por lo que se ha propuesto continuar con estos créditos para lograr alcanzar sus sueños de ser la mejor comerciante en el negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos Luis P. Macedo is married and has 6 school age children. He lives with his family in a house they own in Cruce Liberacion in the city of Santani.

He started working in the city of San Estanislao with a relative who had an agro-veterinary. He learned a lot about that business there.

He now owns a veterinary, which has been working for 6 years in the city where he lives. He rents his locale. He keeps a considerable stock of merchandise and a good clientele.

Mr. Carlos is well known in his area as a person who is hard working, honest and devoted to his job. He has good commercial and personal references.

His dream is to have his own locale so he can use the money he is now spending on rent to invest in products for his veterinary and in this way increase his business' income.

The loan will be used to buy veterinary medications and supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Carlos Luis P. Macedo es casado con 6 hijos todos menores de edad en etapa escolar, vive con su familia en su casa propia ubicada en Cruce Liberación, ciudad de Santani.

Comenzó a trabajar en la ciudad de San Estanislao, con un pariente que tenía una Agro veterinaria, allí aprendió mucho sobre este rubro

Hoy es propietario de una Veterinaria, puesta en funcionamiento hace 6 años en la ciudad donde vive, su local es alquilado. Mantiene un stock de mercaderías bien considerable y mantiene una cartera buena de clientes.

El Señor Carlos es una persona bien conocida en su localidad por ser trabajadora, honesta y dedicada en su trabajo. Tiene buenas referencias comerciales y personales.

Su sueño es tener un local propio para así el dinero que gasta en alquiler utilizarlo para invertir en productos para su Veterinaria y de esa manera aumentar los ingresos de su negocio.

El crédito será destinado a la compra de medicamentos e insumos Veterinarios.

loans.use: buying veterinary medications (COMPRAS DE MEDICAMENTOS VETERINARIOS)

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Emilio B. Arguello is married and has an adult son.

For 7 years now, he has owned a tire shop, where he sells new and used tires. He has a vast clientele thanks to his good location.

Mr. Emilio is well known in his area for being hard working, and he also has good commercial and personal references.

His dream is to expand his locale so he has space to increase his merchandise stock, buy more tires, and offer his customers a greater variety in tires. In this way he would be able to increase his sales, and in consequence his income, so he can offer his family more financial stability.

The loan will be used to buy tires.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Emilio Benítez Arguello es casado y tiene un hijo que ya es mayor de edad.

Desde hace 7 años es propietario de una gomeria, donde vende cubiertas nuevas y usadas. Cuenta con una amplia clientela gracias a su buena ubicación.

El Señor Emilio es conocido en la zona por ser trabajador, aparte tiene buenas referencias comerciales y personales.

Su sueño es ampliar su local para tener espacio para poder aumentar su stock de mercaderías, comprar más cubiertas y así brindarle a sus clientes una mayor variedad de cubiertas, de esta manera generar mayores ventas para que sus ingresos aumenten y pueda darles a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.

El crédito será destinado para la compra de cubiertas.

loans.use: Buying tires (COMPRAS DE CUBIERTAS.)

loans.name: Guillermo Ovidio

texts.es:
Guillermo has 25 years of experience working in the transportation business. He makes trips to all parts of the country, as well as to the airport, moving construction materials and other items. With his income he has been able to care for his two older children. His vehicle is essential for his work, and he is very well known in the city in which he lives due to his experience in the business. He is sought-after by clients in part because he knows how to bid jobs in relationship to other businesses in his area.

He is seeking credit in order to make necessary vehicle repairs, since with the passage of time his truck has lost power. His objective is to repair it and in that way continue working with the same vehicle since it has been his largest source of income over the years and the source of his family’s sustenance.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Guillermo tiene veinticinco años de dedicarse a el transporte, el hace viajes a todas zonas del país al aeropuerto, transporta materiales de construcción y otros, con estos ingresos a podido sacar adelante a sus dos hijos mayores, el vehículo es primordial para su trabajo, el es muy conocido en la ciudad en la que vive y debido a su experiencia en este negocio es muy buscado por los clientes además de que sabe dar un precio comparados con otros que se dedican a hacer viajes de la zona ,el crédito lo necesita para poder hacer un ajuste a su vehículo de trabajo ya que con el paso de los años lo siente deforzado , su objetivo es poder repararlo y a si de esa manera seguir trabajando con este vehículo ya que a sido su mayor fuente de ingresos en el transcurso de estos años y la fuente de alimentación de su familia.

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance for transportation business

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
Mr. Eusebio I. Candia is married and has three minor children that attend a school in the neighborhood. Together with his family he devotes his time to agriculture and the raising of cattle. They are hard-working people and very well liked in their neighborhood.

Don Eusebio has a well stocked grocery store that generates good revenues. He can depend on a large clientele since he treats them all so well.

Mr. Eusebio’s dream is to increase his inventory of products which would generate more sales and increase his revenues, making him able to provide a better future for his family.

With the loan proceeds he wants to buy products for his grocery store, such as consumer goods for the home and perishable and non perishable food products.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

El Señor Eusebio Insfrán Candia es casado, tiene 3 hijos menores de edad que asisten en un colegio de su barrio. Se dedica junto con su familia a la agricultura y ganadería. Son personas trabajadoras y muy queridas en su barrio.

Don Eusebio tiene una despensa bien surtida que le genera buenos ingresos. Cuenta con una amplia clientela, gracias al buen trato que se les brinda.

El sueño de Eusebio es poder aumentar su stock de mercaderías para que esto le genere mas ventas y así tener mayores ingresos y poder darles a su familia un futuro mejor.

Con el crédito quiere comprar mercaderías para su Despensa, artículos de primera necesidad para el hogar, productos comestibles perecederos y no perecederos.

loans.use: Purchase of inventory such as consumer goods for the home and perishable and non perishable food products.

loans.name: Fulvia

texts.es:
Fulvia G. is a single mother with four older children who work independently. They all live together in their own home.

For the past 10 years, Fulvia has worked as a butcher in the municipal market of the city where she lives, which generates good income. She has formed a strong clientele. In addition, she has good business and personal references. She is considered a very hard-working and well-loved person in her neighborhood.

Her goal is to build a commercial space in her home in order to be able to sell from her house and thereby generate a greater profit margin. This would also lead to improved quality of life.

The credit obtained would be used for the expansion of her home and the construction of a commercial space.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Fulvia G. es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos todos mayores de edad que trabajan en forma independiente. Viven todos juntos en su casa propia.

La Señora Fulvia desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de menudencias, en el mercado municipal de la ciudad donde vive, que le genera buenos ingresos. Cuenta con una muy buena clientela formada. Aparte tiene buenas referencias comerciales y personales, debido a ser una persona muy trabajadora y querida en su barrio.

Su meta es construir un salón comercial en su domicilio para poder realizar las ventas desde su casa y así generar mayor margen de ganancias y mejorar su estilo de vida.

El crédito obtenido será destinado a la ampliación de su casa, la construcción de un salón comercial.

loans.use: Expansion of her home, construction of a commercial space

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia C. de Barrios is widowed, has two grown children and lives with them in her own house.

For the last 28 years she is owner of a food store that is well situated in the city where she lives. She depends on the fact that she owns the space, has a good client base and also maintains a good inventory of products.

She is well known in the area for being very hard-working. She has excellent business and personal references.

Her goal is to increase her inventory of products in order to increase her sales and revenues and therefore improve her quality if life. The loan proceeds will be used for the purchase of various products for the food store.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Lucia Centurión de Barrios, es una señora viuda, tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad, vive junto con ellos en su casa propia.

Hace 28 años es propietaria de una despensa muy bien ubicada en la ciudad donde vive. Cuenta con un local propio y una buena clientela formada, también mantiene un buen stock de mercaderías.

Es una señora muy conocida en esa localidad por ser trabajadora. Tiene excelentes referencias comerciales y personales.

Su objetivo es aumentar su stock de mercaderías, para mejorar sus ventas e ingresos y tener una mejor calidad de vida. El crédito será destinado a la compra de mercaderías varias para su Despensa

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, flour, milk producs, baked goods, canned goods, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
For the last twenty years, Mrs. Juanita M. has been selling basic grains in the city of Chinandega. She is a woman worthy of being imitated for after not being able to cover the expenses of her home being a housewife, she used her savings of about USD $100, which she had for emergencies, and started her business.

CEPRODEL has supported Mrs. Juanita, facilitating loans to her for the last two years. In spite of the strong competition in her type of business, her results have been improving and therefore it has been proposed to continue granting her credit. With these loans she can be able to reach her goal of being the best merchant in her business. She has obtained a total of 11 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace 20 años en la ciudad de Chinandega la señora Juanita M. se dedica a la venta de granos básicos. Es una mujer digna de imitar por el hecho de que primeramente inició como ama de casa pero lastimosamente este negocio no cubría las necesidades de su hogar. Por este motivo decidió utilizar un ahorro de U$ 100 que guardaba para cualquier emergencia y de aquí nació su negocio.

CEPRODEL ha apoyado a la señora Juanita realizándole préstamos desde hace dos años y a pesar de la fuerte competencia en su negocio ha comenzado a ver mejores resultados por lo que se ha propuesto continuar con estos créditos para lograr alcanzar sus sueños de ser la mejor comerciante en el negocio. Ella ha realizado un total de 11 créditos.

loans.use: Sales of basic grains

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Marta Nancy C. is 53 years old and has three grown children. She is a hardworking person and very self-sacrificing. She is greatly loved in her neighborhood for her kindness and honesty.

Nancy has always worked in business as well as in agriculture. She has several well-located apartments, but they need to be refurbished in order to rent them.

The credit will be used for refurbishing apartments.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Marta Nancy C. tiene 53 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos todos mayores de edad. Es una persona trabajadora y muy sacrificada. Es muy querida en el barrio por su amabilidad y honestidad.

La Señora Nancy siempre trabajó en el comercio, como así también en la actividad agropecuaria.

Tiene varios salones comerciales muy bien ubicados pero necesitan ser refaccionados para poder alquilarlos.

El crédito será utilizado para la refacción de los salones comerciales.

loans.use: Refurbishing commercial space

loans.name: Maria De Jesús

texts.es:
Maria de Jesús L. is the mother of three children and she is responsible for supporting them. For ten years she has worked selling clothing in a location in the central market of Chinandega.

Despite the difficult financial situation she has gone through she has been able to reach a different quality of life and with enough hard work and sacrifice she has been able to support her three children providing them with education and food. It is important to remember that the clothing business is very competitive because there are many clothes sellers.

Over the past year and a half she has received 8 loans through CEPRODEL and has wisely invested them in the remodeling of her shop and above all in the support of her three children.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria de Jesús L. es madre de tres hijos a los que tiene la responsabilidad de mantener. Actualmente tiene 10 años de laborar en el negocio de la venta de ropa en una localidad del mercado central de Chinandega.

A pesar de la difícil situación económica que ha atravesado ha logrado alcanzar un nivel de vida un poco diferente ya que con suficiente esfuerzo y sacrificio ha podido mantener a sus tres hijos brindándole educación y alimentación. Es menester recordar que el negocio de venta de ropa es muy competitivo ya que hay muchos comerciantes de este producto.

Ella ha realizado desde hace un año y medio 8 créditos con Ceprodel invirtiéndolos sabiamente en la remodelación de su local y sobre todo en la manutención de sus tres hijos.

loans.use: Investment in her business

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es:
