Nestor Miguel Alfonzo is single. He has a daughter who lives with him and is in school in the city. He is a hard working and beloved in his neighborhood.

He has a general store in his home, with a well-established clientele, which generates a good income. He has good commercial and personal references.

His goal is to expand his merchandise stock in the area of school supplies, because there are many students in his area and a demand for such products.

The loan will be used to buy school supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Néstor Miguel Alfonzo es soltero, tiene una hija que vive con él y estudia en un Colegio de la ciudad. Es una persona muy trabajadora y querida en su barrio.

Tiene una Salón Comercial en su domicilio, con una buena clientela formada que le genera buenos ingresos. Posee buenas referencias comerciales y personales.

Su meta es ampliar su stock de mercaderías en el rubro de librería, ya que en la zona hay muchos estudiantes y hace falta.

El crédito será destinado a la compra de artículos de librería.

loans.use: Buying school supplies such as notebooks, books, pencils, erasers, rulers, etc, (compra de artículos de librería como cuadernos, libros, lápices, borradores, reglas, etc.)

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
For 8 years Nelson C. has worked selling footware in the city of Chinandega. Nelson is inspired by his two small children and for this reason he works hard to bring sustenance back to his humble home. He started his shoe store eight years ago selling few products that were not in high demand. He then began to expand his products until now.

He has worked with CEPRODEL for the past year and has demonstrated that he works well with the loans because they were very helpful and were granted at the right tim. He has a loan history of 4 loans.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Nelson C. desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de calzados en el municipio de Chinandega. A Nelson lo inspiran sus dos pequeños hijos y por tal razón es un arduo trabajador para llevar el sostenimiento a su humilde hogar. Su negocio de calzado comenzó hace ocho años con la venta de pocos productos que por cierto eran poco demandados. Luego fue ampliando sus productos hasta llegar al día de hoy.

Este cliente, trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace un año, el nos manifiesta que se siente muy bien con los créditos otorgados pues han sido muy oportunos y brindados de manera muy ágil. Su record crediticio es de 4 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase of shoes

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
Pilar R. is a widow with two school-age children who, with much sacrifice, words hard to support her children and provide them with all of the support that they need.

Two years ago she started her general store with $450. Over the months she has used this money to supply her business with more products. This woman is a great example that despite the fact that she doesn't have a husband at her side she has been to support both herself and her children.

She has received 7 loans from CEPRODEL over the last two years and thanks to these loans Pilar has been able to succeed in her business. She confesses that her dream is to one day she her children graduate with a university degree.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Pilar R. es una madre viuda y con dos hijos en la edad escolar que con muchísimo sacrificio se esfuerza para mantenerlos y brindarles todo su apoyo en lo que amerita.

Con un monto de U$ 450 desde hace dos años inició su negocio de pulpería de los cuales a través de los meses ha venido surtiendo de mas productos. Esta dama es un gran ejemplo que a pesar de que no tiene a su esposo a su lado ha logrado superar su vida y la de sus hijos.

Ha realizado 7 créditos en Ceprodel desde hace dos años, esta es la razón por la que la señora Pilar ha podido salir adelante. Confiesa que su sueño es ver algún día a sus hijos coronando una carrera universitaria.

loans.use: Investment in her business

loans.name: Emilce

texts.es:
Mrs. Emilce Z. is 58 years old. She is a single mom of two daughters, one of them is 28 years old and is a teacher, and the other one is 17 and is studying the final year in high school. They both live with her.

Mrs. Emilce is the owner of a grocery store, which she started in 1988 with a small sum she had saved. She now has a well-established clientele because of the personalized attention and the good variety of products she offers to her customers.

Mrs. Emilce is requesting the loan to buy merchandise such as sweet bread, beverages in general, rice, pasta, vegetables, fruit, and fireworks because the end of the year is approaching and in this season there is an increase in the demand of those products.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Emilce Z. de 58 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijas, una de 28 años de edad que se encuentra ejerciendo la docencia y la otra de 17 años que esta cursando el último año del nivel medio, ambas viven con ella.

La señora es propietaria de una despensa la cual inició en el año 1988 con un pequeño ahorro con el que contaba. Ella ya cuenta con una clientela bien formada gracias a la atención personalizada y la buena variedad de productos que les otorga a sus clientes.

La clienta solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como pan dulce, bebidas en general, arroz, fideos, verduras, frutas y la compra de juegos artificiales, ya que se acercan las fiestas de fin de año y en esta época aumenta la demanda de dichos productos.

loans.use: buying merchandise such as sweet bread, beverages in general, rice, pasta, vegetables, fruit, and fireworks  (Para la compra de bebidas en general, compra de pan dulce, compra de arroz, compra de fideos, compra de verduras, frutas, compra de juegos artificiales)

loans.name: Rosa Inés

texts.es:
Rosa Vallecillo is a married woman, the mother of one school-aged son. She is hardworking and has dreams of success in both her personal life and her business. She started her business selling footwear five years ago, offering a variety of products, with a start-up capital of $900.00.

Ros Vallecillo has worked with CEPRODEL for one year and is very happy with the support they have given her. Thanks to this support she has been able to expand her business, meet her clientèle's needs and support her family. She has a history of four loans.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Rosa Vallecillo es una mujer casada, madre de un hijo que esta en edad escolar, ella es una persona trabajadora con deseos de superación tanto en su vida personal como es su negocio. Inicio su negocio de venta de calzados hace cinco años, ofreciendo variedad de productos, con un capital de U$900.00.

La Sra. Rosa Vallecillo trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace un año y se siente muy satisfecha por el apoyo ofrecido, ya que de esta manera ha podido incrementar su negocio, satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela y sacar adelante a su familia. Ella tiene un record de Cuatro créditos.

loans.use: Purchase of footwear

loans.name: Anuncio

texts.es:
Anuncio Martínez in 43 years old, married and has 4 children.

He has been very hardworking since he was young. His goal was always to open a brick shop and thus create a source of work for the people living in his area. Since he did not have the capital to open this business, he decided to travel to Argentina to work as a mason and thus return with enough capital to open his business.

After much sacrifice he returned to his country to achieve his goal, started his business and now has one of the biggest shops in the area with all of the work that he creates for persons from his town. Through his business he can support his family because he has a good income, and has improved his quality of life and that of his family.

The loan requested will be used to buy materials for his business.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

El Señor Anuncio Martínez tiene 43 años de edad, es casado y tiene 4 hijos.

Desde joven fue muy trabajador. Su meta siempre fue abrir una olería y así generar fuentes de trabajo para las personas de la zona. Como no contaba en ese entonces con un capital para abrir este negocio, decidió viajar a la Argentina para ir trabajar como albañil y así volver con un buen capital y abrir su Olería.

Fue así que después de mucho sacrificio volvió al país para cumplir con su meta, inicio su olería y hoy es una de las mas grandes de la zona, con el trabajo que le proporciona a las personas de su pueblo, puede mantener a su familia ya que le genera muy buenas ganancias, ha mejorado su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de materiales para su olería.

loans.use: purchase of cement, sand and other supplies

loans.name: Verónica Del Rosario

texts.es:
Verónica del Rosario C. R. is a married woman and the mother of a school-age child, She is hardworking and has dreams to succeed in both her personal life and her business. She started her business selling footware five years ago, offering a variety of products, with a start-up capital of $900.00.

Mrs. C. R. has worked with CEPRODEL for one year and is very happy with the support they have given her. With this support she has been able to expand her business, meet her clientèle's needs and support her family. She has a history of four loans.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Verónica del Rosario C. R. es una mujer casada, madre de un hijo que esta en edad escolar, ella es una persona trabajadora con deseos de superación tanto en su vida personal como en su negocio. Inicio su negocio de calzados hace cinco años, ofreciendo variedad de productos, con un capital de U$900.00.

La Sra. C. R. trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace Un años y se siente muy satisfecha por el apoyo ofrecido, ya que de esta manera ha podido incrementar su negocio, satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela y sacar adelante a su familia. Ella tiene un record de Cuatro créditos.

loans.use: Investment in her business

loans.name: Dora Fatima

texts.es:
Mrs. Dora Fatima M. Diaz is a single mother of two children. They live in the city of Ybycui in her own house.

Because she didn't have a profession or a fixed income and she had to support her children, she decided to travel to Argentina in search of better job opportunities. She found work as a cleaning lady and in a short time saved a small capital and returned to her hometown. She invested her money to open a small grocery store selling basic needs food items. With time she acquired a good clientele and her business grew.

Currently, her grocery store is well stocked, and the best in the area.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to buy cider, sugar, pasta, and other food products.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Dora Fátima Morínigo Díaz es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos y viven en la ciudad de Ybycui en su casa propia.

Como no tenía una profesión ni un ingreso fijo y tenía que mantener a sus hijos, decidió viajar a Argentina en busca de oportunidades de trabajo. Consiguió trabajo como empleada doméstica y en poco tiempo reunió un pequeño capital y volvió a su ciudad, invirtió su dinero para abrir un pequeño almacén con venta de artículos comestibles de primera necesidad para el hogar. Con el tiempo fue adquiriendo buena clientela y su negocio fue creciendo.

En la actualidad es una despensa bien surtida y la mejor de la zona.

Con el crédito solicitado desea comprar sidra, azúcar, fideo y otros productos alimenticios.

loans.use: buying cider, sugar, pasta, and other food products  (Compra de  sidra, azúcar, arroz, fideo y otros productos alimenticios.)

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Mr. Jorge L. is 48 years old. He is single and lives in the city of Ybycui with his mother. Since his father passed away, he had to take on the responsibility of taking care of her because she of a very advanced age.

He works in the production and sale of vegetable coal (charcoal) and he does very well because there isn't another business like that in his area. His dream is to one day have a family and children.

With the loan he is requesting he wants to buy materials to build a larger furnace to increase production and satisfy his demand.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

El Señor Jorge L. tiene 48 años de edad, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ybycuí en compañía de su madre, desde que falleció su padre tuvo que asumir la responsabilidad de cuidar de ella ya que su edad era muy avanzada.

Se dedica a la producción y venta de carbón vegetal y le va muy bien ya que en la zona no existe otra.

Su sueño es alguna vez formar una familia y tener hijos.

Con el crédito solicitado desea comprar materiales para construir un horno más grande para mejorar la producción y cumplir con la demanda.

loans.use: Buying materials to build a furnace to produce coal (Compra de materiales para la construcción de un horno para producción)

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
Mr. Porfirio V. is 39 years old. He is married and has three children in elementary school. They live in the city of Ybucui and own their house.

He has worked selling milk since 1990. He started in this business with the help of his father, who gave him three milking cows with their calves. This business produces good profits which help him support his household. Early in the morning, his wife milks the cows, and then Don Porfirio starts distributing the milk in the neighborhoods, because they have an established clientele.

They hope their children will study and become professional, and to achieve this they are willing to work more to obtain greater profits. The loan would be used to buy two milking cows from Holland.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

El Señor Porfirio V. tiene 39 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos menores de edad que están cursando la primaria, viven en la Ciudad de Ybucui en su casa propia.

Se dedica a la venta de leche desde 1990. Se inicio en esta actividad con la ayuda de su padre quien le había regalado tres lecheras con crías. Este negocio le genera buenas ganancias que le ayudan a mantener su casa.

Su esposa desde temprano ordeña a sus lecheras y luego Don Porfirio comienza a distribuir la leche por los barrios, ya que tiene su clientela formada.

Desean que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales, para ello quieren trabajar más y así obtener mejores ganancias. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de dos lecheras Holanda.

loans.use: buying milking cows (compra de dos vacas lecheras)

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Trần Thị A., 40 years of age, lives with her husband and 3 children. She tends her beef stand at the open market near home while her husband, Trần Xuân Hòa, is buying cows for meat from nearby provinces and butchering them for her stand. From their beginning of purchasing wholesale beef, now Hòa butchers for their own, and also extra for supplying to other small meat stands. The family’s business has been steady for 5 years now. It requires more capital for expansion so she applies a special loan of 1200USD. The family’s monthly income is 150USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Trần Thị A. năm nay 40 tuổi sống cùng chồng và 3 con. Công việc chính của chị là bán thịt bò ở chợ trong khi chồng chị, A. Trần Xuân Hòa, mua bò từ các tỉnh lân cận mang về mổ thịt cho vợ bán. Gia đình chị A. làm công việc này được 5 năm nay. Bắt đầu từ chỗ chỉ đến các lò mổ lấy thịt, đến nay gia đình chị đã tự mổ thịt bò và cung cấp cho các cửa hàng nhỏ. Công việc này đòi hỏi một nguồn tài chính tương đối lớn nên chị đã đề nghị Quỹ TYM cho vay mức vốn đặc biệt là 1200USD. Mức thu nhập bình quân một tháng của gia đình chị A. hiện nay là 150USD/tháng.

loans.use: Purchase more cows for meat.

loans.name: Vuong Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Vương Thị T., 48 years of age, lives with her husband and 4 children in Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. She joined the TYM Fund in 2003 with her first loan of 60USD. She invested the funds in her small scale animal husbandry and vegetable sales business. The result of that modest loan has encouraged her to apply for more loans. Currently she has a stock of dozen of pigs that earns her a monthly income of 150USD. She plans to purchase more piglets and feed with her next loan of 1200USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Vương Thị T., 48 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 4 con tại Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. Chị tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 2003 và vay mức vốn đầu tiên là 60USD. Với số vốn này chị đã đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và buôn bán nhỏ các mặt hàng rau quả. Kết quả thu được giúp chị T. mạnh dạn tiếp tục sử dụng đồng vốn vay mở mở rộng dự án của mình. Hiện chị đang có một đàn lợn hơn 10 con và mức thu nhập hàng tháng đạt 150USD. Dự định trong thời gian tới chị sẽ xin vay 1200USD để mua thêm lợn con và thức ăn gia súc.

loans.use: Buy pigs and mash

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoàng Thị Kế, 47 years of age, is a fifth year member of the TYM Fund. She invested her first loan of 50USD in a few dozens ducklings, now the flock has grown to hundreds of ducks. She also owns a fish pond and dozen of pigs. She is so confident with her experience of running her business, that confidence has encouraged her to taK. out more loans. The profit of those loans has not only improved the family’s economy, covered her children’s education expenses but also been used as seeds for next cycles of investment. Her current income is 140USD a month. She is applying a loan of 1200USD to purchase feeds for her animal stock.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Hoàng Thị Kế, 47 tuổi là thành viên năm thức 5 của Quỹ Tình thương. Từ mức vay đầu tiên là 50USD đủ mua vài chục vịt con đến nay đàn vịt của chị Kế đã lên đến vài trăm. Ngoài ra chị còn có 1 ao cá và vài chục con lợn. Kinh nghiệm tích lũy trong nhiều năm đầu tư vào chăn nuôi đã giúp chị mạnh dạn tăng nguồn vốn vay lên qua mỗi vòng. Nguồn lợi nhuận thu được không những giúp chị cải thiện đời sống gia đình, cho các con ăn học mà còn tạo thêm nguồn vốn đầu tư cho các vòng sau. Với nguồn thu nhập hiện tại là 140USD/tháng chị Kế dự định sẽ xin vay thêm 1200USD mua thức ăn cho đàn vịt, lợn và ao cá.

loans.use: Buy food for pigs, ducks, fishes

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị A., 45 years of age, of Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ A., joined the TYM Fund since 2003. Her first loA. of 50USD was used for her small animal husbandry. That business was typical among people in the area. Although the profit of that first loA. was modest, it has encouraged her to continue the same business model. Mrs. A. plans to use her next loA. of 400USD for purchasing more piglets and mash. Her current income is 125USD a month. She lives with her husband and 8 children.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị A., 45 tuổi, Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ A. tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 2003. Mức vay đầu tiên của chị là 50USD. Như đa số chị em tại địa phương chị A. sử dụng số vốn này vào chăn nuôi nhỏ. Nguồn lợi thu được sau vòng vốn đầu tiên không nhiều nhưng đã khích lệ chị tiếp tục phát triển dự án của mình trong các vòng tiếp theo. Vòng vốn tới chị làm đơn xin vay 400USD để mua lợn con và cám. Mức thu nhập hiện tại của chị A. là 125USD/tháng, chị đang sống cùng chồng và 8 người con tại Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ A..

loans.use: Buy piglets and mash

loans.name: Munnawer's Group

texts.en: Munnawer M. earns money selling both blankets and clothing at her house, while her daughters help Munnawer in bookkeeping. She has been in this business for the past four years, and has managed to establish a strong client base. She has five children: three daughters and two sons. Her husband works at a factory for a wage that has been insufficient for the household's expenses and forced Munnawer to start her own business. She lives with her family in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. Munnawer is asking for a loan to buy blankets for sale. Her group members are: Zainab A. R. who needs a loan to buy wood for her husband, Shamim S. who is asking for a loan for her husband’s electronics store, Ameeran L. who is borrowing for her husband's fruit business, Munnawer B. who needs a loan for her grocery store, and Anwer B. who needs financial support for her husband's garlic vending business.

loans.use: Purchase of blankets for a business

loans.name: Naziran's Group

texts.en:
I am Naziran B. wife of Mohammad Nazir. I am the mother of six: two daughters and four sons. We all live in Lahore, a historic city in Pakistan. My husband operates a catering shop; two of my sons also help him in this business. My elder children could not get an education due to our poor financial circumstances but now our income has grown and therefore, I have enrolled my younger kids in school.

We have been in this business for six years. Now, we need to buy new crockery and tents for our business and for this, we need a loan.

My other group members are Sakina B. who needs a loan for her grocery store; Tasleem A. G. who needs a loan for her cloth business; Azra B. who needs a loan for a container manufacturing business; and Rasheeda B. who requires a loan for her son’s butcher shop.

loans.use: Buy items for our little catering business

loans.name: Firdos' Group

texts.en:
I am Firdos A. and I live in Lahore, a big metropolis in Pakistan. I am married and the mother of seven. My husband runs a fruit business and now he requires a loan to buy fruit in bulk for his business so as to increase his income.

Now I would like to introduce my other group members. They are:

Budhan B. who requires a loan to buy a cow.

Koser A. whose husband needs to buy a cow.

Munnawer Gulam F. who needs a loan for their toy business; and

Parveen A. who desires a loan to buy her son a rickshaw.

loans.use: Buy fruit in bulk and expand businesses for four other women

loans.name: Shugufta's Group

texts.en:
My name is Shugufta Y. and I come from a big city: Lahore, Pakistan. I am married and the mother of an only son. My son has recently married. Both my husband and son operate a fruit business; they have separate fruit carts for this purpose. Now, after our son's wedding, our expenses have increased and we feel a need for an extra income. For this reason, they have decided to expand their fruit business and to do that, they require a loan.

There are few other women among my friends who are also in a need of a loan for their businesses. Alia B. needs a loan for her son’s scrapyard. Nasreen A. requires a loan for her grocery store. Suriya B. needs a loan for her husband’s juice corner to buy him a juicer. Razia A. needs a loan for the expansion of her husband’s grocery store. I know all these women; they are very responsible and hardworking and strive to make their families' lives better.

loans.use: Expand our family's fruit business

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
I am Shamim H. and I live with my family in Lahore, a city in Pakistan with a long history. My family consists of my husband and three kids: two daughters and one son. My husband buys and sells cows as well as selling their milk. For his milk-selling business, he owns four cows and sells their milk twice a day. Now we need to buy an additional cow for our milk business.

Our other group members are

Koser S. (she requires a loan for her husband’s restaurant);

Parveen G. (she needs to buy her son an overlock machine for his business);

Akbari B. (her husband needs a loan to invest in his vegetable and garlic business); and

Razia N. (who needs a loan for her husband’s nursery/garden center).

We all hope to have a very positive impact on our businesses with your loan.

loans.use: Buy an additional cow for my husband's business and help our other group members' businesses

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
I am Shamim A. and I live in a mid-size city, Faisalabad in Pakistan. I am the mother of nine: six daughters and three sons. My husband has been a barber for the past ten years. Now, he wishes to start his own barber shop for which he requires buying chairs, tables, mirrors, hair dryers, scissors etc. We lack financial means for this purpose and therefore require a loan.

There are four more women who are in my loan group and need loans to improve their businesses. My group members are:

Rubina B. (who needs loan for her husband’s fruit business);

Zahida B. (her husband needs to buy a donkey cart);

Riffat B. (she requires loan to invest in her husband’s restaurant); and Majeedan B. needs a loan for her husband’s fruit business.

All of my group members are very good and cooperative. They always listen to me as their leader and are very honest in their dealings.

loans.use: Start barber shop for my husband and help my group members with their businesses

loans.name: Sobia's Group

texts.en:
My name is Sobia M. Y.. I am married and I live with my husband in Faisalabad, Pakistan. I run a beauty salon that I started two years ago. I operate seven days a week from 9 am till 5 pm. I have a good client base and now I'd like to expand my business for which I require a loan.

I also want to request loans from you for my other group members who are:

Sughran B. (who needs a loan to buy a rickshaw for her son);

Suriya B. (her husband is a scrap dealer and needs a loan to buy scrap items in bulk);

Tasleem K. (she is a seamstress and needs a loan to buy cloth and other items); and lastly,

Razia B. (she has a milk-selling business and needs an additional cow).

Your loan can add new life to the businesses of all of us.

loans.use: Expand my beauty salon and other group members' businesses

loans.name: Rashida Riaz's Group

texts.en: I am Rasheeda R. and I live in Faisalabad, Pakistan. I am married and a mother of eight: seven sons and one daughter. Currently, three of my kids are studying while others work. My husband works at a government institute for a meager income and one of my sons sells files that are used in various organizations for legal documentation. Now, he needs to expand his business and therefore requires a loan for this purpose. I shall now like to introduce the other group members of my loan group.They are Yasmeen B. who needs to buy a cow for her family's  business. Kubra B. whose husband wants to buy a rickshaw. Arshad F. who needs a loan for her grocery store. Sardaran B. she is a widow and needs loan to buy her son a donkey cart.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Shamim Akhter's Group

texts.en: I am a widow, Shamim A. from the  midsize city  of Faisalabad, Pakistan. I live here in Lahore with my seven kids: six daughters and one son. My elder children had to quit their  studies after their father’s death and work for small pays Now, I have enrolled my younger kids at school so that at least they can get an education. I need a loan to start a grocery store so that I can increase our household income and continue with the studies of my kids. My other group members are Akbari B. she needs a loan for her son to buy him a donkey cart.   Ramzan B. needs a loan for her son’s barber shop. Suriya B. is a widow and needs a loan to buy her son a motorcycle to transport goods from one place to another. Sughran B.'s  son wants a loan to start his own motorcycle repair shop. All of these women have promised themselves to throw poverty out of their houses. So please help us in our mission.

loans.use: Start a grocery store

loans.name: Nazia Bibi's Group

texts.en: My name is Nazia B. from Faisalabad, a textile city in Pakistan. I am married and a mother of an only son who is one year old. My husband sells plants on his cart. Earlier he used to work in a factory but  the factory had to shut down and my husband started this business a year ago. We need a loan to buy plants in bulk for our business. There area  few other women in my community who all are very hardworking and require loans for their businesses. They are: Rasheeda B. who requires a loan for her husband’s scrap business. Hameeda B.  needs a loan to buy a fruit cart for her husband. Rubina B. requires a loan to manufacture small cloth bags in which sweets are stored. Samina K. she needs a loan to help her son to expand his files( a paper used for legal documentation) business.

loans.use: Buy plants

loans.name: Emay

texts.en: Emay is a 29 year old woman.  She sells gasoline and usually earns $30 per month, which is just enough for the family's daily needs.  Her husband, S., is an employee at the workshop and earns $50 per month.  She would like to expand her business, and increase her capital by requesting a $125 loan.  Emay is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Inah

texts.en: Inah is a 25 year old woman who has a small shop where she sells snacks, household goods, cigarettes, rice and many other things.  She is able to earn $6 per day due to the amount and variety of goods she has in stock.  Inah is requesting a $125 loan to fill her shop with more inventory.  Her husband, E., has no fixed income so she has to work hard for her children's education.  She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her shp

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en: “I live in Lahore the second largest city of Pakistan. I have five children, two boys and three girls and all of them go to school except the youngest one who is only two. My husband and I want to pay-off our Rickshaw (local three wheeled vehicle) which we bought a few years ago. With a loan we will be able to pay off the cost of the Rickshaw and it will be ours and we will save on interest payments. Besides driving the Rickshaw, my husband does gardening, which brings in extra income. Hence, we would have no trouble paying off your loan.”

loans.use: Pay-off a Rickshaw

loans.name: Ana  Julia

texts.es:
Mrs. M. due to economic circumstances has dedicated herself to orange selling since childhood. Her mother taught her how to make a living from this profession as she started earning her keep since the age of 7 accompanying her mother to the market.

As her business grows, she hopes to improve her quality of life and her business conditions as she dreams of having a permanent stand in the local market.

Currently she has a cart with a plastic roof but remains hopeful that one day the conditions of her locale will improve and her children can go to school.

Consider that the financial aid from CEPRODEL has been the economic pillar that has allowed the development of her business and the improvement of the quality of life of her family and she hopes to improve the conditions of her locale little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. M. desde muy pequeña por circunstancias economicas se dedica a la venta de naranjas quinen le enseña esta forma de ganarse la vida es su señora madre a quien acompaña desde la edad de siete años a ganarse su sustento.

Al ir creciendo tiene la esperanza de ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y las de su negocio ya que sueña con tener un local fijo en el mercado.

Aunque actualmente tiene un pequeño tramo en el mercado con techo de plástico no pierde la esperanza en que algún día las condiciones de su local se mejoren y sus hijos puedan asistir al colegio.

Considera que el apoyo financiero de CEPRODEL ha sido el pilar económico que la ha permitido el desarrollo de su negocio y a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y espera ir mejorando las condiciones de su local poco a poco.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es:
Mrs. A. started her business by selling yucca, potatoes, tamarind, chayotes (prickly pear or christophine), sugar beets, and carrots as a traveling saleswoman since the age of 8. She used to accompany her sister in this line of work.

With the hope of improving her quality of life, she looked for financial aid and with the helping hand of CEPRODEL, she’ll be able to further her business.

Currently she has a small locale, not in the best condition but at least it has a roof to protect it from the elements.

One of her goals is to improve the conditions of her locale and that her daughter keeps up her studies in order to have a better life. She doesn’t want her daughter to have to work since childhood as she did and earn her keep as well as support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. A. inicia su negocio con la venta de yuca, papa, Tamarindo, Chayote, Remolacha y Zanahoria ambulante desde la edad de ocho años en un inicio acompañaba a su hermana en esta faena.

Con la esperanza de mejorar su nivel de vida decide la búsqueda de apoyo financiero y es por medio de la mano amiga de CEPRODEL que ha logrado el desarrollo de su negocio.

Actualmente cuenta con pequeño local no muy bien acondicionado pero por lo menos tiene un techo para soportar las inclemencias del clima.

Una de sus metas es mejorar las condiciones de su local y el que su hija siga estudiando para que logre un mejor nivel de vida y no le suceda con ella que tuvo que trabajar desde muy pequeña para ganarse su sustento y permitirse el apoyo económico de su familia.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Sarinah

texts.en: Sarinah is a 21 year old woman who keeps chicken livestock at her house.  She has to raise and fatten them before she can sell her chickens.  She is able to earn $50 per month.  Her husband, O., has no fixed income.  She needs a IDR 900,000 (USD $100) loan to expand her business and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her chicken livestock

loans.name: Arístides

texts.es:
Mr. Martinez A. dedicates himself to selling watches, padlocks, magazines, sunglasses, and imitation jewelry. He's been doing this for 16 years.

Consider that CEPRODEL's financial aid will be a determining factor in furthering his business. He currently has a small area in the market with a plastic roof and no walls. He hopes that through this loan from CEPRODEL he'll be able to improve his life daily.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. M. A. se dedica a la venta de relojes, candados, revistas, anteojos para el sol en fin productos de bisutería ejerce esta actividad desde hace ya 16 años.

Considera que el aporte financiero que la ha brindado CEPRODEL ha sido un factor determinante en el desarrollo de su negocio actualmente tiene un pequeño piso en el mercado con techo de plástico no tiene paredes pero tiene la esperanza de que por medio de los financiamientos de CEPRODEL mejorar día a día.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
“I live in Lahore, a large city and have six daughters. My eldest daughter has finished tenth grade and now attending a sewing course. She could not continue her education because government colleges are too far and private ones are too expensive. The other girls are in school.  

I need a loan so that we can invest in my general store. I want to diversify my store and add cosmetics and cloth to the store. My store is doing well now that I have a no credit policy. Besides running the general store, I also design traditional textiles and sell to rich women in Lahore. I actually started with my business by sewing clothes. My husband’s government income was not enough to make ends meet and I literally knocked on people’s doors to give me clothes to sew. I believe that my enterprising spirit will help me go a long way.”

loans.use: Add Cosmetics and cloth to the general store

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
Mrs Basilia formerly worked as a homemaker, but circumstances in her life changed when her husband lost his job. Faced with this situation, she decided to invest her savings in the bulk purchase of onions and peppers. In the beginning, she sold these products in the market bus terminals.

She says that the financial support of CEPRODEL has been fundamental in the development of her business. The unconditional support and financing have allowed her to purchase merchandise, offer a better price to her customers, and now have a small location of her own to sell from.

One of her goals is to improve the conditions of her location, replacing the roof which is now made of plastic, and to improve the quality of life of her family.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Basilia anteriormente se dedicaba a atender su hogar pero por imprevistos de la vida su esposo pierde su empleo, ante esta situación decide el invertir sus ahorros en la compra de Cebollas y Chiltoma al por mayor, anteriormente para realizar la venta de sus productos los comercializa ambulante en las terminales de buses del mercado.

Considera que el aporte financiero de CEPRODEL ha sido fundamental en el desarrollo de su negocio quien la apoya incondicionalmente y que través de los financiamiento le permiten la compra de mercadería al contado, ofrece un mejor precio a sus clientes y actualmente cuenta con un pequeño local en donde ofrece su mercadería.

Una de sus metas es mejorar las condiciones de su local, cambiar el techo ya que actualmente es de plástico y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Aap

texts.en: Aap is 36 years old and is married.  She has a small shop where she sells snacks, household goods, cigarettes, rice and many other things.  She is able to earn $44.50 per month due to the large variety of goods she has in stock.  Aap is requesting a IDR 800,000 (USD $100) loan to fill her shop.  Her husband, A., has no fixed income so she has to work hard for her children's education.  She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her shop

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Mrs. A. was introduced to fruit-selling in childhood, working alongside her father, who taught her this method of earning a living.

Over time she has asked for credit and she considers the financial support that CEPRODEL has provided to be a determining factor in the development of her business. Currently she has a small floor space in the local market with a plastic roof and no walls, but she hopes that through CEPRODEL financing she will be able to improve her business day by day.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. A. se inicia en este negocio desde su infancia, trabajando al lado de su padre, quien le enseña esta forma de ganarse la vida.

Con el transcurso del tiempo decide la solicitud de créditos y en este sentido considera que el aporte financiero que la ha brindado CEPRODEL ha sido un factor determinante en el desarrollo de su negocio actualmente tiene un pequeño piso en el mercado con techo de plástico no tiene paredes pero tiene la esperanza de que por medio de los financiamientos de CEPRODEL mejorar día a día.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Doris  Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doris decided to invest her life savings in the purchase of potatoes, squash, yucca, (casava), cabbage, peppers and tamarindo, as she could not find employment to support her young children. Her only option in the beginning was to start this business selling in the market.

Over time, and with the financial support of CEPRODEL she now has a small location, which, though it lacks proper infrastructure, at least has a roof the cover her from the weather.

One of her goals is to develop her business and to improve her family's quality of life. She has said that CEPRODEL has been her right hand in helping her in various circumstances.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Doris decide invertir los ahorros de toda su vida en la compra Papas, Ayote, Yuca, Repollo, Chiltoma y Tamarindo, en vista de no encontrar empleo y para sustentar a sus pequeños hijos no tiene mas alternativa que dedicarse a este negocio en el que en un inicio los comercializa ambulante en el mercado.

En el trascurso del tiempo y con el aporte financiero de CEPRODEL hoy en día tiene un pequeño local no en buenas condiciones de infraestructuras pero por lo menos tiene un techo donde soportar las inclemencias del tiempo.

Una de sus metas es lograr el desarrollo de su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia y para ello comenta que CEPRODEL ha sido su mano amiga quien le ayuda en toda circunstancias.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Fiza

texts.en: “I live in the bustling city of Lahore in Pakistan along with my husband and four children. I send three of my children to school because they should learn and these days education is a major requirement for survival. My youngest child is a toddler. My husband and I need a loan so that we can purchase a new Rickshaw. We want to purchase a four stroke Rickshaw, which the government has recently introduced. We will sell our old Rickshaw and combine it with your loan so we can buy a new one. My husband provides transportation services in the city to people who use his services regularly. I also help generate additional income for our family by tutoring children of junior classes since I have studied up to tenth grade myself.”

loans.use: Purchase a new Rickshaw

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en: “I live in Lahore, a major city of Pakistan with my husband and ten children. My eldest son has finished tenth grade and the girls have finished middle school.  My husband needs  who works as a contractor in the construction business needs a loan to  buy some materials. I also run an embroidery business. With the profits my husband hopes to diversify the business to include a cement distribution store. I also hope that my children either get good jobs or study as much as they want.”

loans.use: Purchase construction material

loans.name: Saiyah

texts.en: Saiyah is 41 year old woman who has a small shop and sells crackers, snacks, vegetables, etc.  She usually earns $12 per day.  Her husband, W., has no fixed income.  Saiyah is requesting a IDR 1,200,000 (USD $150) loan to buy some goods to fill the shop.  She hopes that this loan will help her to support her family and get more income for her children's education.  She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her shop

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en: “I live in Lahore, Pakistan. My husband is a day labourer in the construction industry. He brings in about US$ 5 per day, which is insufficient to take care of six children. My older children dropped out of school since we used to live in a small village, where education was not encouraged. Thankfully, now my children are in school. My husband now wants to provide public transport in a rickshaw (local three-wheeled vehicle) purchased with a loan. He believes that he can make more money with this job.”

loans.use: Purchase a rickshaw

loans.name: Hajran

texts.en: “I live in Lahore, a big bustling city of Pakistan, with nine children. My husband is a day labourer. My eldest son provides transport service on a rickshaw (local three-wheeled vehicle), but it is old now. He wants to purchase a new one with a loan and some savings. With the profits, I would like to get my daughters married with some dignity.”

loans.use: Purchase a new rickshaw

loans.name: Julia Marina

texts.es:
Julia has been selling fruit for the past 22 years. She started her business with her own savings and a loan. She decided to start this business after finding herself unemployed. Her family runs a small stand in the market. This has been the only means they have found for earning a living. The financial assistance of CEPRODEL would allow Julia to develop her business by purchasing in bulk. She could thereby offer a better price for her products.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Julia se dedica a la actividad de venta de frutas desde hace 22 años inicia su negocio con sus ahorros y un préstamo .

Decide el iniciar su propio negocio al quedarse sin empleo ademas de que su familia tiene sus pequeños negocios en el mercado por ser la unica forma que encuentran de ganarse su sustento diario.

Con los financiamientos de CEPRODEL le permiten el desarrollo de su negocio, compra de contado y ofrece a un mejor precio sus productos.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en: “I am from Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan and live with my husband and three of my six children; the others are married. I need a loan for my husband who will invest it in his grocery store. The money will be used to purchase goods in bulk and save on costs. We have been operating the store for the past three years. We started the store with a loan from a microfinance institution called Asasah and the store has been doing well ever since.”

loans.use: expand the inventory for their grocery store

loans.name: Marcelina De Los  Sa

texts.es:
Mrs Marcelina has worked as a fruit vendor for 26 years. She began her business with a loan.

Currently, she offers her merchandise on the sidewalk in the market. She began doing this when she could not find work, as she needed to support her family.

Hoping to progress little by little, she has decided to request loans from CEPRODEL which allow her to grow her business, pay for her product in cash, and to offer a better price on her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Marcelina se dedica a la actividad de venta de frutas desde hace 26 años inicia su negocio con un préstamo .

Actualmente para vender sus mercadería las exhibe en la acera del mercado y lo realiza al no encontrar trabajo y por la necesidad de mantener a su familia. Con la esperanza de progresar poco a poco opta por solicitar prestamos a CEPRODEL y le permiten el desarrollo de su negocio, compra de contado y ofrece a un mejor precio sus productos.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
“I am originally from the big city of Lahore. I have two children, a boy and girl. My son is in school while my daughter is too young to attend school yet. My husband works in a mall as an elevator operator and earns a salary of US$ 110 per month. I also embroider clothes to earn a bit extra.

We live with our in-laws and my mother works in someone’s kitchen and my father-in-law is retired from his government job. He now wants to start a grocery store and we need a loan to help him start up this business. We will open the store in the main market near our home, where sales can be good. This will help increase our family income.”

loans.use: Open a grocery store

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es:
María José has been dedicated to the sale of soft drinks and coffee for the past 17 years. She started her business with a loan of $100.00. Faced with the need to support her family as a single mother of two young children, María José is asking for a loan from CEPRODEL. She comments that she is grateful for the help that CEPRODEL offers as it will make it possible for her to develop her business, purchase in bulk, and offer a better price for her products.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Maria José se dedica a la actividad de venta de Gaseosas y Café desde hace 17 años e inicia su negocio con un préstamo de $100.00.

Ante la necesidad de sustentar su familia al ser madre soltera de dos pequeños solicita financiamientos a CEPRODEL de quien comenta sentirse satisfecha con la atención que brindan al resultarle optimo para el desarrollo de su negocio, compra de contado y ofrece a un mejor precio sus productos.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Vuong Thi Hai

texts.vi:
Mrs. Vương Thị Hải Xuân, 57 years of age, lives with her husband and 2 children in Phúc Yên, Vĩnh Phúc province. She is a fifth year member of TYM Fund. As an accomplished hair dresser, she tends her beauty salon and also teaches her trade at same time. Her long experience and good reputation has made her salon so popular. The income is very stable at about 200USD a month. Mrs. Hải Xuân is applying for a loan of 1200USD to furnish her shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Vương Thị Hải Xuân, 57 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 2 con tại Phúc Yên, Vĩnh Phúc. Chị là thành viên năm thứ 5 của Quỹ Tình thương. Công việc chính của chị hiện nay là làm đầu cho những phụ nữ có nhu cầu làm đẹp, ngoài ra chị còn dạy nghề cho các học viên. Với kinh nghiệm lâu năm và tay nghề cao nên cửa hiệu của chị thường xuyên đông khách, thu nhập rất ổn định (khoảng 200USD/tháng). Dự kiến vòng vốn tới chị vay tiếp 1200USD để mua thiết bị cho cửa hàng.

loans.use: Buy tools for her beauty salon

loans.name: Fabiana's Group

texts.es:
Fabiana, Teresa y Lucila have been part of the Communal Bank Urpicha (a Quechua term meaning little bird) for 9, 2, and 1 years respectively. Fabiana tells us that she is the founder of the Communal Bank. All three say that thanks to the training offered by the Communal Bank they have learned to be responsible, to save money, and to educate their children with love and affection. They also mentioned that thanks to the savings they have collected in their Communal Bank they have accomplished many things such as building a house and educating their children.

Fabiana is 49 years old, has 5 children, and sells fruits from a walking cart in the Nery García market. She has been working in this business for five years. Her desire is to change her business and start a grocery store in her house. Teresa is 41, has 7 children, and sells fruit by walking through the city center of Ayacucho. She has been in this business for 25 years. Lucila is 44 years old, she has 5 children, and she has been operating a grocery store located in her home for the past 3 years.

The women need loans of 400 soles, 600 soles, and 600 soles respectively, which they will invest in the purchase of mangos, peaches, bananas, papayas, pineapples, cucumbers, rice, sugar, noodles, milk, and oil. Their earnings will be used to construct a house, start a new business, and educate their children. The dreams of Fabiana, Teresa and Lucila are that their children will be professionals, that they will be able to start a new grocery business, that they will be able to own their own homes, and that they will maintain good health and be able to live in harmony with their spouses.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Fabiana, Teresa y Lucila pertenecen al Banco Comunal Urpicha (palabra quechua que significa Pajarito), desde hace 9, 2 y 1 años respectivamente. Fabiana nos cuenta que es la fundadora del Banco Comunal. Ellas cuentan que gracias a las capacitaciones en su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ser responsables, a ahorrar, a educar a los hijos con cariño y amor. También mencionaron que gracias a los ahorros que pudieron reunir en su Banco Comunal hicieron muchas cosas como construir su casa y educar a sus hijos. Fabiana tiene 49 años y 5 hijos, y vende frutas en forma ambulatoria en el mercado Nery García, actividad que realiza desde hace 5 años. Su deseo es cambiar de negocio e implementar una tienda de abarrotes en su casa. Teresa tiene 41 años y 7 hijos y vende frutas caminando por las calles céntricas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza desde hace 25 años. Lucila tiene 44 años y 5 hijos, y tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace 3 años y está ubicado en su casa. Ellas necesitan préstamos de 400 soles, 600 soles, 600 soles respectivamente, que serán invertidos en la compra de mango, durazno, plátano, papaya, piña, pepino, arroz, azúcar, fideo, leche, aceite. Sus ahorros los utilizarán en la construcción de su casa, iniciar un nuevo negocio y la educación de los hijos. Los sueños de Fabiana, Teresa y Lucila son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener un nuevo negocio de venta de abarrotes, tener una casa propia, estar bien de salud y vivir bien en armonía con el esposo.

loans.use: For the purchase of mangos, peaches, bananas, papayas, pineapples, cucumbers, rice, sugar, noodles, milk, and oil.

loans.name: Dinh Thi

texts.vi:
Young and industrious, Mrs. Đinh Thị Bắc, 35 years of age, though recently, 2004, joined the TYM Fund, has been active of taking out loans to invest in her business. Her general store carries variety of goods to satisfy the needs for people in the neighborhood. High quality, low price has resulted in her store’s popularity. The income is steady at 150USD a month. She would like to get a new loan of 1200USD to purchase more goods for her store. Mrs. Đinh Thị Bắc lives with her husband and 2 children in Vĩnh Yên, Vĩnh Phúc province.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Là một phụ nữ trẻ nhưng chị Đinh Thị Bắc, 35 tuổi rất năng động. Mới tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 2004 nhưng chị đã mạnh dạn vay những mức vốn lớn đầu tư cho kinh doanh. Cửa hàng của chị bán nhiều loại hàng hóa phục vụ nhu cầu đa dạng của người dân trong vùng. Với chất lượng hàng tốt giá cả phải chăng nên cửa hàng của chị Bắc thu hút rất đông khách. Thu nhập của cửa hàng đạt 150USD/tháng. Mong muốn của chị Bắc là sẽ được vay tiếp 1200USD ở vòng vốn tới để mua thêm hàng. Hiện chị Bắc đang sống cùng chồng và hai con tại Vĩnh Yên, Vĩnh Phúc.

loans.use: Buy goods for general store

loans.name: Maria's Group

texts.es:
Anatolia is 38 years old and has 3 children; Maria is 28 years old and has 2 children; Nelida is 31 years old and has 3 children. Anatolia, Maria and Nelida belong to the communal bank Urpicha (which in Quechua means "little bird"), for 3, 2, and 1 year respectively.

In their communal bank they learned to save and invest money, manage their business and avoid illnesses.

Anatolia has been selling fruit wholesale in the market "Nery Garcia" for 15 years. Maria has been selling second-hand clothing in the San Juan Bautista fair for 4 years, and she also sells new clothes upon requests of friends and relatives. Nelida has been selling dried maize (a product which is used to prepared the dishes typical of the region) for two years.

Anatolia, Maria and Nelida need loans of 600 soles, 600 soles, and 1000 soles respectively. These will be invested in buying pineapple, yucca, firewood, lime, and second-hand clothes such as shirts, pants, and children's clothing. They will use their savings to educate their children, buy appliances, and build a house.

The dreams of Anatolia, Maria, and Nelida are to have a good capital, their own locale, buying a car to transport their merchandise and buying land to build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Anatolia tiene 38 años y 3 hijos, Maria tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, mientras que Nélida tiene 31 años y 3 hijos. Anatolia, Maria y Nélida pertenecen al Banco Comunal Urpicha (palabra quechua que significa Pajarito), desde hace 3, 2, 1 años respectivamente.

En su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ahorrar, a cómo invertir su dinero, cómo manejar su negocio y cómo evitar enfermedades.

Anatolia vende frutas al por mayor en el mercado “Nery García”, actividad que realiza desde hace 15 años. Por otro lado Maria vende ropa de segunda mano en la feria de San Juan Bautista, actividad que realiza desde hace 4 años, además vende ropa nueva por pedido a amigos y familiares. Mientras Nélida elabora maíz pelado (producto que es utilizado para preparar comidas típicas de la región), actividad que realiza desde hace 2 años.

Anatolia, Maria y Nélida necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles respectivamente, que serán invertidos en la compra de piña, yuca, leña, cal y ropa de segunda mano como polos, pantalones, ropa de niños. Sus ahorros los utilizarán en la educación de sus hijos, compra de artefactos y en la construcción de la casa. Los sueños de Anatolia, Maria y Nélida son tener un buen capital, local propio, comprar un carro para el traslado de su mercadería y comprar un terreno y construir su casa.

loans.use: buying pineapple, yucca, firewood, lime, and second-hand clothes such as shirts, pants, and children's clothing.  ( compra de piña, yuca, leña, cal y ropa de segunda mano como polos, pantalones, ropa de niños.)

loans.name: Mario  Antonio

texts.es:
Due to bad luck, Mr. R. accompanied his grandmother every day when she went to sell fruits and vegetables. Because of their financial situation, he has the necessity to help with support his family.

As time passed, and with the death of his grandmother, Mr. R. inherited the locale in the market, which he has now. When he lost his job he continues with the activity he learned since he was very young.

In spite of all the unfortunate circumstances he has faced since he was a young boy, Mr. R. is hopeful that he will be able to improve his quality of life. He believes CEPRODEL's financial support has been a determining factor in the development of his business, because being able to buy fruits and vegetables in cash, he is able to offer a better price to his customers.

One of his goals is to get more financial support from CEPRODEL to improve the conditions of his stand at the market, because its infrastructure is precarious, but he has hopes that the future will be better and he will meet his goal.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. R. por infortunios del destino acompaña desde muy niño a su abuela en la faena diaria de la venta de sus Frutas y verduras ya que por circunstancias económicas tiene la necesidad de ayudar al sustento de su familia.

En el transcurso del tiempo y al fallecer su abuela le hereda el tramo que tiene actualmente ademas de que se queda sin empleo y al haberle heredado su abuela el tramo continua con la actividad que aprende desde pequeño.

A pesar de todas las circunstancias a las enfrenta desde pequeño tiene la esperanza de mejorar su calidad de vida y considera que el apoyo financiero de CEPRODEL ha sido un pilar determinante en el desarrollo de su negocio ya que compra sus frutas y verduras al contado, ofrece un mejor precio a sus clientes.

Una de sus metas es que seguir siendo apoyado financieramente por CEPRODEL para ir mejorando las condiciones de su tramo cuya infraestructura es precaria pero con la esperanza de hay mañana mejor no pierde a visión de algún día culmine con sus meta.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (En compra  de  mercadería)

loans.name: Micaela  Mercedes

texts.es:
Due to bad luck, Mrs. Hernandez lost her job, and started her business with loans for $200. For the past 20 years she has worked selling a variety of soft drinks, because of unemployment and the need to support her family.

With the financial support of CEPRODEL, she has been able to develop her business, which allows her to offer a better price to her customers because she can buy her merchandise in cash.

One of her goals is to establish her business in a locale at the market, because right now she sells her products under the shade of a tree, and this would allow her to improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. H. por infortunios del destino pierde su empleo e inicia su negocio por prestamos de $200 y desde hace 20 años se dedica a la actividad de venta de refrescos variados al en desempleo y por la necesidad de sustentar a su familias.

Con el apoyo financiero de CEPRODEL ha logrado el desarrollo de su negocio, lo que le permite ofrecer un mejor precio a sus clientes por lo que compra su mercadería al contado.

Una de sus metas es establecerse en un local en el mercado ya que actualmente vende sus productos bajo la sombra de un arbol y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: buying merchandise (En compra  de  mercadería)

loans.name: Petrona Del  Carmen

texts.es:
For the past 15 years, Mrs. Petrona has worked selling fruit and vegetables. She started with a capital of $200, from her previous job being terminated.

With the hope of making progress little by little in her business, she requests loans from CEPRODEL, which offers her a helping hand and supports her unconditionally. In this way, she has developed her business, offering her products at a better price and in consequence increasing her income.

The continual work of Mrs. Petrona allows her to support her children. Her greatest dream is that they go to college and achieve a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Petrona se dedica a la actividad de venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 15 años inicia con un capital inicial de $200, producto de su indemnización al quedarse sin empleo.

Con la esperanza de ir progresando poco a poco en su negocio solicita prestamos a CEPRODEL quien le extiende su mano amiga y le ayuda incondicionalmente ha logrado el desarrollo de su negocio , ofrece a un mejor precio sus productos y con ello obtiene un poco mas de ingresos.

El trabajo continuo de la Sra. Petrona le permiten el sustento de sus hijos y el que coronen una carrera universitaria es su mayor sueño y que logren mejorar su nivel de vida.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (En compra  de  mercadería)

loans.name: Sindya  Karen

texts.es:
Mrs. C. started her business with a small capital, product of her life savings. When she, due to unfortunate circumstances, found herself unemployed and with the need to support her children, she decided to set up a beauty salon.

In the beginning she attended her customers in her home, but because her income was low there, she decided to move to the market in search for more customers. She has now five years of experience in this line of work and through the loans from CEPRODEL, she has been able to set up a small locale in the market.

Among her goals are letting her three children to continue their studies so they can achieve a better quality of life and to improve the infrastructure of her locale.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. C. inicia su negocio con un pequeño capital producto de los ahorros de toda su vida quien por infortunios del destino queda en el desempleo y por la necesidad de sustentar a sus hijos decide dedicarse a la actividad de peluqueria .

En un inicio atiende a sus clientes en su casa pero por lo bajo de sus ingresos decide trasladarse al mercado en busca de mas clientes a la fecha ya tiene cinco años de experiencia en esta labor y con los financiamientos que solicita en CEPRODEL le han permitido acondicionar un pequeño local en el mercado.

Entre sus metas esta el que sus tres hijos continuen sus estudios para lograr mejoras en las condiciones de vida e ir mejorando las condiciones de infraestructura de su local.

loans.use: Beauty shop (Servicio de peluqueria)

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Mrs. Rodriguez works selling charcoal bags, and during some seasons, selling watches, locks, magazines, and sunglasses, in other words imitation jewelry products. She has worked on this activity for 16 years. She believes that the financial aide offered by CEPRODEL has been a determining factor in he development of her business which now has a small locale in the market. Her market stand has a roof made of plastic and no walls, but she hopes that through CEPRODEL loans she will improve the conditions of her business, and in consequence of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La señora R. se dedica a la venta de Bolsas de Carbon y en algunas temporadas venta de relojes, candados, revistas, anteojos para el sol en fin productos de bisutería ejerce esta actividad desde hace ya 16 años.

Considera que el aporte financiero que la ha brindado CEPRODEL ha sido un factor determinante en el desarrollo de su negocio actualmente tiene un pequeño local en el mercado con techo de plástico y además no tiene paredes pero tiene la esperanza de que por medio de los financiamientos de CEPRODEL mejorara la condición de su negocio y por ende la de su familia..

loans.use: Buying merchandise (Compra  de mercadería)

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina lives in Beregovo, western Ukraine. She sells second hand footwear in a local market called “Progress”. Irina’s business has been growing consistently because of little competition in the market. She started selling second hand items eight years ago. Today she has about $4000 in inventory. Her monthly net profit is about $500-600.

Irina is requesting a loan of $1200 to increase her turnover capital and assorted inventory in her kiosk. She enjoys doing what she’s doing and likes working with this type of merchandise. Irina wants to invest her savings in opening a new vending facility in the future. We believe her focused efforts, hard and committed work and great communication skills will help Irina grow in her business and be a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: Increase capital and inventory

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en:
Arthur is married with one son. He and his family live in Novomoskovsk, Ukraine. Arthur works in the central city market selling men’s clothing, jackets and shirts. His business is characterized by stability and consistent growth. He has been working in the market for 10 years. Currently, his net profit is about $500 per month.

Arthur likes to work for himself. His business has been the only source of income for his whole family. Today Arthur would like to ask for a loan of $1200 to purchase inventory from wholesalers and increase the assorted merchandise in his kiosk. We believe Arthur’s perfect credit history and drive for success will help this young entrepreneur succeed and thrive in business.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Dmytryi

texts.en:
Dmytryi is single. He lives with his parents in Novomoskovsk in eastern Ukraine. Dmytryi sells sportswear in the central city market. The type of inventory he sells is always in high demand especially during the cold season. Dmytryi has been in this trade for 8 years. Presently, his monthly net profit is about $400.

Dmytryi believes he hasn’t realized the full potential of this business. He wants to continue to see his venture grow and expand. That is why Dmytryi would like to increase the assorted inventory in his kiosk which he believes will help attract more potential customers to his vending spot. Moreover, in the near future he is hoping to open a second vending facility. Dmytryi wants to get to the point of financial stability and independence when he will not only be able to provide for his own needs but will have enough to support his retired parents. Today Dmytryi is requesting a loan of $500. We believe the serious attitude and commitment of this young entrepreneur would help him repay the current loan without any delinquencies.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is 37 years old and he has 3 children who are studying in school. His wife was injured in a terrorist attack two months ago. He has a small carpentry shop in Kirkuk. He has applied to get $1200 to purchase new wood and raw materials, to paint the shop, and do some advertising in order to increase his income and develop his business.

This entrepreneur is from a volatile region and repayment risk may be higher. Lenders should consider this when making this loan.

To protect his identity, this entrepreneur's name has been modified and his face has been obscured in the photo.

loans.use: Purchase new wood

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 28 years old he is married and has two children. His father and mother live with him. He has a small shop selling electrical goods. He applied to get $1200 to purchase new electric goods, install new shelves and renovate the shop, and hire one unemployed person to increase his income and provide a better life for his family.

This entrepreneur is from a volatile region and repayment risk may be higher. Lenders should consider this when making this loan.

To protect his identity, this entrepreneur's name has been modified and his face has been obscured in the photo.

loans.use: Purchase new electric goods

loans.name: Luisa  Liliam

texts.es:
Luisa has dedicated herself to selling fruit for the past 13 years. Her parents taught her how to run a fruit stand. She began the business with a loan from her father.

In the hopes of bettering her children’s quality of life, she has decided to seek a loan in order to purchase her own work space, to increase her inventory, and to realize her dreams of improving all aspects of her life.

She believes that the financial assistance that she has received from CEPRODEL has been a determining factor in the development of her business. Currently she has a small space in the market with a plastic roof and no walls. She hopes that with CEPRODEL’s assistance her business will improve quickly.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Luisa se dedica a la actividad de venta de frutas desde hace 13 años a quien sus padres enseñaron a administrarla. Inicia su negocio con un préstamo que le concede su señor padre.

Con la esperanza de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su hijos decide solicitar prestamos para tener un local propio, incrementar su inventario en fin el de realizar sus sueños que son mejorar en todos los aspectos de su vida.

Considera que el aporte financiero que la ha brindado CEPRODEL ha sido un factor determinante en el desarrollo de su negocio actualmente tiene un pequeño piso en el mercado con techo de plástico no tiene paredes pero tiene la esperanza de que por medio de los financiamientos de CEPRODEL mejorará pronto.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria  Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Maria Auxiliadora started her business with a loan that she took out along with her mother, who she accompanies every day to sell oranges in an open air market, starting very early in the morning.

As time went on and because this business has allowed her to support her family, she decided to ask for a loan from CEPRODEL. So far she has been able to put a small stand in the market, although not in very good condition, but at least it has allowed her some shelter during inclement weather.

Although she currently has a small area in the market with a plastic tarp overhead, she hopes one day that the condition of her stand will improve and that her children will be able to attend school.

The financial support of CEPRODEL has been the economic pillar that has allowed for the development of her business, and for improvement to the quality of life of her family, and she hopes that conditions at her stand will improve little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria Auxiliadora inicia este negocio con un préstamo que hace en conjunto con su señora Madre a quien acompañaba todos los días a vender las naranjas desde muy tempranas horas a la intemperie.

En el transcurso del tiempo y por medio de ayuda financiera ya que este negocio le ha permitido el sustento de su familia decide solicitar prestamos en CEPRODEL y hasta la fecha ha logrado tener un pequeño local en el mercado aunque no tiene buenas condiciones pero por lo menos le ha permitido tener un techo en donde soporta las inclemencias del tiempo. Aunque actualmente tiene un pequeño tramo en el mercado con techo de plástico no pierde la esperanza en que algún día las condiciones de su local se mejoren y sus hijos puedan asistir al colegio.

Considera que el apoyo financiero de CEPRODEL ha sido el pilar económico que la ha permitido el desarrollo de su negocio y a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y espera ir mejorando las condiciones de su local poco a poco.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria started this work twelve years ago with her life savings, selling breakfasts starting early in the morning at bus stations located in the markets of Managua.

With the financial support of CEPRODEL, she has been able to develop her business and, in addition, now has an area where she sells meals at breakfast, lunch and dinner to customers that come by her establishment.

One of her goals is to improve the condition of her establishment so that she can provide better service to her customers and, above all, have a prosperous family life so that her children improve their standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Maria inicia esta actividad hace doce años con los ahorros de toda su vida vendiendo desde muy tempranas horas sus desayunos ambulantes en la terminales de buses en los mercados de Managua.

En el transcurso del tiempo y con el aporte financiero de CEPRODEL ha logrado el desarrollo de su negocio y además cuenta con un tramo en donde vende sus comidas en el desayuno, almuerzo y cena a sus clientes que llegan a su establecimiento.

Una de sus metas es mejorar las condiciones de su establecimiento para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y sobre todo prosperar en vida familiar para que sus hijos mejoren su nivel de vida.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Santos  Paz

texts.es:
Santos Hernandez has worked since adolescence due to economic circumstances and helps his mother sell footwear in the area around the Managua market.

Hoping to improve his children's standard of living, he decided to apply for a loan so he can have his own stand and increase his inventory, with the goal of achieving his dreams of bettering all aspects of his life.

He thinks that the financial support from CEPRODEL has been a determining factor in the development of his business and a vital pillar for improving his standard of living. CEPPRODEL has granted him 13 loans which he has taken advantage of quite efficiently.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

Santos H. se dedica a esta actividad desde su adolescencia quien por circunstancias económicas apoya a su madre en la venta de calzado en las aceras del mercado en Managua.

Con la esperanza de mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos decide solicitar prestamos para tener un local propio, incrementar su inventario en fin el de realizar sus sueños que son mejorar en todos los aspectos de su vida.

Considera que el aporte financiero que la ha brindado CEPRODEL ha sido un factor determinante en el desarrollo de su negocio y pilar vital para mejorar su calidad de vida. Actualmente Ceprodel le ha brindado 13 créditos que los ha sabido aprovechar muy eficientemente.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar C. sells vegetables; at the beginning he walked around the bus stations offering his products.

As time went on he decided to request a loan so that he could set up his business at a stand. Oscar tells us that the economic support that CEPRODEL has given him has been decisive in the development of his business and has allowed him to improve his standard of living. He no longer sells by walking around but now has his own stand. One of his greatest dreams is to improve the condition of his stand as well as improve the standard of living of his parents, who are now elderly and need his support.

His stand is very simple but his business contributes to the support of his family and allows his children to go to school.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

Oscar C. se dedica a la actividad de venta de verduras, en un inicio oferta sus productos ambulantes en la terminales de buses.

En el transcurso del tiempo decide solicitar financiamiento para instalar su negocio en un local especial. Manifiesta el Sr. Oscar que el aporte económico que la han brindado en CEPRODEL ha sido decisivo en el desarrollo de su actividad por lo que le ha permitido mejorar la calidad de vida, ya no anda ambulante sino que ahora tiene un local propio y uno de sus mayores sueños es mejorar las condiciones de su local así como mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus padres los cuales ya son adultos mayores a los que tiene que apoyar.

Actualmente su local no tiene muchas condiciones pero con su negocio contribuye al sustento de su familia y le permite que sus hijos estudien.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Maria  De Los Santos

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria de los Santos started selling oranges with her mother at the age of seven.

She hopes to grow her fruit business by having a fixed stall in the marketplace which will help her to improve her living conditions. Currently she sells her oranges from a small section of the local market, but she has high hopes for acquiring her own stall and to be able to send her children to school.

Mrs. de los Santos feels that the economic support provided by CEPRODEL has allowed her to build up her busines and to improve the living conditions of her family. She wants to improve her business slowly, but surely.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase oranges

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Mr. Pedro B. is 32 years old. He is single and lives in his own house in the city of Caaguazu, in the neighborhood called Villa Constitucion.

Mr. Pedro owns a grocery store and a butcher shop. He has a good clientele because of his accessible location in an important commercial area of the city.

He started with a small capital he had saved during the years in which he worked for a private company.

Nowadays, his micro-enterprise generates a good income with which he can support himself, but he needs to increase his merchandise stock to satisfy the demand of his customers and offer them a better service and greater variety of products.

The loan requested will be used to buy merchandise such as meat, flour, pasta, rice, fruit, vegetables, oil, canned food, dairy products, bakery products, and beverages.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

El Señor Pedro Benítez tiene 32 años, es soltero, vive en su casa propia en la ciudad de Caaguazú, en el barrio llamado Villa Constitución.

Don Pedro es propietario de una despensa y carnicería, cuenta con buena clientela debido a la buena ubicación en la que se encuentra, ya que esta en una importante zona comercial de su ciudad.

Se inició con un pequeño capital que ahorro durante los años que trabajo como empleado para una empresa privada.

Hoy día su micro empresa le genera buenos ingresos con los cuales puede mantenerse, pero necesita cargar su stock de mercaderías para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y darles un mejor servicio y variedad de productos.

El préstamo solicitado será destinado para la compra de mercaderías como carnes, harina, fideos, arroz, frutas, verduras, aceite, enlatados, lácteos, panificados y la compra de bebidas en general.

loans.use: buying merchandise such as meat, flour, pasta, rice, fruit, vegetables, oil, canned food, dairy products, bakery products, and beverages.  (para la compra de mercaderías como carnes, harina, fideos, arroz, frutas, verduras, aceite, enlatados, lácteos, panificados y bebidas)

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Mrs. Virginia is a 55 years old mother of seven. Four of her children are allready married and independent, the other three are students living at her home.

With the savings from her previous employer as a seamstress, she opened her own shop 10 years ago. Her micro business is generating a good income thanks to a loyal clientele but she needs to offer a greater varity of product. Mrs. Virginia´s dream is to expand her business and eventually create her own label of apparel.

The loan will be used to purchase blouses, pants, shirts, shoes and underwear to expand her product line.

loans.use: Purchase blouses, pants, shirts, shoes, underwear

loans.name: Ermo

texts.es:
