Mr. Ermo is 61 years old, married and has 3 children all of whom are married and independent. His parents were shopkeepers and from them he learned the ropes and received economical assistance to start his own business.

Due to an accident, he lost an arm and had to shut down his business temporarily. But he is a fighter and did not let his misfortune get in the way of reopening his store. Since 2003 when he reopened for business, things are going well for him thanks to a strong will to succeed. He even started another business purchasing scrap metal that is generating a good income.

The loan Mr. Ermo is requesting will be used to increase the stock of drinks available in his store (beer, soft drinks, wines and other drinks).

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase beer, soft drinks, wines and other drinks

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José de Jesús J. is 37 year old, married and has 4 children. All of his children work selling mandioca (a local potato-like root) from a cart to help out the family. Mr.José and his wife sell clothing and shoes.

Previously Mr.José had a construction job which provided the income necessary to purchase the stock that his wife sold. Unfortunately the construction job slowed down and he decided to dedicate himself 100% to the retail business with his wife. They have over a hundred clients that purchase their clothing and shoes on credit terms.

The loan requested will be used to purchase a greater quantity of clothing and shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase clothing and shoes

loans.name: Isidoro

texts.es:
Señor Isidoro M. is 29-years-old and single. He used to work as a driver for a public transportation company in Ciudad del Este. Because of a traffic accident that he had, he was unable to keep working and had to resign.

He received compensation, which he was able to invest in the puchase of clothing and accessories that he goes out to sell in different neighborhoods and neighboring cities. He travels on a motorcycle that he acquired as well to be able to make his sales.

He will invest the requested credit in the purchase of wholesale merchandise, sinch he receives good discounts this way.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

El Señor Isidoro M. tiene 29 años y es soltero. Se desempeñaba como chofer de transportes varios para una empresa de transportes públicos en Ciudad del Este; a causa de un accidente de transito que tuvo se vio imposibilitado para seguir trabajando y tuvo que renunciar.

Recibió una indemnización con la cual pudo invertir en la compra de ropas y accesorio los cuales sale a vender recorriendo diferentes barrios y ciudades aledañas. El recorrido lo realiza en una moto que adquirió también para salir a realiza sus recorridos.

El crédito solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de mercaderías al por mayor, ya que de este modo le otorgan buenos descuentos.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing like shirts, pants, t-shirts, shorts, belts, etc.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is married and has no children.

She and her husband are owners of a grocery store in their neighborhood. They started their business with a small amount of capital that they earned through the compensation from their former job. They are very hard workers and highly responsible.

Their credit will be used to purchase rice, pasta, milk products, breads, and assorted beverages.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Juana es casada y no tiene hijos.

Con su marido son propietarios de una despensa en el barrio donde viven. Se iniciaron con un pequeño capital que obtuvo de la indemnización de su antiguo trabajo. Son personas muy trabajadoras y muy responsables.

El crédito será destinado para la compra de arroz, fideo, lácteos, panificados y bebidas varias.

loans.use: To purchase rice, pasta, milk products, breads and assorted beverages

loans.name: Senon

texts.es:
Mr. Senon is 44 years old, married and has an older son that has allready moved out. Previously Mr. Senon used to work as a construction worker, but the building trade has slowed down lately.

With his savings, he decided to make an investment in clothing to sell in his hometown. His wife is his business partner and they are generating a good income. However they wish to have more capital to increase their stock.

The loan they have requested will be used to purchase ladies and men´s jeans to increment their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase jeans

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Mrs. Margarita A. is 35 years old, a widow and a mother of two girls (one in high school and the youngest in grade school). They all live in a humble home which is also where their small business is located.

Margarita and her two daughters manage a small restaurant that feeds the workers of a nearby wood processing plant. Together they offer a varied menu of home cooked meals, salads, desserts and drinks..all made to order. From the year 2000 (when her husband passed away), she started this business to be able to feed and educate her two daughters. Now she wants to improve her small business and offer a more varied menu.

The need to survive provided Margarita with the strength to overcome her tragic loss and taught her children a valuable lesson in how to face the challenges which we face in our lives. Their mother is a role model of valor and committment.

The money requested will be used to purchase stock for the restarurant such as: soft drinks, beer, ciders, wine, ice cream, and meats.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks, beer, ciders, wine, ice cream, and meats

loans.name: Isacio

texts.es:
Mr. Isacio Pezoa is 65 years old, married and has a son. Mr. Isacio ia a door to door salesman. He owns two motorcycles that he uses to do his sales calls.

His previous experience as a salesman in a company in Coronel Oviedo gave him the impulse needed to start his first venture in 1982. With his savings he purchased his first motorcycle to start selling door to door. He purchased a second motorcycle to give himself a competitive advantage and increase his sales.

The requested loan will be used to purchase stock: medicine, underwear, etc.

He wishes to transmit to the young people of his community the values of discipline and consistency, values that he feels are missing in the new generations. Mr. Isacio has high hopes that the economic and social situation in Paraguay will improve, which is why he is investing in new business ventures.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase stock: medicine, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Mrs. Petrona A. is a 54 year old single mother of 3 teenage girls. The 3 girls are studying and help their mother with the family busines and with the house chores.

She creates home cooked meals that are delivered to her clients own homes in the town of Coronel Oviedo. On the menu are a variety of hot meals, salads, desserts and drinks. Mrs. Petrona has over 30 years experience in the catering business and decided to open her own venture as she found herself unemployed when her previous employers decided to close down their restaurant and retire.

The money requested will be used to purchase a freezer to add ice cream to her menu.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Freezer purchase

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Tú, 30 years of age, of Phúc Yên, joined TYM Fund in 2006. She tends a small general store while her husband, Nguyễn Văn Minh, is repairing watches. They have 2 children, both are in school age. Although still a new member, Mrs. Tú is energetic in the Fund’s activities. With the Fund’s new policy, she is now eligible for loan application. Mrs. Tú would like to take out a loan of 575USD to replenish her store. Her current monthly income is 150USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Tú, 30 T.ổi, sống tại Phúc Yên, tham gia Quỹ Tình thương từ năm 2006. Công việc chính của chị Tú hiện nay là bán hàng tạp hóa. Chồng chị, anh Nguyễn Văn Minh là một thợ sửa đồng hồ, hai con chị cũng đang còn trong độ T.ổi đi học. Là một thành viên mới nhưng chị Tú rất năng động, nhiệt tình cho công việc của Quỹ và mạnh dạn vay vốn cho kinh doanh. Với chính sách của Quỹ ngày càng linh hoạt hiện nay chị đã đủ tiêu chuẩn để được vay những mức vốn lớn. Vòng vốn này chị dự định xin vay 575USD để mua thêm hàng hóa cho của hàng của mình. Thu nhập của chị Tú là 150USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Vuong Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Vương Thị Chiến, 35 years of age, lives with her husband and 2 children in Phúc Yên, Vĩnh Phúc province. She joined the TYM Fund in 2006, and took out her first loan of 175USD to invest in her general store. Very proactive, she increases the amount each new round of loan to expand her business. Her husband, Nguyễn Văn Huy, a mechanic, supports her business and help to create conditions so that she could join the Fund. Her current monthly income is 125USD. Mrs. Chiến applies for a loan of 575USD to purchase goods for replenishing her store.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Vương Thị Chiến, 35 tuổi, hiện đang sống cùng chồng và hai con tại Phúc Yên, Vĩnh Phúc. Chị bắt đầu tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 2006 với mức vay đầu tiên là 175USD đầu tư cho việc kinh doanh hàng tạp hóa. Là một phụ nữ năng động, sau khi kết thúc mỗi vòng vốn chị luôn có xu hướng vay mức cao hơn để mở rộng thêm dự án của mình. Chồng chị, anh Nguyễn Văn Huy, một công nhân cơ khí cũng rất ủng hộ công việc kinh doanh của vợ và tạo điều kiện cho chị tham gia vào các hoạt động của Quỹ Tình thương. Với mức thu nhập hiện tại là 125USD/tháng, dự định chị sẽ xin vay thêm 575USD cho việc mua thêm nhiều hàng hóa cho cửa hàng.

loans.use: Buy goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Phạm Thị Hương, 29 year of age, is one of the first and most enthusiastic members of the TYM Fund. Though not even 30, she has been with the Fund for 8 years. Beginning at her local vocational school, Mrs. Hương is now a skillful dress maker. She has her own shop at home. Because of her industriousness and high quality workmanship, her income is steady at 125USD a month. Though her husband is busy with his construction job, he spares time to help her with household chores so she can have more time to make dresses. They have two children. Both are in school age. She would like to apply for a loan of 650USD to expand her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Phạm Thị Hương, 29 tuổi, là một trong những thành viên rất nhiệt tình tham gia Quỹ ngay từ ngày đầu thành lập. Mặc dù chưa đến 30 tuổi nhưng chị đã có 8 năm gắn bó với Quỹ. Công việc chủ yếu hiện nay của chị là may mặc tại nhà. Bắt đầu với việc đi học nghề ở địa phương, sau một thời gian, tay nghề được nâng cao, chị đã chủ động vay vốn để mở một cửa hàng của riêng mình. Với tính cần cù, chịu khó, hàng may có chất lượng nên thu nhập cũng ổn định. Chồng chị mặc dù đi xây dựng nhưng vẫn giúp đỡ công việc gia đình, tạo điều kiện cho vợ tập trung sản xuất kinh doanh. Hai anh chị đã có hai cháu đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Vòng vốn sắp tới chị Hương dự định xin vay 650USD mua thêm vải về may quần áo. Thu nhập hiện tại của chị Hương là 125USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy clothes

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is 26 years old. He is married and has one child. He has a sewing shop in Kirkuk. He has applied to get $1200 to purchase a new sewing machine and new fabric with some leather to make clothes for winter sales, and paint the shop in order to increase his income and expand his business. This entrepreneur is from a volatile region and repayment risk may be higher. Lenders should consider this when making this loan.

To protect his identity, this entrepreneur's name has been modified and his face has been obscured in the photo.

loans.use: Purchase new sewing machine

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 39 years old. He is married and has 4 children, three of whom are studying in school. He lives in a rented house. He has a small restaurant. He has applied to get $1200 to purchase a new cooking stove, tables and chairs, renovate the restaurant, hire two unemployed helpers, and do some advertising for the restaurant to increase his income and provide a better life for his family. This entrepreneur is from a volatile region and repayment risk may be higher. Lenders should consider this when making this loan.

To protect his identity, this entrepreneur's name has been modified and his face has been obscured in the photo.

loans.use: Purchase new cooking stove with tables and chairs

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Vũ Thị Bắc is 33 years old. She lives in Phúc Yên, Vĩnh Phúc with her husband and 3 young children. She is a TYM fund member since 2000. Her main occupation is raising cattle and cultivation. Before joining TYM her family living condition was very difficult. With the loans from TYM, hard work and determination, she has been able to overcome the poverty. Things have changed for the better for her family. After each round of loan, she has been able to put away some savings to buy basic things for her family: tv, motorcycle ... The family income is about 100 USD a month. This time she is requesting a loan of 650 USD to buy a pair of breeding cows. She hopes that after a few months, they would produce calves so that she would be able to recuperate her investment quickly.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Vũ Thị Bắc, 33 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 3 con nhỏ tại Phúc Yên, Vĩnh Phúc. Chị là thành viên tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2000. Công việc chủ yếu của chị Bắc là làm ruộng và chăn nuôi. Điều kiện gia đình chị trước khi tham gia Quỹ còn rất khó khăn, thiếu thốn. Sau khi được vay vốn từ Quỹ, với sự cần cù chịu khó và tự tin của bản thân kinh tế gia đình chị Bắc đã có nhiều chuyển biến. Sau mỗi vòng vốn vay chị đều tích lũy được một số tiền dùng mua sắm các trang thiết bị, đồ dùng sinh hoạt như trong nhà như: Tivi, xe máy … Cuộc sống gia đình chị đã thực sự thay đổi so với trước. Với mức thu nhập hiện tại là 100USD/tháng, chị Bắc muốn xin vay thêm 650USD từ Quỹ để mua một đôi bò sinh sản. Chị hi vọng sau vài tháng sẽ có được lứa bê đầu tiên để sớm thu hồi vốn.

loans.use: Buy two cows

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Đào Thị Tuyết, 51, lives in Phúc Yên with her husband and 3 children. Her children are grown up and they all work in a shoes factory. Her situation is favorable for raising livestock and poultry so she applied for a loan. The loan was used to buy ducks. She also has 4 pairs of breeding bull/cow in her cow pen. The loan was well invested as it yields growing profit round after round. Her husband is a farmer, he helps her out a lot doing daily chores. This time Ms Tuyết is requesting a loan of 950 USD to buy 200 ducks.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Đào Thị Tuyết, 51 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 3 con tại Phúc Yên. 3 người con của chị đều đã trưởng thành và làm công nhân cho nhà máy giầy da. Điều kiện gia đình chị rất thuận lợi cho việc chăn nuôi tập trung, nên chị Tuyết đã mạnh dạn vay vốn về để mua vịt về chăn nuôi, ngoài ra chị còn chăn nuôi 4 cặp bò sinh sản. Dự án phát triển tốt nên mức vốn vay của chị tăng lên thường xuyên qua các vòng. Chồng chị Tuyết, một nông dân, là người thường xuyên quan tâm và tích cực hỗ trợ vợ trong công việc hàng ngày. Vòng vốn tới chị Tuyết xin vay thêm 950USD để mua thêm 200 vịt thả đồng.

loans.use: Buy 200 ducks

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
“I live in Lahore, Pakistan with my husband and five children. Three of them attend school and the youngest two will attend later. I hope that my eldest son will become a doctor.

My husband purchases old computers and fixes them or sells the spare parts from those that can't be fixed. He needs a loan to purchase computers.

My husband’s work slows down due to shortage of money as capital for this little business. Last night we obtained a new order but due to lack of money, we cannot meet the demand for old computers.

Last year we took a loan from the microfinance institution Asasah to start this business. Before this, we were not doing well as we did not even have warm blankets to sleep under. With profits from the business last year, we are now doing better and have even bought new blankets. We hope to do even better in the future.”

loans.use: Buy and re-sell old computers

loans.name: Parween

texts.en: “I live in Lahore with my husband and three children. My husband has left the army and now runs his rickshaw (local three wheeled personal transport vehicle). We want to pay off some of the rickshaw so that we can cut down on the interest payments and need a loan to do this. We also want to start a grocery store in a few years from now, where I can sit or my son can sit and sell simple basic goods. I hope that we can use some of the profits from the rickshaw to do this.”

loans.use: Pay off a loan for a rickshaw and save on interest payments

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Hoàng Thị Khách, 52, is a TYM member since 1998. She is married and has 2 children, they live in the town of Lâm, Ý Yên, Nam Định province. They are artisans who produce various religious objects* made with copper/bronze. This is a skill that is passed on from generation to generation in this town. Since the economy in the region was not good before 2000, it did not generate enough revenue for her family but she just kept continuing to preserve the skill. In the last couple of years, the region's economy picked up and so did her business. Her family living condition had improved. For the last 3-4 years, she had applied for maximum loans to be invested in her business. Her family income is now 200-250 USD a month. This time she requests a loan of 1200 USD to buy bronze.

Note: * objects such as incense holder, candle holder ... which are displayed on an altar in every vietnamese household.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Hoàng Thị Khách, 52 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 1998. Chị sống cùng chồng và hai con tại thị trấn Lâm, Ý Yên, Nam Định. Đây là khu vực có nghề truyền thống đúc đồng. Làng nghề những năm trước năm 2000 kinh tế của địa phương chưa phát triển mạnh nên nghề đúc đồng của gia đình không tạo ra những khoản thu nhập đáng kể. Chị Khách chỉ vay vốn ở mức thấp để làm giữ nghề. Thời gian trở lại đây nghề đúc đồng dần hưng thịnh trở lại, kinh tế gia đình chị Khách cũng phát triển theo. 3-4 năm qua chị Khách luôn luôn vay vốn ở mức đặc biệt để đầu tư làm nghề. Mức thu nhập hiện tại của cả gia đình đạt 200-250USD/tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị Khách dự định tiếp tục vay mức vốn 1200USD để mua thêm đồng.

loans.use: Buy bronze to cast

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Nguyễn Thị Bích, 40 years old, lives in Ý Yên district. She joined TYM fund in 1998. Her first loan was 60 USD which was used to open a restaurant. After a while, her business has picked up and she was getting used at making the weekly payment so she applied for bigger loans. Her restaurant is getting busier and busier and she is qualified for maximum amount of loan. All her children are grown up and they often help her running the restaurant. This time she is requesting a loan of 1025 USD to renovate her restaurant and buy more stock, getting prepared for the Tet Holiday rush

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Bích, 40 tuổi, sống tại huyện Ý Yên, tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 1998. Nguồn vốn vay được chị đầu tư chủ yếu vào cửa hàng ăn. Bắt đầu với mức vốn nhỏ là 60USD, sau một thời gian thấy công việc làm ăn hiệu quả và quen với việc trả tiền tuần chị Bích tăng dần mức vốn vay. Cửa hàng của chị ngày càng đông khách và mức vốn vay cũng thường xuyên ở mức tối đa. Các con chị đều đã trưởng thành và hỗ trợ chị rất nhiều trong công việc bán hàng. Hiện nay chị muốn vay thêm 1025USD để sửa sang và mua hàng kinh doanh trong dịp Tết.

loans.use: Renovate her restaurant, buy stock

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Dương Thị S. is 41 years old. She is married and has 2 children. When she first joined TYM, she used the loan to buy goods to resell at the market. Gradually, her family living condition has improved. Her husband is an artisan working with bronze/copper He produces various objects like candle holder, incense holder, statute ...etc. Lately, this kind of business had taken off in this region so Ms S. has joined her husband working in this business full time. She's requesting a loan of 1200 USD to buy bronze/copper.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Dương Thị S., 41 tuổi, sống tại Ý Yên cùng chồng và hai con, trong đó một con đang đi học. Thời gian đầu tham gia Quỹ chị vay vốn về đi bán hàng ở chợ. Kinh tế gia đình dần dần được nâng lên. Chồng chị làm nghề đúc đồng thuê với nguồn vốn tự có của gia đình. Những năm gần đây, nghề đúc đồng tại địa phương phát triển, chị S. chuyển hẳn sang cùng chồng làm công việc này. Nguồn vốn vay từ Quỹ được chị sử dụng mua đồng về đúc tượng, các đồ cúng lễ v.v... Vòng vốn này chị S. làm hồ sơ xin vay thêm 1200USD để mua thêm đồng đúc

loans.use: Buy bronze to cast

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Phạm Thị Luận is 44. She lives in Ý Yên district with her husband and 2 children. She is a TYM member since 1998. The loans from TYM were used to buy copper/bronze to cast. She produces religious objects (that are displayed on an altar) and sells to the locals. Previously, she only applied for small loans just to preserve the handicraft skill, her income was about 70 USD a month. Today, this region is well known for its copper/bronze casting handicrafts. These products are sold in other provinces as well. This time Ms Luận would like to obtain a loan of 575 to buy copper/bronze thus to increase her income.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Phạm Thị Luận năm nay 44 tuổi, hiện đang sống tại Ý Yên cùng chồng và hai con. Chị là thành viên tham gia vào Quỹ tư năm 1998. Nguồn vốn vay từ Quỹ được chị Luận sử dụng chủ yếu vào việc mua đồng về đúc các đồ cúng, lễ cho người dân địa phương. Các năm trước chị vay vốn thấp về làm chủ yếu giữ nghề với mức thu nhập hàng tháng từ công việc này là 70USD. Đến nay thì nghề đúc đồng của địa phương phát triển tốt, các mặt hàng làm ra đã có mặt trên nhiều tỉnh thành, chị Luận muốn vay mức vốn cao hơn. Vòng vốn này chị làm đơn xin vay 575USD để mua thêm đồng đúc nhằm nâng cao thu nhập.

loans.use: Buy bronze to cast

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en: “I am Sadia B. and have two girls and one boy. My eldest daughter is in nursery school. My husband needs a loan to purchase a buffalo. He has been selling fresh milk in the neighbourhood for many years. We already have nine buffaloes. Later on, when my children are older I may open my own tailoring business. I think my daughters  especially shouldobtain an education.”

loans.use: purchase a buffalo

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: “I live in Lahore with my family. My husband has been running an automobile workshop for the past three years. We need a loan to purchase some new equipment. Lately we have been borrowing money from a local microfinance institution Asasah and have invested in our business. Our automobile store is in old Lahore near the shrine. With the profits, I was able to get a medical procedure done and pay for my son’s wedding. I feel certain that I will be pay off your loan as well.”

loans.use: purchase equipment for our automobile workshop

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: “I live in Lahore with my husband Muhammad Aslam Raza and five sons and one daughter. My son runs his own tyre shop where he fixes punctures and rents out motorcycles and bicycles. With a loan he will purchase some equipment for his store. With profits, he can purchase a bigger shop later.”

loans.use: Purchase equipment for our son's tyre shop

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: “I have been living in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan all my life. I have five children. My husband drives a rickshaw (local three-wheeled vehicle) for public transport purposes. We want to have our rickshaw repaired and we need a loan. My husband provides transport to some travellers on a regular basis so business is good. With the profits, I hope that in a couple of years we can build our own home since we rent right now.”

loans.use: Have their rickshaw repaired

loans.name: Shaista

texts.en: “I am Shaista and live in Lahore, a large urban centre in Pakistan. I have one three-year-old daughter. My husband drives a wagon as a public transport service. My father who lives with us runs a small catering business and cooks in big pots called deighs. He needs to purchase more of  these deighs so that he can cook in them. I hope that you can help my old father with a loan.”

loans.use: Purchase pots for her father's little catering business

loans.name: Bilqees

texts.en: “I live in Lahore, Pakistan and have seven children. I am widow and my husband died of a heart attack three years back. I am now dependent on my sons for income. My son drives someone else’s rickshaw and does not make much on it since he pays $2 per day in rent. We need a loan to use along with our savings to make an advance payment for a rickshaw. If he buys a rickshaw in this way, he will eventually own it.”

loans.use: Purchase a rickshaw

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
“I have three children and live in Riawind, about 50 km from the second largest city of Pakistan, Lahore. I want to take a loan for my husband who wants to purchase a rickshaw (local three-wheeled vehicle). After his first business failed, he started driving someone else’s rickshaw a year ago, for which he pays daily rent. He now wants to purchase his own rickshaw so that we can make money for the family. If we buy our own rickshaw, it will help us because the money that he pays as daily rent, we will be able to save and eventually we will own the rickshaw.

I would like to borrow the money together with a small group and I accept responsibility for other women in my group. The first one is Suriya who wants to pay off a buffalo; the second one is Bashiran who wants to purchase a motorcycle for her son’s rent-a-bike business. Zubaidan’s son wants to purchase cloth for his clothing store; Raqaya’s husband wants to purchase inventory for his grocery store.”

loans.use: Purchase a rickshaw

loans.name: Ramzana's Group

texts.en:
“I live in Riawind, a small city in Pakistan. My husband has been retired for the past ten years and opened his own grocery store. We would like a loan so that we can stock up our grocery store. I have married off four of my children and the others live with me. One of my daughters makes shoes and I help her out by going to the market and purchasing materials and cutting shoes. I have been borrowing from a local microfinance institution.

I would like to borrow together with a small group and guarantee that other women in my group will repay their loans. Niamat A.’s husband recycles plastic bottles by cutting them up and then sells them to be melted down. Naziran’s son requires a loan to help him purchase inventory for his fruit cart. Musarat’s husband requires a loan to repair their wagon. Asia’s husband requires cash to purchase a rickshaw (local three-wheeled vehicle) for her husband. We are all like family and I know them well enough to accept responsibility for them.”

loans.use: purchase inventory for a grocery store and improve the businesses of the other four members of the group

loans.name: Suriya's Group

texts.en:
“I live in Riawind, a small city located near Lahore, a large urban centre in Pakistan. I have one child, a son, Sahid Mahmood. My husband and I would like to pay off our buffalo. We trade buffalos and have done so in the past. Last year, we bought a fridge with some of the profits and in the near future, if we make a profit, I will purchase a cow.

I would like to borrow money together with a small group of women who live in my neighbourhood. The first one is Zarina Y. who owns a cassette and video shop and needs a loan to expand her inventory. The second one is Shabana whose husband is in the marble business. The third one is Naziran whose son needs to have his rickshaw repaired. The fourth one is Bushara M. whose husband needs a loan to purchase a rickshaw.”

As the group leader, I guarantee that these women will repay their loans.”

loans.use: Buying and re-selling buffalos

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is 40 years old and has 4 children, all studying. He has two sisters living with him and he is responsible for them. He has a small car welding and spare parts shop and has applied to get $1200 to purchase a new welding machine and some car spare part and to renovate the shop in order to increase his income and make a better life for his big family. This entrepreneur is from a volatile region and repayment risk may be higher. Lenders should consider this when making this loan.

To protect his identity, this entrepreneur's name has been modified and his face has been obscured in the photo.

loans.use: Purchase new welding machine and some car spare part

loans.name: Zareena's Group

texts.en:
“I have lived in Riawind, a small city, since my marriage many years ago. I have six children and my eldest son is also married and working. The other son are also working, one in a factory, one provides transport services, and one works with his father. My daughter just finished her Masters and is teaching in a school. My youngest daughter is in ninth grade. Since I am too old to work, I need a loan to purchase a buffalo so I can sell milk. My son who works with his father will take care of the buffalo. I will invest the profits to purchase another animal.

Since my group members and I have borrowed before from a local microfinance institution, we know each other well and can guarantee repayment. Zubaida has a grocery store and needs a loan to stock up. Shazia runs a laundry business and Safia runs a clothing business.”

loans.use: Purchase a buffalo

loans.name: Subran's Group

texts.en:
Subran F. lives with her husband and five children in Riawind, Pakistan. Only one of the children attends school. Subran has borrowed money from Asasah, a microfinance institution, before, and has invested it in her family-owned vegetable store which is operated by her husband. Now the couple needs another loan to purchase vegetables in bulk to minimize costs. 
There are several other members in Subran's group who would like to make their businesses grow: Sharifan wants to invest in her grocery store, Mona would like to invest in her husband’s electric store, Shamshad’s husband wants to purchase a stock of supplies for his paint store, while Rashidan’s husband wants to open a cooking gas cylinder store.

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables

loans.name: Jameela's Group

texts.en:
“I have been living in Riawind for the past 20 years. I have four children, all of whom attend school. I have been a lady heath worker for the past eight years, trained by a government program, and I sell ladies' outfits from as well. My husband has an electrical supplies store. We would like to use the loan to purchase premises of our own on installments so that we do not have the rent to pay each month.

I would like to borrow money together with a small group of women who are friends of mine; we will guarantee each others' repayment. Naseem’s husband makes furniture and needs a loan to purchase raw materials. Bashiran’s husband does wheat trading and also needs a loan to purchase grain.”

loans.use: Purchase premises for our store on installments

loans.name: María Del Socorro

texts.es:
When her son was three months old, Maria del Socorro began to realize that what her husband was earning each week was not enough to cover the costs of having a child. So she began to do raffles between her friends and neighbors. She met a woman who offered her the opportunity to sell products via catalog, and she began slowly by selling to the people who had been buying the raffle tickets. Today she has many more clients, including many mothers of her son's friends.

Even though she has many requests pending for products, Maria does not have enough capital to buy everything her customers are asking for. She is requesting a loan, to be repaid in 6 months, in order to buy more products, better meet her customer's demands and improve her family's quality of life. With your help Maria will be able to achieve her dream of economic stability.

Cuando su hijo tenía tres meses María del Socorro comenzó a ver que con lo que ganaba su esposo a la semana no le alcanzaba para poder pagar los gastos del niño. Y fue por eso que comenzó a hacer rifas de despensa a sus vecinos y amistades. Poco después conoció a una señora que le ofreció la venta de productos por catálogo y fue así como comenzó poco a poco a venderle a esas personas que le compraban los boletos para la rifa. Y actualmente tiene más clientela puesto que le vende a las mamás de los compañeritos de su hijo.

Sin embargo actualmente tiene varios pedidos pendientes puesto que no cuenta con el capital suficiente para poder comprar todo lo que le están solicitando. Puesto que María revende los productos en plazos pequeños. María está solicitando un crédito de US $700 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero María podrá comprar los productos que le pidieron y así logrará sacar adelante a su familia. Con tu ayuda María podrá lograr que su sueño de estabilidad económica se haga realidad.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE PRODUCTS TO SELL, BETTER MEET THE REQUESTS OF HER CUSTOMERS, AND CONTINUE TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR HER FAMILY

loans.name: María Laura

texts.es:
Maria Laura has 4 children and is separated from their father. Although their father pays a monthly sum, it is not enough to cover the costs of 4 children. With the help of her mother, Maria began to create handicrafts to sell. She began 10 years ago selling to friends and acquaintances , and little by little she has grown her business and become well known to the people in her community.

Today many people are requesting her crafts in greater quantity for events such as weddings, but Maria does not have enough capital to meet the demand. She is requesting a loan, to be repaid in 6 months, in order to purchase what she needs to grow her business. With your help, Maria can continue to provide a better life for her children.

María Laura está separada del padre de sus 4 hijos, el cuál le da una mensualidad con la que no puede pagar los gastos de sus hijos. Fue por eso que comenzó, con la ayuda de su mamá, a elaborar manualidades para poder venderlas. Empezó hace 10 años vendiéndoles a sus familiares y amigos, y poco a poco se fue dando a conocer entre los de su localidad.

Actualmente le están pidiendo en cantidades grandes para eventos grandes y para bodas, sin embargo actualmente no cuenta con dinero suficiente como para elaborar los productos. Es por eso que María está solicitando un crédito de US $925 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero María podrá elaborar las manualidades. Con tu ayuda María podrá sacar a sus hijos adelante.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE THE MATERIALS SHE NEEDS TO MAKE HER HANDICRAFTS, BETTER MEET THE INCREASING DEMANDS OF HER CUSTOMERS, AND CONTINUE TO PROVIDE A BETTER LIFE FOR HER FOUR CHILDREN.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Rita has two children and is separated from their father. She had to take full responsibility for the children. She started a business sewing uniforms. It began when a neighbor of hers asked if she could make a couple of uniforms as a favor. The quality of her work was so good, and the price so fair, that the same neighbor began to promote her work amongst her friends. Little by little the requests for uniforms has grown.

Today Rita has a request for 20 uniforms which she can't meet because she lacks sufficient materials. She is requesting a loan, to be repaid in 3 months, so she can purchase the fabric and thread and other materials needed to meet the needs of her customers. With your help, Rita will be able to continue to grow her business and start selling her uniforms in greater quantities.

Rita está separada del padre de sus dos hijos. Es por eso que Rita se tiene que hacer responsable de sus hijos. Para poder obtener dinero Rita elabora uniformes. Todo comenzó porque una vecina de Rita le pidió de favor que le hiciera dos uniformes. Sin embargo el trabajo quedó tan bien y el precio era tan bueno que la propia vecina le comenzó a hacer promoción entre sus amigas y así poco a poco se le fue incrementando el pedido de uniformes.

Actualmente Rita tiene un pedido de 20 uniformes los cuales no a podido realizar por falta de material es por eso que Rita está solicitando un crédito de US $325 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 3 meses y así con este dinero poder comprar las telas y los materiales para poder elaborar los productos. Con tu ayuda Rita podrá sacar este pedido adelante, además de poder comenzar a vender sus uniformes por cantidades mayores.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE THE MATERIALS NEEDED TO MAKE THE UNIFORMS SHE SELLS.  HER CUSTOMERS ARE REQUESTING GREATER QUANTITIES AND SHE NEEDS MORE CAPITAL TO MEET THE GROWING DEMAND.

loans.name: Mohammad Zahar

texts.en: Mohammad Zahar lives in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and the father of two sons;  he lives with his own nuclear family. He has a retail shop, a business he started 6 years ago in Kabul. During these last few years, he has attracted a goodly number of customers. Now he wants to further develop his business so he would like to take a small loan to buy extra products for re-sale, such as shampoos, baskets, chocolates, etc. to complete his stock. In that way, he will be able to make a good income to help his family for whom he is the sole breadwinner. He is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: To buy more products for re-sale such as shampoo, baskets, chocolates, etc.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is a single mother and can't count on any support from the children's father. At the suggestion of a few friends, she began to sell clothing, shoes and other items by catalog to generate an income while still being able to care for her children. She takes extra care with them to help make up for their father's absence.

However, she had a lot of household costs which took away the profits of her business, causing a deficit. She is requesting a loan, to be repaid in 4 months, to be able to purchase the items her customers are requesting and offer them new products as well. With your help, Juana will be able to build her business and provide for a better future for her children.

Juana es una madre de familia que no cuenta con el apoyo del padre de sus hijos para poder obtener dinero para pagar los gastos de sus hijos. Es por eso que con la ayuda de unas amigas le recomendaron que vendiera ropa de vencería, zapatos y otros artículos por catálogo para poder obtener ingresos, pero sin descuidar a sus hijos, que necesitan tanto de ella para poder sobrellevar la ausencia de un padre de familia.

Sin embargo actualmente tuvo muchos gastos, por lo tanto la administración de su negocio sufrió un déficit. Es por eso que Juana está solicitando un crédito de US $300 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses, y con este dinero Juana podrá comprar mercancía que le están solicitando y así poder tener productos nuevos que ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Juana podrá sacar adelante su negocio además de poder ayudarle a sus hijos a salir adelante y en un futuro poder estudiar una carrera universitaria.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MERCHANDISE TO GROW HER CATALOG BUSINESS, BETTER MEET THE DEMANDS OF HER CUSTOMERS AND IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR HER CHILDREN.

loans.name: Minerva

texts.es:
Ten years ago Minerva began to selling grocery items, buying small quantities of bread and milk to sell. She needed to start this business because her husband's salary was not enough to cover the education of their three children. The two oldest have now completed their university studies, and the youngest continues her studies and helps her mother with the business. During the last ten years, Minerva has expanded the range of products she offers.

However, lately her customers have been requesting items that she doesn't carry, so they've gone to the competition. Now Minerva can't generate enough income to cover the costs of her daughter's education, so she is requesting a loan, to be paid back in 6 months, to purchase additional merchandise such as office supplies (paper, pens and pencils, notebooks). By winning back her customers and growing her income, she will be able to achieve her dream that her daughter finishes university. With your help Minerva will be able to give her daughter a better future.

Hace 10 años que Minerva comenzó la venta de abarrotes comprando un poco de leche pan y latas. Minerva tubo que comenzar este negocio puesto que no les alcanzaba con el sueldo de su esposo para pagar los estudios de sus 3 hijos de los cuales los 2 mayores lograron terminar la universidad satisfactoriamente y la más pequeña continua estudiando y por las tardes le ayuda a Minerva en el negocio. En estos 10 años Minerva a logrado aumentar la gama de productos en su tienda.

Sin embargo sus clientes le han pedido últimamente artículos que ella no posee esto hace que su clientela se vallan con la competencia y por lo tanto no puede adquirir tantos ingresos como ella desearía para poder pagar los gastos de la universidad de su hija. Es por esto que Minerva esta solicitando un crédito de US $750, que esta dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses, con este dinero Minerva podrá comprar mas mercancía como papelería (libretas, lápices, plumas, colores entre otras cosas) y asi poder cumplir su sueño, que su hija termine la Universidad. Con tu ayuda Minerva podrá sacar adelante a su hija.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE ADDITIONAL MERCHANDISE FOR HER SMALL SHOP SO HER COMPETITION DOESN'T TAKE HER CUSTOMERS AWAY,  AND INCREASE HER INCOME SO THAT SHE CAN PAY FOR HER DAUGHTER TO FINISH UNIVERSITY.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa is a single mother who fights hard to give her children a good future. She can't count on the support of the children's father. Realizing she needed to generate more income to cover basic costs for her family, she began selling shoes amongst her friends and neighbors after work. Soon she realized she could earn more money with her own business than with her job. With her savings, she rented a small space and added clothing to the items she sold.

However, Teresa does not have enough merchandise to offer her customers for this season. She is requesting a loan, to be repaid in 4 months, in order to purchase more merchandise and meet the demands of her customers. With your help, she will be able to make her business more stable, and she will have more time to spend with her two children.

Teresa es una mujer que a lucha para sacar a delante a sus 2 hijos a pesar de ser madre soltera y no contar con el apoyo de un hombre en la familia. Consiente de que 2 niños requieren un patrimonio para poder costear los gastos básicos alimenticios y médicos, comenzó a vender zapatos entre sus amistades y vecinos al salir de su trabajo, poco a poco observo que este negocio le dejaba mas dinero que su trabajo en ese entonces fue asi como con unos ahorros rento un pequeño local para que sus clientes pudieran tener un lugar para adquirir alguno de sus productos y tiempo después agrego la venta de ropa a su tienda.

Sin embargo no cuenta con suficiente mercancía que ofrecer para esta temporada es por eso que teresa esta solicitando un crédito de US $250 que esta dispuesta a pagar en un plazo de 4 meses, con este dinero Teresa podrá comprar la mercancía necesaria para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Teresa podrá estabilizar su negocio para asi poder dedicarles mas tiempo a sus 2 hijos y que asi no recientan la falta de su padre.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE MERCHANDISE FOR HER SMALL STORE, BETTER MEET THE REQUESTS OF HER CUSTOMERS, AND CONTINUE TO PROVIDE A BETTER QUALITY OF LIFE FOR HER CHILDREN.

loans.name: Aslam Din

texts.en: Aslam Din lives in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and he lives with his own family. He has a retail shop and he has been engaged in this business for more than 8 years now. He has a lot of good experience and now he wants to further develop his business so he is requesting a small loan to expand his inventory and make a better income to help his family and make a bright future for them.  He is happy  for this opportunity and he would like to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To expand his inventory of grocery products

loans.name: Delia Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita's husband had to go to the United States to look for a beter future for their family. However Margarita's husband took a long time to be able to find a job. It is because of this that in order to pay the daily expenses of her children, she began to sell clothes at a market close to her house in order to make money. And little by little she began to get customers, actually continuing to work in this business since her husband sent her money once a month and on occaision more time would pass between when he would send her money.

Actually Margarita is requesting a loan of US $300 that she is arranged to pay back in a four month term, and with this money Margarita will be able to purchase merchandise in order to have a greater variety in her merchandise. Since the clothing she has in not for winter and her cutomers are looking for winter clothes. With your help Margarita will be able to stay ahead of her children and help her husband to go forward while he looks for a better life for them all.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

El esposo de Margarita se tuvo que ir a Estados Unidos a buscar un mejor futuro para su familia. Sin embargo el esposo de Margarita tardó tiempo para poder conseguir un empleo. Es por eso que para poder pagar los gastos diarios de sus dos hijos, comenzó a vender ropa en un mercado cerca de su casa para poder sacar dinero. Y poco a poco comenzó a hacerse de clientes, actualmente sigue trabajando en este negocio puesto que su esposo le manda dinero cada mes y en ocasiones pasa más tiempo en que le envía dinero.

Actualmente Margarita está solicitando un crédito de US $300 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses y con este dinero Margarita podrá comprar mercancía para poder tener más variedad en su mercancía. Puesto que la ropa que tiene no es de invierno y sus clientes andan buscando ropa para invierno. Con tu ayuda Margarita podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos y ayudar a su esposo a salir adelante por mientras él busca una mejor vida para todos.

loans.use: Purchase winter merchandise - Comprar mercancía

loans.name: Claudia Guadalupe

texts.es:
Claudia Guadalupe dedicates herself to the sale of quilts and shoes, thanks the recommendation of a family member, to be able to help her husband with the household and family expenses since in his work as a laborer they don't pay him enough to pay the expenses of their children. She began selling quilts a little at a time offering them to her neighbors and friends; with referrals she became known in her neighborhood.

However, she actually doesn't have new quilts or eider downs to offer to her customers. It is for this that she is requesting a loan of US $425 that she is set to pay back in a five month term. With this money she will be able to purchase merchandise in order to have a greater variety to offer her customers. With your help Claudia will be able to help her husband to go forward and help her children so that in the future they can study for a career.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Claudia Guadalupe, se dedica a vender colchas y zapatos, gracias a una recomendación que le hizo un familiar, para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su casa y su familia, puesto que en su trabajo como obrero no le pagan suficiente como para pagar los gastos de sus hijos. Comenzó por vender colchas poco a poco ofreciéndole a sus vecinos y a sus amigos, por recomendaciones se fue haciendo conocer en su colonia.

Sin embargo actualmente no tiene colchas ni edredones nuevos para ofrecerle a sus clientes, es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $425 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero poder comprar mercancía nueva para poder tener mayor variedad qué ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda a Claudia podrá ayudar a su esposo a salir adelante y ayudar a sus hijo a que en un futuro estudien una carrera.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise, specifically new quilts - Comprar más productos

loans.name: Ramiro Santiago

texts.es:
Ramiro, unfortunately, became ill in his spinal column, and they needed to operate on it. The business that he had before he had to sell he could no longer attend to it, what is more he needed the money to pay for rehabilitaion and medicines. Thanks to his lust for life and the will that his three children not lack for anything, he began to move forward and thought of a business that would allow him to give money to advance his children. After thinking os it, he bought a machine for making flour tortillas and it was thus that he started. First he sold flour tortillas and little by little he would include other food products such as chile rellenos (stuffed peppers) or dishes for banquets.

Currently demand is increasing, however he finds himself without sufficient resources to make them. It is for this that Ramiro is requesting a loan of US $475 that he is set to repay in a four month term, and with this money he will be able to buy basic materials to make his products. With your help, you will succeed in helping Ramiro to move his business forward so that it can grow little by little and be converted into a legacy for his three children in case something befalls Ramiro.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Ramiro, desafortunadamente se enfermó de la columna, y lo tuvieron que operar, y el negocio que tenía anteriormente lo tuvo que vender porque no podía atenderlo, además de que necesitaba dinero para poder pagar las rehabilitaciones así como las medicinas. Gracias a su entusiasmo por la vida y las ganas de que a sus 3 hijos no les falte nada, comenzó a salir adelante y pensó en un negocio que le pudiera dar dinero para poder sacar a sus hijos adelante. Después de pensarlo, compró una máquina para elaborar tortillas de harina y fue así como comenzó. Primero vendía tortillas de harina y poco a poco fue incluyendo otros productos de comida, como chiles rellenos, o guisos para hacer banquetes.

Actualmente la demanda se le está incrementando, sin embargo no cuenta con recursos suficientes como para poder elaborarlos. Es por eso que Ramiro está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses y con este dinero podrá comprar materia prima para poder elaborar sus productos. Con tu ayuda lograrás que Ramiro saque adelante su negocio para que este pueda crecer poco a poco y se convierta en un patrimonio para sus tres hijos en caso de que algo le llegara a pasar a Ramiro.

loans.use: Purchase basic materials - Comprar materia prima

loans.name: Karla

texts.es:
Karla started working at a food stand selling roasted chickens when she was 14-years-old. At this job, she learned everything she needed to know to make these products. After discovering the financial need they had in their home, Karla decided to start her own business selling chicken when she had saved a little money. Now Karla is well-known and sought after by her clients.

However, her clients are now asking her for more chickens, and this is why she is requesting a loan of $300 that she is willing to repay in 5 months. With this money, she will be able to buy more chickens to expand her production. With this money, she will be able to help her family, especially her mother who needs her because she can no longer work. With your help, Karla will be able to get ahead, take care of her mother, and create something to pass on to her children when she gets married and has her own family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Desde que tenía 14 años Karla trabajó en un puesto de venta de pollos asados, en este trabajo aprendió todo lo necesario para poder elaborar esos productos. Al saber la necesidad que tenían en su casa Karla decidió crear su propio negocio de venta de pollos, después de que ahorró un poco de dinero comenzó a elaborar un local de venta de pollos. Actualmente Karla ya es conocida y buscada por sus clientes.

Sin embargo actualmente le están pidiendo más pollos y por eso Karla está solicitando un crédito de US $300 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Karla podrá comprar redes de pollo para poder ampliar su producción. Y así con este dinero podrá ayudar a su familia, en especial a su mamá que necesita de ella, puesto que ya no puede trabajar. Con tu ayuda Karla podrá salir adelante y sacar adelante a su mamá para así crear un patrimonio para cuando se case y tenga su propia familia.

loans.use: Purchase of chickens

loans.name: Mohammad Ajmal

texts.en: Mohammad Ajmal lives in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is single and he still lives together with his parents. He has a carpet shop. He is a very talented young man who started this business only last year. Still, he has attracted a good number of customers during this one year. Now he wants to further develop his business, so he has requested a small loan to  expand his inventory so as to make a better monthly income to help his family and also to make a better future for himself.

loans.use: To expand his inventory

loans.name: Olga Leticia

texts.es:
For a long time Olga Leticia and her husband, Julián, lived off of his pension. This money was not enough to cover their spending and their household expenses. For this reason Olga started to sell second-hand clothing. During the winter she went to Mexico to buy toys for the season and that is when she realized that toys sold easier than clothing. Little by little she built up a customer base that seeks her out to buy toys.

Her customers are now asking Olga for new products that she does not have to sell. For this reason Olga is requesting a loan of $850 that she is prepared to repay over 6 months. With this money she will be able to stock her store with new toys so that she will have a wider variety of products to offer her clients. With your help Olga will be able to make her business a success and thus gather enough money to cover her and her husband's expenses.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Olga Leticia y su esposo vivían hace tiempo de lo que Julián (su esposo) recibía de la pensión, sin embargo ese dinero no es suficiente como para pagar los gastos de los dos y de su casa. Es por eso que Olga comenzó a vender ropa de segunda, sin embargo en la temporada de invierno se iba a México a comprar juguetes para la temporada de invierno, y fue ahí donde se dio cuenta que los juguetes se venden mejor. Poco a poco se fue haciendo de clientes que la buscan para comprarle los juguetes.

Sin embargo le están pidiendo nuevos productos a Olga que no tiene. Es por eso que Olga está solicitando un crédito de US $850 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder surtir su negocio con juguetes nuevos para poder tener variedad para sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Olga podrá sacar adelante su negocio y así juntar dinero para los gastos de ella y su esposo.

loans.use: To purchase products
